61// Utility functions

63enum Condition {
64 // any value < 0 is considered no_condition
65 no_condition = -1,
66
67 overflow = 0,
68 no_overflow = 1,
69 below = 2,
70 above_equal = 3,
71 equal = 4,
72 not_equal = 5,
73 below_equal = 6,
74 above = 7,
75 negative = 8,
76 positive = 9,
77 parity_even = 10,
78 parity_odd = 11,
79 less = 12,
80 greater_equal = 13,
81 less_equal = 14,
82 greater = 15,
83
84 // Fake conditions that are handled by the
85 // opcodes using them.
86 always = 16,
87 never = 17,
88 // aliases
89 carry = below,
90 not_carry = above_equal,
91 zero = equal,
92 not_zero = not_equal,
93 sign = negative,
94 not_sign = positive,
95 last_condition = greater
96};
97
98// Returns the equivalent of !cc.
99// Negation of the default no_condition (-1) results in a non-default
100// no_condition value (-2). As long as tests for no_condition check
101// for condition < 0, this will work as expected.
102inline Condition NegateCondition(Condition cc) {
103 return static_cast<Condition>(cc ^ 1);
104}
105
106enum RoundingMode {
107 kRoundToNearest = 0x0,
108 kRoundDown = 0x1,
109 kRoundUp = 0x2,
110 kRoundToZero = 0x3
111};
112
113// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
114// Machine instruction Immediates
115
116class Immediate {
117 public:
118 explicit constexpr Immediate(int32_t value) : value_(value) {}
119 explicit constexpr Immediate(int32_t value, RelocInfo::Mode rmode)
120 : value_(value), rmode_(rmode) {}
121 explicit Immediate(Smi value)
122 : value_(static_cast<int32_t>(static_cast<intptr_t>(value.ptr()))) {
123 DCHECK(SmiValuesAre31Bits())((void) 0); // Only available for 31-bit SMI.
124 }
125
126 private:
127 const int32_t value_;
128 const RelocInfo::Mode rmode_ = RelocInfo::NONE;
129
130 friend class Assembler;
131};
132ASSERT_TRIVIALLY_COPYABLE(Immediate)static_assert(::v8::base::is_trivially_copyable<Immediate>
::value, "Immediate" " should be trivially copyable");
133static_assert(sizeof(Immediate) <= kSystemPointerSize,
134 "Immediate must be small enough to pass it by value");
135
136class Immediate64 {
137 public:
138 explicit constexpr Immediate64(int64_t value) : value_(value) {}
139 explicit constexpr Immediate64(int64_t value, RelocInfo::Mode rmode)
140 : value_(value), rmode_(rmode) {}
141 explicit constexpr Immediate64(Address value, RelocInfo::Mode rmode)
142 : value_(static_cast<int64_t>(value)), rmode_(rmode) {}
143
144 private:
145 const int64_t value_;
146 const RelocInfo::Mode rmode_ = RelocInfo::NONE;
147
148 friend class Assembler;
149};

151// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
152// Machine instruction Operands
153
154enum ScaleFactor : int8_t {
155 times_1 = 0,
156 times_2 = 1,
157 times_4 = 2,
158 times_8 = 3,
159 times_int_size = times_4,
160
161 times_half_system_pointer_size = times_4,
162 times_system_pointer_size = times_8,
163 times_tagged_size = (kTaggedSize == 8) ? times_8 : times_4,
164};
165
166class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Operand {
167 public:
168 struct Data {
169 byte rex = 0;
170 byte buf[9];
171 byte len = 1; // number of bytes of buf_ in use.
172 int8_t addend; // for rip + offset + addend.
uninitialized field 'this->data_.addend'
173 };
174
175 // [base + disp/r]
176 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) Operand(Register base, int32_t disp) {
177 if (base == rsp || base == r12) {
178 // SIB byte is needed to encode (rsp + offset) or (r12 + offset).
179 set_sib(times_1, rsp, base);
180 }
181
182 if (disp
1.1
'disp' is not equal to 0
1.1
'disp' is not equal to 0
 == 0 && base != rbp && base != r13) {
183 set_modrm(0, base);
184 } else if (is_int8(disp)) {
2
←
Taking true branch
→
185 set_modrm(1, base);
186 set_disp8(disp);
3
←
1 uninitialized field at the end of the constructor call
187 } else {
188 set_modrm(2, base);
189 set_disp32(disp);
190 }
191 }
192
193 // [base + index*scale + disp/r]
194 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) Operand(Register base, Register index, ScaleFactor scale,
195 int32_t disp) {
196 DCHECK(index != rsp)((void) 0);
197 set_sib(scale, index, base);
198 if (disp == 0 && base != rbp && base != r13) {
199 // This call to set_modrm doesn't overwrite the REX.B (or REX.X) bits
200 // possibly set by set_sib.
201 set_modrm(0, rsp);
202 } else if (is_int8(disp)) {
203 set_modrm(1, rsp);
204 set_disp8(disp);
205 } else {
206 set_modrm(2, rsp);
207 set_disp32(disp);
208 }
209 }
210
211 // [index*scale + disp/r]
212 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) Operand(Register index, ScaleFactor scale, int32_t disp) {
213 DCHECK(index != rsp)((void) 0);
214 set_modrm(0, rsp);
215 set_sib(scale, index, rbp);
216 set_disp32(disp);
217 }
218
219 // Offset from existing memory operand.
220 // Offset is added to existing displacement as 32-bit signed values and
221 // this must not overflow.
222 Operand(Operand base, int32_t offset);
223
224 // [rip + disp/r]
225 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) explicit Operand(Label* label, int addend = 0) {
226 data_.addend = addend;
227 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(label)((void) 0);
228 DCHECK(addend == 0 || (is_int8(addend) && label->is_bound()))((void) 0);
229 set_modrm(0, rbp);
230 set_disp64(reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(label));
231 }
232
233 Operand(const Operand&) V8_NOEXCEPTnoexcept = default;
234
235 const Data& data() const { return data_; }
236
237 // Checks whether either base or index register is the given register.
238 // Does not check the "reg" part of the Operand.
239 bool AddressUsesRegister(Register reg) const;
240
241 private:
242 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void set_modrm(int mod, Register rm_reg) {
243 DCHECK(is_uint2(mod))((void) 0);
244 data_.buf[0] = mod << 6 | rm_reg.low_bits();
245 // Set REX.B to the high bit of rm.code().
246 data_.rex |= rm_reg.high_bit();
247 }
248
249 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void set_sib(ScaleFactor scale, Register index, Register base) {
250 DCHECK_EQ(data_.len, 1)((void) 0);
251 DCHECK(is_uint2(scale))((void) 0);
252 // Use SIB with no index register only for base rsp or r12. Otherwise we
253 // would skip the SIB byte entirely.
254 DCHECK(index != rsp || base == rsp || base == r12)((void) 0);
255 data_.buf[1] = (scale << 6) | (index.low_bits() << 3) | base.low_bits();
256 data_.rex |= index.high_bit() << 1 | base.high_bit();
257 data_.len = 2;
258 }
259
260 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void set_disp8(int disp) {
261 DCHECK(is_int8(disp))((void) 0);
262 DCHECK(data_.len == 1 || data_.len == 2)((void) 0);
263 int8_t* p = reinterpret_cast<int8_t*>(&data_.buf[data_.len]);
264 *p = disp;
265 data_.len += sizeof(int8_t);
266 }
267
268 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void set_disp32(int disp) {
269 DCHECK(data_.len == 1 || data_.len == 2)((void) 0);
270 Address p = reinterpret_cast<Address>(&data_.buf[data_.len]);
271 WriteUnalignedValue(p, disp);
272 data_.len += sizeof(int32_t);
273 }
274
275 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) void set_disp64(int64_t disp) {
276 DCHECK_EQ(1, data_.len)((void) 0);
277 Address p = reinterpret_cast<Address>(&data_.buf[data_.len]);
278 WriteUnalignedValue(p, disp);
279 data_.len += sizeof(disp);
280 }
281
282 Data data_;
283};
284ASSERT_TRIVIALLY_COPYABLE(Operand)static_assert(::v8::base::is_trivially_copyable<Operand>
::value, "Operand" " should be trivially copyable");
285static_assert(sizeof(Operand) <= 2 * kSystemPointerSize,
286 "Operand must be small enough to pass it by value");

288#define ASSEMBLER_INSTRUCTION_LIST(V)V(add) V(and) V(cmp) V(cmpxchg) V(dec) V(idiv) V(div) V(imul)
V(inc) V(lea) V(mov) V(movzxb) V(movzxw) V(not) V(or) V(repmovs
) V(sbb) V(sub) V(test) V(xchg) V(xor) \

290 V(and) \
291 V(cmp) \
292 V(cmpxchg) \

294 V(idiv) \
295 V(div) \
296 V(imul) \
297 V(inc) \
298 V(lea) \
299 V(mov) \
300 V(movzxb) \
301 V(movzxw) \
302 V(not) \
303 V(or) \
304 V(repmovs) \
305 V(sbb) \
306 V(sub) \
307 V(test) \
308 V(xchg) \
309 V(xor)

311// Shift instructions on operands/registers with kInt32Size and kInt64Size.
312#define SHIFT_INSTRUCTION_LIST(V)V(rol, 0x0) V(ror, 0x1) V(rcl, 0x2) V(rcr, 0x3) V(shl, 0x4) V
(shr, 0x5) V(sar, 0x7) \
313 V(rol, 0x0) \
314 V(ror, 0x1) \
315 V(rcl, 0x2) \
316 V(rcr, 0x3) \
317 V(shl, 0x4) \
318 V(shr, 0x5) \
319 V(sar, 0x7)
320
321// Partial Constant Pool
322// Different from complete constant pool (like arm does), partial constant pool
323// only takes effects for shareable constants in order to reduce code size.
324// Partial constant pool does not emit constant pool entries at the end of each
325// code object. Instead, it keeps the first shareable constant inlined in the
326// instructions and uses rip-relative memory loadings for the same constants in
327// subsequent instructions. These rip-relative memory loadings will target at
328// the position of the first inlined constant. For example:
329//
330// REX.W movq r10,0x7f9f75a32c20 ; 10 bytes
331// …
332// REX.W movq r10,0x7f9f75a32c20 ; 10 bytes
333// …
334//
335// turns into
336//
337// REX.W movq r10,0x7f9f75a32c20 ; 10 bytes
338// …
339// REX.W movq r10,[rip+0xffffff96] ; 7 bytes
340// …
341
342class ConstPool {
343 public:
344 explicit ConstPool(Assembler* assm) : assm_(assm) {}
345 // Returns true when partial constant pool is valid for this entry.
346 bool TryRecordEntry(intptr_t data, RelocInfo::Mode mode);
347 bool IsEmpty() const { return entries_.empty(); }
348
349 void PatchEntries();
350 // Discard any pending pool entries.
351 void Clear();
352
353 private:
354 // Adds a shared entry to entries_. Returns true if this is not the first time
355 // we add this entry, false otherwise.
356 bool AddSharedEntry(uint64_t data, int offset);
357
358 // Check if the instruction is a rip-relative move.
359 bool IsMoveRipRelative(Address instr);
360
361 Assembler* assm_;
362
363 // Values, pc offsets of entries.
364 using EntryMap = std::multimap<uint64_t, int>;
365 EntryMap entries_;
366
367 // Number of bytes taken up by the displacement of rip-relative addressing.
368 static constexpr int kRipRelativeDispSize = 4; // 32-bit displacement.
369 // Distance between the address of the displacement in the rip-relative move
370 // instruction and the head address of the instruction.
371 static constexpr int kMoveRipRelativeDispOffset =
372 3; // REX Opcode ModRM Displacement
373 // Distance between the address of the imm64 in the 'movq reg, imm64'
374 // instruction and the head address of the instruction.
375 static constexpr int kMoveImm64Offset = 2; // REX Opcode imm64
376 // A mask for rip-relative move instruction.
377 static constexpr uint32_t kMoveRipRelativeMask = 0x00C7FFFB;
378 // The bits for a rip-relative move instruction after mask.
379 static constexpr uint32_t kMoveRipRelativeInstr = 0x00058B48;
380};
381
382class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Assembler : public AssemblerBase {
383 private:
384 // We check before assembling an instruction that there is sufficient
385 // space to write an instruction and its relocation information.
386 // The relocation writer's position must be kGap bytes above the end of
387 // the generated instructions. This leaves enough space for the
388 // longest possible x64 instruction, 15 bytes, and the longest possible
389 // relocation information encoding, RelocInfoWriter::kMaxLength == 16.
390 // (There is a 15 byte limit on x64 instruction length that rules out some
391 // otherwise valid instructions.)
392 // This allows for a single, fast space check per instruction.
393 static constexpr int kGap = 32;
394 STATIC_ASSERT(AssemblerBase::kMinimalBufferSize >= 2 * kGap)static_assert(AssemblerBase::kMinimalBufferSize >= 2 * kGap
, "AssemblerBase::kMinimalBufferSize >= 2 * kGap");
395
396 public:
397 // Create an assembler. Instructions and relocation information are emitted
398 // into a buffer, with the instructions starting from the beginning and the
399 // relocation information starting from the end of the buffer. See CodeDesc
400 // for a detailed comment on the layout (globals.h).
401 //
402 // If the provided buffer is nullptr, the assembler allocates and grows its
403 // own buffer. Otherwise it takes ownership of the provided buffer.
404 explicit Assembler(const AssemblerOptions&,
405 std::unique_ptr<AssemblerBuffer> = {});
406 ~Assembler() override = default;
407
408 // GetCode emits any pending (non-emitted) code and fills the descriptor desc.
409 static constexpr int kNoHandlerTable = 0;
410 static constexpr SafepointTableBuilder* kNoSafepointTable = nullptr;
411 void GetCode(Isolate* isolate, CodeDesc* desc,
412 SafepointTableBuilder* safepoint_table_builder,
413 int handler_table_offset);
414
415 // Convenience wrapper for code without safepoint or handler tables.
416 void GetCode(Isolate* isolate, CodeDesc* desc) {
417 GetCode(isolate, desc, kNoSafepointTable, kNoHandlerTable);
418 }
419
420 void FinalizeJumpOptimizationInfo();
421
422 // Unused on this architecture.
423 void MaybeEmitOutOfLineConstantPool() {}
424
425 // Read/Modify the code target in the relative branch/call instruction at pc.
426 // On the x64 architecture, we use relative jumps with a 32-bit displacement
427 // to jump to other Code objects in the Code space in the heap.
428 // Jumps to C functions are done indirectly through a 64-bit register holding
429 // the absolute address of the target.
430 // These functions convert between absolute Addresses of Code objects and
431 // the relative displacements stored in the code.
432 // The isolate argument is unused (and may be nullptr) when skipping flushing.
433 static inline Address target_address_at(Address pc, Address constant_pool);
434 static inline void set_target_address_at(
435 Address pc, Address constant_pool, Address target,
436 ICacheFlushMode icache_flush_mode = FLUSH_ICACHE_IF_NEEDED);
437
438 // This sets the branch destination (which is in the instruction on x64).
439 // This is for calls and branches within generated code.
440 inline static void deserialization_set_special_target_at(
441 Address instruction_payload, Code code, Address target);
442
443 // Get the size of the special target encoded at 'instruction_payload'.
444 inline static int deserialization_special_target_size(
445 Address instruction_payload);
446
447 // This sets the internal reference at the pc.
448 inline static void deserialization_set_target_internal_reference_at(
449 Address pc, Address target,
450 RelocInfo::Mode mode = RelocInfo::INTERNAL_REFERENCE);
451
452 inline Handle<Code> code_target_object_handle_at(Address pc);
453 inline Handle<HeapObject> compressed_embedded_object_handle_at(Address pc);
454 inline Address runtime_entry_at(Address pc);
455
456 // Number of bytes taken up by the branch target in the code.
457 static constexpr int kSpecialTargetSize = 4; // 32-bit displacement.
458
459 // One byte opcode for test eax,0xXXXXXXXX.
460 static constexpr byte kTestEaxByte = 0xA9;
461 // One byte opcode for test al, 0xXX.
462 static constexpr byte kTestAlByte = 0xA8;
463 // One byte opcode for nop.
464 static constexpr byte kNopByte = 0x90;
465
466 // One byte prefix for a short conditional jump.
467 static constexpr byte kJccShortPrefix = 0x70;
468 static constexpr byte kJncShortOpcode = kJccShortPrefix | not_carry;
469 static constexpr byte kJcShortOpcode = kJccShortPrefix | carry;
470 static constexpr byte kJnzShortOpcode = kJccShortPrefix | not_zero;
471 static constexpr byte kJzShortOpcode = kJccShortPrefix | zero;
472
473 // VEX prefix encodings.
474 enum SIMDPrefix { kNone = 0x0, k66 = 0x1, kF3 = 0x2, kF2 = 0x3 };
475 enum VectorLength { kL128 = 0x0, kL256 = 0x4, kLIG = kL128, kLZ = kL128 };
476 enum VexW { kW0 = 0x0, kW1 = 0x80, kWIG = kW0 };
477 enum LeadingOpcode { k0F = 0x1, k0F38 = 0x2, k0F3A = 0x3 };
478
479 // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
480 // Code generation
481 //
482 // Function names correspond one-to-one to x64 instruction mnemonics.
483 // Unless specified otherwise, instructions operate on 64-bit operands.
484 //
485 // If we need versions of an assembly instruction that operate on different
486 // width arguments, we add a single-letter suffix specifying the width.
487 // This is done for the following instructions: mov, cmp, inc, dec,
488 // add, sub, and test.
489 // There are no versions of these instructions without the suffix.
490 // - Instructions on 8-bit (byte) operands/registers have a trailing 'b'.
491 // - Instructions on 16-bit (word) operands/registers have a trailing 'w'.
492 // - Instructions on 32-bit (doubleword) operands/registers use 'l'.
493 // - Instructions on 64-bit (quadword) operands/registers use 'q'.
494 // - Instructions on operands/registers with pointer size use 'p'.
495
496#define DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(instruction) \
497 template <class P1> \
498 void instruction##_tagged(P1 p1) { \
499 emit_##instruction(p1, kTaggedSize); \
500 } \
501 \
502 template <class P1> \
503 void instruction##l(P1 p1) { \
504 emit_##instruction(p1, kInt32Size); \
505 } \
506 \
507 template <class P1> \
508 void instruction##q(P1 p1) { \
509 emit_##instruction(p1, kInt64Size); \
510 } \
511 \
512 template <class P1, class P2> \
513 void instruction##_tagged(P1 p1, P2 p2) { \
514 emit_##instruction(p1, p2, kTaggedSize); \
515 } \
516 \
517 template <class P1, class P2> \
518 void instruction##l(P1 p1, P2 p2) { \
519 emit_##instruction(p1, p2, kInt32Size); \
520 } \
521 \
522 template <class P1, class P2> \
523 void instruction##q(P1 p1, P2 p2) { \
524 emit_##instruction(p1, p2, kInt64Size); \
525 } \
526 \
527 template <class P1, class P2, class P3> \
528 void instruction##l(P1 p1, P2 p2, P3 p3) { \
529 emit_##instruction(p1, p2, p3, kInt32Size); \
530 } \
531 \
532 template <class P1, class P2, class P3> \
533 void instruction##q(P1 p1, P2 p2, P3 p3) { \
534 emit_##instruction(p1, p2, p3, kInt64Size); \
535 }
536 ASSEMBLER_INSTRUCTION_LIST(DECLARE_INSTRUCTION)DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(add) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(and) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION
(cmp) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(cmpxchg) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(dec) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION
(idiv) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(div) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(imul) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION
(inc) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(lea) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(mov) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION
(movzxb) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(movzxw) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(not)
DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(or) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(repmovs) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION
(sbb) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(sub) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(test) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION
(xchg) DECLARE_INSTRUCTION(xor)
537#undef DECLARE_INSTRUCTION
538
539 // Insert the smallest number of nop instructions
540 // possible to align the pc offset to a multiple
541 // of m, where m must be a power of 2.
542 void Align(int m);
543 // Insert the smallest number of zero bytes possible to align the pc offset
544 // to a mulitple of m. m must be a power of 2 (>= 2).
545 void DataAlign(int m);
546 void Nop(int bytes = 1);
547 // Aligns code to something that's optimal for a jump target for the platform.
548 void CodeTargetAlign();
549
550 // Stack
551 void pushfq();
552 void popfq();
553
554 void pushq(Immediate value);
555 // Push a 32 bit integer, and guarantee that it is actually pushed as a
556 // 32 bit value, the normal push will optimize the 8 bit case.
557 void pushq_imm32(int32_t imm32);
558 void pushq(Register src);
559 void pushq(Operand src);
560
561 void popq(Register dst);
562 void popq(Operand dst);
563
564 void enter(Immediate size);
565 void leave();
566
567 // Moves
568 void movb(Register dst, Operand src);
569 void movb(Register dst, Immediate imm);
570 void movb(Operand dst, Register src);
571 void movb(Operand dst, Immediate imm);
572
573 // Move the low 16 bits of a 64-bit register value to a 16-bit
574 // memory location.
575 void movw(Register dst, Operand src);
576 void movw(Operand dst, Register src);
577 void movw(Operand dst, Immediate imm);
578
579 // Move the offset of the label location relative to the current
580 // position (after the move) to the destination.
581 void movl(Operand dst, Label* src);
582
583 // Load a heap number into a register.
584 // The heap number will not be allocated and embedded into the code right
585 // away. Instead, we emit the load of a dummy object. Later, when calling
586 // Assembler::GetCode, the heap number will be allocated and the code will be
587 // patched by replacing the dummy with the actual object. The RelocInfo for
588 // the embedded object gets already recorded correctly when emitting the dummy
589 // move.
590 void movq_heap_number(Register dst, double value);
591
592 void movq_string(Register dst, const StringConstantBase* str);
593
594 // Loads a 64-bit immediate into a register, potentially using the constant
595 // pool.
596 void movq(Register dst, int64_t value) { movq(dst, Immediate64(value)); }
597 void movq(Register dst, uint64_t value) {
598 movq(dst, Immediate64(static_cast<int64_t>(value)));
599 }
600
601 // Loads a 64-bit immediate into a register without using the constant pool.
602 void movq_imm64(Register dst, int64_t value);
603
604 void movsxbl(Register dst, Register src);
605 void movsxbl(Register dst, Operand src);
606 void movsxbq(Register dst, Register src);
607 void movsxbq(Register dst, Operand src);
608 void movsxwl(Register dst, Register src);
609 void movsxwl(Register dst, Operand src);
610 void movsxwq(Register dst, Register src);
611 void movsxwq(Register dst, Operand src);
612 void movsxlq(Register dst, Register src);
613 void movsxlq(Register dst, Operand src);
614
615 // Repeated moves.
616 void repmovsb();
617 void repmovsw();
618 void repmovsl() { emit_repmovs(kInt32Size); }
619 void repmovsq() { emit_repmovs(kInt64Size); }
620
621 // Repeated store of doublewords (fill (E)CX bytes at ES:[(E)DI] with EAX).
622 void repstosl();
623 // Repeated store of quadwords (fill RCX quadwords at [RDI] with RAX).
624 void repstosq();
625
626 // Instruction to load from an immediate 64-bit pointer into RAX.
627 void load_rax(Address value, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
628 void load_rax(ExternalReference ext);
629
630 // Conditional moves.
631 void cmovq(Condition cc, Register dst, Register src);
632 void cmovq(Condition cc, Register dst, Operand src);
633 void cmovl(Condition cc, Register dst, Register src);
634 void cmovl(Condition cc, Register dst, Operand src);
635
636 void cmpb(Register dst, Immediate src) {
637 immediate_arithmetic_op_8(0x7, dst, src);
638 }
639
640 void cmpb_al(Immediate src);
641
642 void cmpb(Register dst, Register src) { arithmetic_op_8(0x3A, dst, src); }
643
644 void cmpb(Register dst, Operand src) { arithmetic_op_8(0x3A, dst, src); }
645
646 void cmpb(Operand dst, Register src) { arithmetic_op_8(0x38, src, dst); }
647
648 void cmpb(Operand dst, Immediate src) {
649 immediate_arithmetic_op_8(0x7, dst, src);
650 }
651
652 void cmpw(Operand dst, Immediate src) {
653 immediate_arithmetic_op_16(0x7, dst, src);
654 }
655
656 void cmpw(Register dst, Immediate src) {
657 immediate_arithmetic_op_16(0x7, dst, src);
658 }
659
660 void cmpw(Register dst, Operand src) { arithmetic_op_16(0x3B, dst, src); }
661
662 void cmpw(Register dst, Register src) { arithmetic_op_16(0x3B, dst, src); }
663
664 void cmpw(Operand dst, Register src) { arithmetic_op_16(0x39, src, dst); }
665
666 void testb(Register reg, Operand op) { testb(op, reg); }
667
668 void testw(Register reg, Operand op) { testw(op, reg); }
669
670 void andb(Register dst, Immediate src) {
671 immediate_arithmetic_op_8(0x4, dst, src);
672 }
673
674 void decb(Register dst);
675 void decb(Operand dst);
676
677 // Lock prefix.
678 void lock();
679
680 void xchgb(Register reg, Operand op);
681 void xchgw(Register reg, Operand op);
682
683 void xaddb(Operand dst, Register src);
684 void xaddw(Operand dst, Register src);
685 void xaddl(Operand dst, Register src);
686 void xaddq(Operand dst, Register src);
687
688 void negb(Register reg);
689 void negw(Register reg);
690 void negl(Register reg);
691 void negq(Register reg);
692 void negb(Operand op);
693 void negw(Operand op);
694 void negl(Operand op);
695 void negq(Operand op);
696
697 void cmpxchgb(Operand dst, Register src);
698 void cmpxchgw(Operand dst, Register src);
699
700 // Sign-extends rax into rdx:rax.
701 void cqo();
702 // Sign-extends eax into edx:eax.
703 void cdq();
704
705 // Multiply eax by src, put the result in edx:eax.
706 void mull(Register src);
707 void mull(Operand src);
708 // Multiply rax by src, put the result in rdx:rax.
709 void mulq(Register src);
710
711#define DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION(instruction, subcode) \
712 void instruction##l(Register dst, Immediate imm8) { \
713 shift(dst, imm8, subcode, kInt32Size); \
714 } \
715 \
716 void instruction##q(Register dst, Immediate imm8) { \
717 shift(dst, imm8, subcode, kInt64Size); \
718 } \
719 \
720 void instruction##l(Operand dst, Immediate imm8) { \
721 shift(dst, imm8, subcode, kInt32Size); \
722 } \
723 \
724 void instruction##q(Operand dst, Immediate imm8) { \
725 shift(dst, imm8, subcode, kInt64Size); \
726 } \
727 \
728 void instruction##l_cl(Register dst) { shift(dst, subcode, kInt32Size); } \
729 \
730 void instruction##q_cl(Register dst) { shift(dst, subcode, kInt64Size); } \
731 \
732 void instruction##l_cl(Operand dst) { shift(dst, subcode, kInt32Size); } \
733 \
734 void instruction##q_cl(Operand dst) { shift(dst, subcode, kInt64Size); }
735 SHIFT_INSTRUCTION_LIST(DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION)DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION(rol, 0x0) DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION
(ror, 0x1) DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION(rcl, 0x2) DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION
(rcr, 0x3) DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION(shl, 0x4) DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION
(shr, 0x5) DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION(sar, 0x7)
736#undef DECLARE_SHIFT_INSTRUCTION
737
738 // Shifts dst:src left by cl bits, affecting only dst.
739 void shld(Register dst, Register src);
740
741 // Shifts src:dst right by cl bits, affecting only dst.
742 void shrd(Register dst, Register src);
743
744 void store_rax(Address dst, RelocInfo::Mode mode);
745 void store_rax(ExternalReference ref);
746
747 void subb(Register dst, Immediate src) {
748 immediate_arithmetic_op_8(0x5, dst, src);
749 }
750
751 void sub_sp_32(uint32_t imm);
752
753 void testb(Register dst, Register src);
754 void testb(Register reg, Immediate mask);
755 void testb(Operand op, Immediate mask);
756 void testb(Operand op, Register reg);
757
758 void testw(Register dst, Register src);
759 void testw(Register reg, Immediate mask);
760 void testw(Operand op, Immediate mask);
761 void testw(Operand op, Register reg);

764 void bswapl(Register dst);
765 void bswapq(Register dst);
766 void btq(Operand dst, Register src);
767 void btsq(Operand dst, Register src);
768 void btsq(Register dst, Immediate imm8);
769 void btrq(Register dst, Immediate imm8);
770 void bsrq(Register dst, Register src);
771 void bsrq(Register dst, Operand src);
772 void bsrl(Register dst, Register src);
773 void bsrl(Register dst, Operand src);

775 void bsfq(Register dst, Operand src);

779 // Miscellaneous
780 void clc();
781 void cld();
782 void cpuid();
783 void hlt();
784 void int3();
785 void nop();
786 void ret(int imm16);
787 void ud2();
788 void setcc(Condition cc, Register reg);
789
790 void pblendw(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, uint8_t mask);
791 void pblendw(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t mask);
792 void palignr(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, uint8_t mask);
793 void palignr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t mask);
794
795 // Label operations & relative jumps (PPUM Appendix D)
796 //
797 // Takes a branch opcode (cc) and a label (L) and generates
798 // either a backward branch or a forward branch and links it
799 // to the label fixup chain. Usage:
800 //
801 // Label L; // unbound label
802 // j(cc, &L); // forward branch to unbound label
803 // bind(&L); // bind label to the current pc
804 // j(cc, &L); // backward branch to bound label
805 // bind(&L); // illegal: a label may be bound only once
806 //
807 // Note: The same Label can be used for forward and backward branches
808 // but it may be bound only once.
809
810 void bind(Label* L); // binds an unbound label L to the current code position
811
812 // Calls
813 // Call near relative 32-bit displacement, relative to next instruction.
814 void call(Label* L);
815 void call(Address entry, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
816
817 // Explicitly emit a near call / near jump. The displacement is relative to
818 // the next instructions (which starts at {pc_offset() + kNearJmpInstrSize}).
819 static constexpr int kNearJmpInstrSize = 5;
820 void near_call(intptr_t disp, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
821 void near_jmp(intptr_t disp, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
822
823 void call(Handle<Code> target,
824 RelocInfo::Mode rmode = RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
825
826 // Call near absolute indirect, address in register
827 void call(Register adr);
828
829 // Jumps
830 // Jump short or near relative.
831 // Use a 32-bit signed displacement.
832 // Unconditional jump to L
833 void jmp(Label* L, Label::Distance distance = Label::kFar);
834 void jmp(Handle<Code> target, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
835
836 // Jump near absolute indirect (r64)
837 void jmp(Register adr);
838 void jmp(Operand src);
839
840 // Unconditional jump relative to the current address. Low-level routine,
841 // use with caution!
842 void jmp_rel(int offset);
843
844 // Conditional jumps
845 void j(Condition cc, Label* L, Label::Distance distance = Label::kFar);
846 void j(Condition cc, Address entry, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
847 void j(Condition cc, Handle<Code> target, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
848

850 void fld(int i);

853 void fldz();
854 void fldpi();
855 void fldln2();

861 void fstp_d(Operand adr);

873 void fisttp_d(Operand adr);

924 // Don't use this unless it's important to keep the
925 // top half of the destination register unchanged.
926 // Use movaps when moving float values and movd for integer
927 // values in xmm registers.
928 void movss(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src);
929
930 void movss(XMMRegister dst, Operand src);
931 void movss(Operand dst, XMMRegister src);
932 void shufps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, byte imm8);

935 void cvttss2si(Register dst, XMMRegister src);
936 void cvtlsi2ss(XMMRegister dst, Operand src);
937 void cvtlsi2ss(XMMRegister dst, Register src);

940
941 void vinstr(byte op, XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2,
942 SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m, VexW w);
943 void vinstr(byte op, XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2,
944 SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m, VexW w);
945
946 // SSE instructions
947 void sse_instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, byte escape, byte opcode);
948 void sse_instr(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, byte escape, byte opcode);
949#define DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION(instruction, escape, opcode) \
950 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { \
951 sse_instr(dst, src, 0x##escape, 0x##opcode); \
952 } \
953 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { \
954 sse_instr(dst, src, 0x##escape, 0x##opcode); \
955 }
956
957 SSE_UNOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST(DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION)DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION(sqrtps, 0F, 51) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION
(rsqrtps, 0F, 52) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION(rcpps, 0F, 53) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION
(cvtdq2ps, 0F, 5B)
958 SSE_BINOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST(DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION)DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION(andps, 0F, 54) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION
(andnps, 0F, 55) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION(orps, 0F, 56) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION
(xorps, 0F, 57) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION(addps, 0F, 58) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION
(mulps, 0F, 59) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION(subps, 0F, 5C) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION
(minps, 0F, 5D) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION(divps, 0F, 5E) DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION
(maxps, 0F, 5F)
959#undef DECLARE_SSE_INSTRUCTION
960
961 // SSE instructions with prefix and SSE2 instructions
962 void sse2_instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, byte prefix, byte escape,
963 byte opcode);
964 void sse2_instr(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, byte prefix, byte escape,
965 byte opcode);
966#define DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(instruction, prefix, escape, opcode) \
967 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { \
968 sse2_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape, 0x##opcode); \
969 } \
970 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { \
971 sse2_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape, 0x##opcode); \
972 }
973
974 // These SSE instructions have the same encoding as the SSE2 instructions.
975 SSE_INSTRUCTION_LIST_SS(DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION)DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(sqrtss, F3, 0F, 51) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION
(addss, F3, 0F, 58) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(mulss, F3, 0F, 59
) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(subss, F3, 0F, 5C) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION
(minss, F3, 0F, 5D) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(divss, F3, 0F, 5E
) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(maxss, F3, 0F, 5F)

(psubq, 66, 0F, FB) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(psubsb, 66, 0F, E8

(psubusb, 66, 0F, D8) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(psubusw, 66, 0F
, D9) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(pand, 66, 0F, DB) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION
(por, 66, 0F, EB) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(pxor, 66, 0F, EF)
977 SSE2_INSTRUCTION_LIST_SD(DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION)DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(sqrtsd, F2, 0F, 51) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION
(addsd, F2, 0F, 58) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(mulsd, F2, 0F, 59
) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(cvtsd2ss, F2, 0F, 5A) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION
(subsd, F2, 0F, 5C) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(minsd, F2, 0F, 5D
) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(divsd, F2, 0F, 5E) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION
(maxsd, F2, 0F, 5F)
978 SSE2_UNOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST(DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION)DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION(sqrtpd, 66, 0F, 51) DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION
(cvtps2dq, 66, 0F, 5B)
979#undef DECLARE_SSE2_INSTRUCTION
980
981 void sse2_instr(XMMRegister reg, byte imm8, byte prefix, byte escape,
982 byte opcode, int extension) {
983 XMMRegister ext_reg = XMMRegister::from_code(extension);
984 sse2_instr(ext_reg, reg, prefix, escape, opcode);
985 emit(imm8);
986 }
987
988#define DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(instruction, prefix, escape, opcode, extension) \
989 void instruction(XMMRegister reg, byte imm8) { \
990 sse2_instr(reg, imm8, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape, 0x##opcode, 0x##extension); \
991 }
992 SSE2_INSTRUCTION_LIST_SHIFT_IMM(DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM)DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psrlw, 66, 0F, 71, 2) DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM
(psrld, 66, 0F, 72, 2) DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psrlq, 66, 0F, 73
, 2) DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psraw, 66, 0F, 71, 4) DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM
(psrad, 66, 0F, 72, 4) DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psllw, 66, 0F, 71
, 6) DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(pslld, 66, 0F, 72, 6) DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM
(psllq, 66, 0F, 73, 6)
993#undef DECLARE_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM
994
995#define DECLARE_SSE2_AVX_INSTRUCTION(instruction, prefix, escape, opcode) \
996 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) { \
997 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2, k##prefix, k##escape, kW0); \
998 } \
999 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) { \
1000 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2, k##prefix, k##escape, kW0); \
1001 }
1002

1005
1006#define DECLARE_SSE2_UNOP_AVX_INSTRUCTION(instruction, prefix, escape, opcode) \
1007 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { \
1008 vpd(0x##opcode, dst, xmm0, src); \
1009 } \
1010 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { \
1011 vpd(0x##opcode, dst, xmm0, src); \
1012 }

1026 byte escape2, byte opcode);

1029 opcode) \
1030 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { \
1031 ssse3_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape1, 0x##escape2, 0x##opcode); \
1032 } \
1033 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { \
1034 ssse3_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape1, 0x##escape2, 0x##opcode); \
1035 }

1041 // SSE4
1042 void sse4_instr(Register dst, XMMRegister src, byte prefix, byte escape1,
1043 byte escape2, byte opcode, int8_t imm8);
1044 void sse4_instr(Operand dst, XMMRegister src, byte prefix, byte escape1,
1045 byte escape2, byte opcode, int8_t imm8);
1046 void sse4_instr(XMMRegister dst, Register src, byte prefix, byte escape1,
1047 byte escape2, byte opcode, int8_t imm8);
1048 void sse4_instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, byte prefix, byte escape1,
1049 byte escape2, byte opcode);
1050 void sse4_instr(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, byte prefix, byte escape1,
1051 byte escape2, byte opcode);
1052#define DECLARE_SSE4_INSTRUCTION(instruction, prefix, escape1, escape2, \
1053 opcode) \
1054 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { \
1055 sse4_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape1, 0x##escape2, 0x##opcode); \
1056 } \
1057 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { \
1058 sse4_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape1, 0x##escape2, 0x##opcode); \
1059 }
1060

1066#define DECLARE_SSE4_EXTRACT_INSTRUCTION(instruction, prefix, escape1, \
1067 escape2, opcode) \
1068 void instruction(Register dst, XMMRegister src, int8_t imm8) { \
1069 sse4_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape1, 0x##escape2, 0x##opcode, \
1070 imm8); \
1071 } \
1072 void instruction(Operand dst, XMMRegister src, int8_t imm8) { \
1073 sse4_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape1, 0x##escape2, 0x##opcode, \
1074 imm8); \
1075 }

1084 byte escape2, byte opcode);

1086 opcode) \
1087 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { \
1088 sse4_2_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape1, 0x##escape2, 0x##opcode); \
1089 } \
1090 void instruction(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { \
1091 sse4_2_instr(dst, src, 0x##prefix, 0x##escape1, 0x##escape2, 0x##opcode); \
1092 }

1098 opcode) \
1099 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) { \
1100 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2, k##prefix, k##escape1##escape2, kW0); \
1101 } \
1102 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) { \
1103 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2, k##prefix, k##escape1##escape2, kW0); \
1104 }

1112 escape2, opcode) \
1113 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { \
1114 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, xmm0, src, k##prefix, k##escape1##escape2, kW0); \
1115 } \
1116 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { \
1117 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, xmm0, src, k##prefix, k##escape1##escape2, kW0); \
1118 }

1122
1123 void vblendvpd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2,
1124 XMMRegister mask) {
1125 vinstr(0x4B, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1126 // The mask operand is encoded in bits[7:4] of the immediate byte.
1127 emit(mask.code() << 4);
1128 }
1129
1130#define DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION(instruction, prefix, escape1, \
1131 escape2, opcode) \
1132 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { \
1133 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, xmm0, src, k##prefix, k##escape1##escape2, kW0); \
1134 } \
1135 void v##instruction(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { \
1136 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, xmm0, src, k##prefix, k##escape1##escape2, kW0); \
1137 }
1138 SSE4_UNOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST(DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION)DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION(ptest, 66, 0F, 38, 17) DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION
(pmovsxbw, 66, 0F, 38, 20) DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION(
pmovsxwd, 66, 0F, 38, 23) DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION(pmovsxdq
, 66, 0F, 38, 25) DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION(pmovzxbw,
66, 0F, 38, 30) DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION(pmovzxwd, 66
, 0F, 38, 33) DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION(pmovzxdq, 66,
0F, 38, 35)
1139#undef DECLARE_SSE4_PMOV_AVX_INSTRUCTION

1148
1149 // Don't use this unless it's important to keep the
1150 // top half of the destination register unchanged.
1151 // Use movapd when moving double values and movq for integer
1152 // values in xmm registers.
1153 void movsd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src);
1154

1209 void pinsrw(XMMRegister dst, Register src, int8_t imm8);
1210 void pinsrw(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, int8_t imm8);
1211 void pinsrd(XMMRegister dst, Register src, int8_t imm8);
1212 void pinsrd(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, int8_t imm8);
1213 void pinsrq(XMMRegister dst, Register src, int8_t imm8);
1214 void pinsrq(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, int8_t imm8);
1215
1216 void roundss(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, RoundingMode mode);
1217 void roundsd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, RoundingMode mode);
1218 void roundps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, RoundingMode mode);
1219 void roundpd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, RoundingMode mode);
1220
1221 void cmpps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, int8_t cmp);
1222 void cmpps(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, int8_t cmp);
1223 void cmppd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, int8_t cmp);
1224 void cmppd(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, int8_t cmp);
1225
1226#define SSE_CMP_P(instr, imm8) \
1227 void instr##ps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { cmpps(dst, src, imm8); } \
1228 void instr##ps(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { cmpps(dst, src, imm8); } \
1229 void instr##pd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { cmppd(dst, src, imm8); } \
1230 void instr##pd(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { cmppd(dst, src, imm8); }
1231
1232 SSE_CMP_P(cmpeq, 0x0)
1233 SSE_CMP_P(cmplt, 0x1)
1234 SSE_CMP_P(cmple, 0x2)
1235 SSE_CMP_P(cmpneq, 0x4)
1236 SSE_CMP_P(cmpnlt, 0x5)
1237 SSE_CMP_P(cmpnle, 0x6)
1238
1239#undef SSE_CMP_P

1242 void movups(XMMRegister dst, Operand src);

1248 void pshufhw(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, uint8_t shuffle);

1252 void movlhps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) {
1253 sse_instr(dst, src, 0x0F, 0x16);
1254 }

1260
1261 void fma_instr(byte op, XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2,
1262 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m, VexW w);
1263 void fma_instr(byte op, XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2,
1264 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m, VexW w);
1265
1266#define FMA(instr, length, prefix, escape1, escape2, extension, opcode) \
1267 void instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) { \
1268 fma_instr(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2, k##length, k##prefix, \
1269 k##escape1##escape2, k##extension); \
1270 } \
1271 void instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) { \
1272 fma_instr(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2, k##length, k##prefix, \
1273 k##escape1##escape2, k##extension); \
1274 }
1275 FMA_INSTRUCTION_LIST(FMA)FMA(vfmadd132sd, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, 99) FMA(vfmadd213sd, L128
, 66, 0F, 38, W1, a9) FMA(vfmadd231sd, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, b9
) FMA(vfmsub132sd, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, 9b) FMA(vfmsub213sd,
L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, ab) FMA(vfmsub231sd, L128, 66, 0F, 38,
W1, bb) FMA(vfnmadd132sd, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, 9d) FMA(vfnmadd213sd
, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, ad) FMA(vfnmadd231sd, L128, 66, 0F, 38
, W1, bd) FMA(vfnmsub132sd, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, 9f) FMA(vfnmsub213sd
, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, af) FMA(vfnmsub231sd, L128, 66, 0F, 38
, W1, bf) FMA(vfmadd132ss, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0, 99) FMA(vfmadd213ss
, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0, a9) FMA(vfmadd231ss, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0
, b9) FMA(vfmsub132ss, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0, 9b) FMA(vfmsub213ss
, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0, ab) FMA(vfmsub231ss, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0
, bb) FMA(vfnmadd132ss, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0, 9d) FMA(vfnmadd213ss
, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0, ad) FMA(vfnmadd231ss, LIG, 66, 0F, 38,
W0, bd) FMA(vfnmsub132ss, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0, 9f) FMA(vfnmsub213ss
, LIG, 66, 0F, 38, W0, af) FMA(vfnmsub231ss, LIG, 66, 0F, 38,
W0, bf) FMA(vfmadd231ps, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W0, b8) FMA(vfnmadd231ps
, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W0, bc) FMA(vfmadd231pd, L128, 66, 0F, 38
, W1, b8) FMA(vfnmadd231pd, L128, 66, 0F, 38, W1, bc)
1276#undef FMA

1285 void vmovsd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) {
1286 vsd(0x10, dst, src1, src2);
1287 }
1288 void vmovsd(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { vsd(0x10, dst, xmm0, src); }
1289 void vmovsd(Operand dst, XMMRegister src) { vsd(0x11, src, xmm0, dst); }

1291 void vmovdqu(Operand dst, XMMRegister src);

1293#define AVX_SSE_UNOP(instr, escape, opcode) \
1294 void v##instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src2) { \
1295 vps(0x##opcode, dst, xmm0, src2); \
1296 } \
1297 void v##instr(XMMRegister dst, Operand src2) { \
1298 vps(0x##opcode, dst, xmm0, src2); \
1299 }
1300 SSE_UNOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST(AVX_SSE_UNOP)AVX_SSE_UNOP(sqrtps, 0F, 51) AVX_SSE_UNOP(rsqrtps, 0F, 52) AVX_SSE_UNOP
(rcpps, 0F, 53) AVX_SSE_UNOP(cvtdq2ps, 0F, 5B)
1301#undef AVX_SSE_UNOP
1302
1303#define AVX_SSE_BINOP(instr, escape, opcode) \
1304 void v##instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) { \
1305 vps(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2); \
1306 } \
1307 void v##instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) { \
1308 vps(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2); \
1309 }
1310 SSE_BINOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST(AVX_SSE_BINOP)AVX_SSE_BINOP(andps, 0F, 54) AVX_SSE_BINOP(andnps, 0F, 55) AVX_SSE_BINOP
(orps, 0F, 56) AVX_SSE_BINOP(xorps, 0F, 57) AVX_SSE_BINOP(addps
, 0F, 58) AVX_SSE_BINOP(mulps, 0F, 59) AVX_SSE_BINOP(subps, 0F
, 5C) AVX_SSE_BINOP(minps, 0F, 5D) AVX_SSE_BINOP(divps, 0F, 5E
) AVX_SSE_BINOP(maxps, 0F, 5F)
1311#undef AVX_SSE_BINOP
1312
1313#define AVX_3(instr, opcode, impl) \
1314 void instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) { \
1315 impl(opcode, dst, src1, src2); \
1316 } \
1317 void instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) { \
1318 impl(opcode, dst, src1, src2); \
1319 }
1320
1321 AVX_3(vhaddps, 0x7c, vsd)
1322
1323#define AVX_SCALAR(instr, prefix, escape, opcode) \
1324 void v##instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) { \
1325 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2, k##prefix, k##escape, kWIG); \
1326 } \
1327 void v##instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) { \
1328 vinstr(0x##opcode, dst, src1, src2, k##prefix, k##escape, kWIG); \
1329 }
1330 SSE_INSTRUCTION_LIST_SS(AVX_SCALAR)AVX_SCALAR(sqrtss, F3, 0F, 51) AVX_SCALAR(addss, F3, 0F, 58) AVX_SCALAR
(mulss, F3, 0F, 59) AVX_SCALAR(subss, F3, 0F, 5C) AVX_SCALAR(
minss, F3, 0F, 5D) AVX_SCALAR(divss, F3, 0F, 5E) AVX_SCALAR(maxss
, F3, 0F, 5F)
1331 SSE2_INSTRUCTION_LIST_SD(AVX_SCALAR)AVX_SCALAR(sqrtsd, F2, 0F, 51) AVX_SCALAR(addsd, F2, 0F, 58) AVX_SCALAR
(mulsd, F2, 0F, 59) AVX_SCALAR(cvtsd2ss, F2, 0F, 5A) AVX_SCALAR
(subsd, F2, 0F, 5C) AVX_SCALAR(minsd, F2, 0F, 5D) AVX_SCALAR(
divsd, F2, 0F, 5E) AVX_SCALAR(maxsd, F2, 0F, 5F)
1332#undef AVX_SCALAR
1333
1334#undef AVX_3
1335
1336#define AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(instr, prefix, escape, opcode, extension) \
1337 void v##instr(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, byte imm8) { \
1338 XMMRegister ext_reg = XMMRegister::from_code(extension); \
1339 vinstr(0x##opcode, ext_reg, dst, src, k##prefix, k##escape, kWIG); \
1340 emit(imm8); \
1341 }
1342 SSE2_INSTRUCTION_LIST_SHIFT_IMM(AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM)AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psrlw, 66, 0F, 71, 2) AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psrld
, 66, 0F, 72, 2) AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psrlq, 66, 0F, 73, 2) AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM
(psraw, 66, 0F, 71, 4) AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psrad, 66, 0F, 72, 4
) AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psllw, 66, 0F, 71, 6) AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM
(pslld, 66, 0F, 72, 6) AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM(psllq, 66, 0F, 73, 6
)
1343#undef AVX_SSE2_SHIFT_IMM

1421 void vucomisd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) {
1422 vinstr(0x2e, dst, xmm0, src, k66, k0F, kWIG);

1427 void vroundss(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2,
1428 RoundingMode mode) {
1429 vinstr(0x0a, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1430 emit(static_cast<byte>(mode) | 0x8); // Mask precision exception.
1431 }
1432 void vroundsd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2,
1433 RoundingMode mode) {
1434 vinstr(0x0b, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1435 emit(static_cast<byte>(mode) | 0x8); // Mask precision exception.
1436 }
1437 void vroundps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, RoundingMode mode) {
1438 vinstr(0x08, dst, xmm0, src, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1439 emit(static_cast<byte>(mode) | 0x8); // Mask precision exception.
1440 }
1441 void vroundpd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, RoundingMode mode) {
1442 vinstr(0x09, dst, xmm0, src, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1443 emit(static_cast<byte>(mode) | 0x8); // Mask precision exception.
1444 }

1446 void vsd(byte op, XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) {
1447 vinstr(op, dst, src1, src2, kF2, k0F, kWIG);
1448 }
1449 void vsd(byte op, XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) {
1450 vinstr(op, dst, src1, src2, kF2, k0F, kWIG);
1451 }

1457 void vmovss(Operand dst, XMMRegister src) { vss(0x11, src, xmm0, dst); }

1468 void vmovups(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { vps(0x10, dst, xmm0, src); }
1469 void vmovups(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { vps(0x10, dst, xmm0, src); }
1470 void vmovups(Operand dst, XMMRegister src) { vps(0x11, src, xmm0, dst); }
1471 void vmovapd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src) { vpd(0x28, dst, xmm0, src); }
1472 void vmovupd(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) { vpd(0x10, dst, xmm0, src); }
1473 void vmovupd(Operand dst, XMMRegister src) { vpd(0x11, src, xmm0, dst); }

1482 void vpmovmskb(Register dst, XMMRegister src);
1483 void vcmpps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2, int8_t cmp) {
1484 vps(0xC2, dst, src1, src2);
1485 emit(cmp);
1486 }
1487 void vcmpps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2, int8_t cmp) {
1488 vps(0xC2, dst, src1, src2);
1489 emit(cmp);
1490 }
1491 void vcmppd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2, int8_t cmp) {
1492 vpd(0xC2, dst, src1, src2);
1493 emit(cmp);
1494 }
1495 void vcmppd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2, int8_t cmp) {
1496 vpd(0xC2, dst, src1, src2);
1497 emit(cmp);
1498 }
1499
1500#define AVX_CMP_P(instr, imm8) \
1501 void instr##ps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) { \
1502 vcmpps(dst, src1, src2, imm8); \
1503 } \
1504 void instr##ps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) { \
1505 vcmpps(dst, src1, src2, imm8); \
1506 } \
1507 void instr##pd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2) { \
1508 vcmppd(dst, src1, src2, imm8); \
1509 } \
1510 void instr##pd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2) { \
1511 vcmppd(dst, src1, src2, imm8); \
1512 }
1513
1514 AVX_CMP_P(vcmpeq, 0x0)
1515 AVX_CMP_P(vcmplt, 0x1)
1516 AVX_CMP_P(vcmple, 0x2)
1517 AVX_CMP_P(vcmpneq, 0x4)
1518 AVX_CMP_P(vcmpnlt, 0x5)
1519 AVX_CMP_P(vcmpnle, 0x6)
1520
1521#undef AVX_CMP_P

1523 void vlddqu(XMMRegister dst, Operand src) {
1524 vinstr(0xF0, dst, xmm0, src, kF2, k0F, kWIG);
1525 }
1526 void vinsertps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, XMMRegister src2,
1527 byte imm8) {
1528 vinstr(0x21, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1529 emit(imm8);
1530 }
1531 void vinsertps(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2, byte imm8) {
1532 vinstr(0x21, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1533 emit(imm8);
1534 }
1535 void vextractps(Register dst, XMMRegister src, int8_t imm8) {
1536 XMMRegister idst = XMMRegister::from_code(dst.code());
1537 vinstr(0x17, src, xmm0, idst, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1538 emit(imm8);
1539 }
1540 void vpextrb(Register dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8) {
1541 XMMRegister idst = XMMRegister::from_code(dst.code());
1542 vinstr(0x14, src, xmm0, idst, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1543 emit(imm8);
1544 }
1545 void vpextrb(Operand dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8) {
1546 vinstr(0x14, src, xmm0, dst, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1547 emit(imm8);
1548 }
1549 void vpextrw(Register dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8) {
1550 XMMRegister idst = XMMRegister::from_code(dst.code());
1551 vinstr(0xc5, idst, xmm0, src, k66, k0F, kW0);
1552 emit(imm8);
1553 }
1554 void vpextrw(Operand dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8) {
1555 vinstr(0x15, src, xmm0, dst, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1556 emit(imm8);
1557 }
1558 void vpextrd(Register dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8) {
1559 XMMRegister idst = XMMRegister::from_code(dst.code());
1560 vinstr(0x16, src, xmm0, idst, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1561 emit(imm8);
1562 }
1563 void vpextrd(Operand dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8) {
1564 vinstr(0x16, src, xmm0, dst, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1565 emit(imm8);
1566 }
1567 void vpextrq(Register dst, XMMRegister src, int8_t imm8) {
1568 XMMRegister idst = XMMRegister::from_code(dst.code());
1569 vinstr(0x16, src, xmm0, idst, k66, k0F3A, kW1);
1570 emit(imm8);
1571 }
1572 void vpinsrb(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Register src2, uint8_t imm8) {
1573 XMMRegister isrc = XMMRegister::from_code(src2.code());
1574 vinstr(0x20, dst, src1, isrc, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1575 emit(imm8);
1576 }
1577 void vpinsrb(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2, uint8_t imm8) {
1578 vinstr(0x20, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1579 emit(imm8);
1580 }
1581 void vpinsrw(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Register src2, uint8_t imm8) {
1582 XMMRegister isrc = XMMRegister::from_code(src2.code());
1583 vinstr(0xc4, dst, src1, isrc, k66, k0F, kW0);
1584 emit(imm8);
1585 }
1586 void vpinsrw(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2, uint8_t imm8) {
1587 vinstr(0xc4, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F, kW0);
1588 emit(imm8);
1589 }
1590 void vpinsrd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Register src2, uint8_t imm8) {
1591 XMMRegister isrc = XMMRegister::from_code(src2.code());
1592 vinstr(0x22, dst, src1, isrc, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1593 emit(imm8);
1594 }
1595 void vpinsrd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2, uint8_t imm8) {
1596 vinstr(0x22, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kW0);
1597 emit(imm8);
1598 }
1599 void vpinsrq(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Register src2, int8_t imm8) {
1600 XMMRegister isrc = XMMRegister::from_code(src2.code());
1601 vinstr(0x22, dst, src1, isrc, k66, k0F3A, kW1);
1602 emit(imm8);
1603 }
1604 void vpinsrq(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2, int8_t imm8) {
1605 vinstr(0x22, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kW1);
1606 emit(imm8);
1607 }
1608
1609 void vpshufd(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8) {
1610 vinstr(0x70, dst, xmm0, src, k66, k0F, kWIG);
1611 emit(imm8);
1612 }
1613 void vpshufd(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, uint8_t imm8) {
1614 vinstr(0x70, dst, xmm0, src, k66, k0F, kWIG);
1615 emit(imm8);
1616 }

1618 vinstr(0x70, dst, xmm0, src, kF2, k0F, kWIG);
1619 emit(imm8);
1620 }
1621 void vpshuflw(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, uint8_t imm8) {
1622 vinstr(0x70, dst, xmm0, src, kF2, k0F, kWIG);
1623 emit(imm8);
1624 }
1625 void vpshufhw(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src, uint8_t imm8) {
1626 vinstr(0x70, dst, xmm0, src, kF3, k0F, kWIG);
1627 emit(imm8);
1628 }
1629 void vpshufhw(XMMRegister dst, Operand src, uint8_t imm8) {
1630 vinstr(0x70, dst, xmm0, src, kF2, k0F, kWIG);
1631 emit(imm8);
1632 }
1633

1635 uint8_t mask) {
1636 vinstr(0x0E, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1637 emit(mask);
1638 }
1639 void vpblendw(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src1, Operand src2, uint8_t mask) {
1640 vinstr(0x0E, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1641 emit(mask);

1643

1647 emit(imm8);
1648 }

1650 vinstr(0x0F, dst, src1, src2, k66, k0F3A, kWIG);
1651 emit(imm8);
1652 }

1661 // BMI instruction
1662 void andnq(Register dst, Register src1, Register src2) {
1663 bmi1q(0xf2, dst, src1, src2);
1664 }

1666 bmi1q(0xf2, dst, src1, src2);
1667 }

1669 bmi1l(0xf2, dst, src1, src2);
1670 }

1672 bmi1l(0xf2, dst, src1, src2);
1673 }
1674 void bextrq(Register dst, Register src1, Register src2) {
1675 bmi1q(0xf7, dst, src2, src1);
1676 }
1677 void bextrq(Register dst, Operand src1, Register src2) {
1678 bmi1q(0xf7, dst, src2, src1);
1679 }

1681 bmi1l(0xf7, dst, src2, src1);
1682 }

1684 bmi1l(0xf7, dst, src2, src1);
1685 }
1686 void blsiq(Register dst, Register src) { bmi1q(0xf3, rbx, dst, src); }
1687 void blsiq(Register dst, Operand src) { bmi1q(0xf3, rbx, dst, src); }
1688 void blsil(Register dst, Register src) { bmi1l(0xf3, rbx, dst, src); }
1689 void blsil(Register dst, Operand src) { bmi1l(0xf3, rbx, dst, src); }
1690 void blsmskq(Register dst, Register src) { bmi1q(0xf3, rdx, dst, src); }
1691 void blsmskq(Register dst, Operand src) { bmi1q(0xf3, rdx, dst, src); }
1692 void blsmskl(Register dst, Register src) { bmi1l(0xf3, rdx, dst, src); }
1693 void blsmskl(Register dst, Operand src) { bmi1l(0xf3, rdx, dst, src); }
1694 void blsrq(Register dst, Register src) { bmi1q(0xf3, rcx, dst, src); }
1695 void blsrq(Register dst, Operand src) { bmi1q(0xf3, rcx, dst, src); }
1696 void blsrl(Register dst, Register src) { bmi1l(0xf3, rcx, dst, src); }
1697 void blsrl(Register dst, Operand src) { bmi1l(0xf3, rcx, dst, src); }
1698 void tzcntq(Register dst, Register src);

1700 void tzcntl(Register dst, Register src);

1713 void bzhiq(Register dst, Register src1, Register src2) {
1714 bmi2q(kNone, 0xf5, dst, src2, src1);
1715 }

1717 bmi2q(kNone, 0xf5, dst, src2, src1);
1718 }
1719 void bzhil(Register dst, Register src1, Register src2) {
1720 bmi2l(kNone, 0xf5, dst, src2, src1);
1721 }
1722 void bzhil(Register dst, Operand src1, Register src2) {
1723 bmi2l(kNone, 0xf5, dst, src2, src1);
1724 }
1725 void mulxq(Register dst1, Register dst2, Register src) {
1726 bmi2q(kF2, 0xf6, dst1, dst2, src);
1727 }
1728 void mulxq(Register dst1, Register dst2, Operand src) {
1729 bmi2q(kF2, 0xf6, dst1, dst2, src);
1730 }
1731 void mulxl(Register dst1, Register dst2, Register src) {
1732 bmi2l(kF2, 0xf6, dst1, dst2, src);
1733 }
1734 void mulxl(Register dst1, Register dst2, Operand src) {
1735 bmi2l(kF2, 0xf6, dst1, dst2, src);
1736 }
1737 void pdepq(Register dst, Register src1, Register src2) {
1738 bmi2q(kF2, 0xf5, dst, src1, src2);
1739 }
1740 void pdepq(Register dst, Register src1, Operand src2) {
1741 bmi2q(kF2, 0xf5, dst, src1, src2);
1742 }

1744 bmi2l(kF2, 0xf5, dst, src1, src2);
1745 }

1747 bmi2l(kF2, 0xf5, dst, src1, src2);
1748 }
1749 void pextq(Register dst, Register src1, Register src2) {

1759 bmi2l(kF3, 0xf5, dst, src1, src2);

1761 void sarxq(Register dst, Register src1, Register src2) {

1763 }

1765 bmi2q(kF3, 0xf7, dst, src2, src1);

1771 bmi2l(kF3, 0xf7, dst, src2, src1);
1772 }
1773 void shlxq(Register dst, Register src1, Register src2) {
1774 bmi2q(k66, 0xf7, dst, src2, src1);

1780 bmi2l(k66, 0xf7, dst, src2, src1);

1783 bmi2l(k66, 0xf7, dst, src2, src1);

1797 void rorxq(Register dst, Register src, byte imm8);

1800 void rorxl(Register dst, Operand src, byte imm8);
1801
1802 void mfence();
1803 void lfence();
1804 void pause();
1805
1806 // Check the code size generated from label to here.
1807 int SizeOfCodeGeneratedSince(Label* label) {
1808 return pc_offset() - label->pos();
1809 }
1810
1811 // Record a deoptimization reason that can be used by a log or cpu profiler.
1812 // Use --trace-deopt to enable.
1813 void RecordDeoptReason(DeoptimizeReason reason, SourcePosition position,
1814 int id);
1815
1816 // Writes a single word of data in the code stream.
1817 // Used for inline tables, e.g., jump-tables.
1818 void db(uint8_t data);
1819 void dd(uint32_t data);
1820 void dq(uint64_t data);
1821 void dp(uintptr_t data) { dq(data); }
1822 void dq(Label* label);
1823
1824 // Patch entries for partial constant pool.
1825 void PatchConstPool();
1826
1827 // Check if use partial constant pool for this rmode.
1828 static bool UseConstPoolFor(RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
1829
1830 // Check if there is less than kGap bytes available in the buffer.
1831 // If this is the case, we need to grow the buffer before emitting
1832 // an instruction or relocation information.
1833 inline bool buffer_overflow() const {
1834 return pc_ >= reloc_info_writer.pos() - kGap;
1835 }
1836
1837 // Get the number of bytes available in the buffer.
1838 inline int available_space() const {
1839 return static_cast<int>(reloc_info_writer.pos() - pc_);
1840 }
1841
1842 static bool IsNop(Address addr);
1843
1844 // Avoid overflows for displacements etc.
1845 static constexpr int kMaximalBufferSize = 512 * MB;
1846
1847 byte byte_at(int pos) { return buffer_start_[pos]; }
1848 void set_byte_at(int pos, byte value) { buffer_start_[pos] = value; }
1849
1850#if defined(V8_OS_WIN_X64)
1851 win64_unwindinfo::BuiltinUnwindInfo GetUnwindInfo() const;
1852#endif
1853
1854 protected:
1855 // Call near indirect
1856 void call(Operand operand);
1857
1858 private:
1859 Address addr_at(int pos) {
1860 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start_ + pos);
1861 }
1862 uint32_t long_at(int pos) {
1863 return ReadUnalignedValue<uint32_t>(addr_at(pos));
1864 }
1865 void long_at_put(int pos, uint32_t x) {
1866 WriteUnalignedValue(addr_at(pos), x);
1867 }
1868
1869 // code emission
1870 void GrowBuffer();
1871
1872 void emit(byte x) { *pc_++ = x; }
1873 inline void emitl(uint32_t x);
1874 inline void emitq(uint64_t x);
1875 inline void emitw(uint16_t x);
1876 inline void emit_runtime_entry(Address entry, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
1877 inline void emit(Immediate x);
1878 inline void emit(Immediate64 x);
1879
1880 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1881 // the top bit of both register codes.
1882 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1883 // REX.W is set.
1884 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, Register rm_reg);
1885 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, XMMRegister rm_reg);
1886 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1887 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister rm_reg);
1888
1889 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1890 // the top bit of the destination, index, and base register codes.
1891 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1892 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1893 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is set.
1894 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, Operand op);
1895 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, Operand op);
1896
1897 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1898 // the top bit of the register code.
1899 // The high bit of register is used for REX.B.
1900 // REX.W is set and REX.R and REX.X are clear.
1901 inline void emit_rex_64(Register rm_reg);
1902
1903 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1904 // the top bit of the index and base register codes.
1905 // The high bit of op's base register is used for REX.B, and the high
1906 // bit of op's index register is used for REX.X.
1907 // REX.W is set and REX.R clear.
1908 inline void emit_rex_64(Operand op);
1909
1910 // Emit a REX prefix that only sets REX.W to choose a 64-bit operand size.
1911 void emit_rex_64() { emit(0x48); }
1912
1913 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1914 // REX.W is clear.
1915 inline void emit_rex_32(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1916
1917 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1918 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1919 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is cleared.
1920 inline void emit_rex_32(Register reg, Operand op);
1921
1922 // High bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1923 // REX.W, REX.R and REX.X are clear.
1924 inline void emit_rex_32(Register rm_reg);
1925
1926 // High bit of base goes to REX.B and high bit of index to REX.X.
1927 // REX.W and REX.R are clear.
1928 inline void emit_rex_32(Operand op);
1929
1930 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1931 // REX.W is cleared. If no REX bits are set, no byte is emitted.
1932 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1933
1934 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1935 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1936 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is cleared. If no REX bits are set, nothing
1937 // is emitted.
1938 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, Operand op);
1939
1940 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1941 // the registers are XMM registers.
1942 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister base);
1943
1944 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1945 // one of the registers is an XMM registers.
1946 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, Register base);
1947
1948 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1949 // one of the registers is an XMM registers.
1950 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, XMMRegister base);
1951
1952 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Operand), except that
1953 // the register is an XMM register.
1954 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, Operand op);
1955
1956 // Optionally do as emit_rex_32(Register) if the register number has
1957 // the high bit set.
1958 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register rm_reg);
1959 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister rm_reg);
1960
1961 // Optionally do as emit_rex_32(Operand) if the operand register
1962 // numbers have a high bit set.
1963 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Operand op);
1964
1965 // Calls emit_rex_32(Register) for all non-byte registers.
1966 inline void emit_optional_rex_8(Register reg);
1967
1968 // Calls emit_rex_32(Register, Operand) for all non-byte registers, and
1969 // emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Operand) for byte registers.
1970 inline void emit_optional_rex_8(Register reg, Operand op);
1971
1972 void emit_rex(int size) {
1973 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1974 emit_rex_64();
1975 } else {
1976 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1977 }
1978 }
1979
1980 template <class P1>
1981 void emit_rex(P1 p1, int size) {
1982 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1983 emit_rex_64(p1);
1984 } else {
1985 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1986 emit_optional_rex_32(p1);
1987 }
1988 }
1989
1990 template <class P1, class P2>
1991 void emit_rex(P1 p1, P2 p2, int size) {
1992 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1993 emit_rex_64(p1, p2);
1994 } else {
1995 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1996 emit_optional_rex_32(p1, p2);
1997 }
1998 }
1999
2000 // Emit vex prefix
2001 void emit_vex2_byte0() { emit(0xc5); }
2002 inline void emit_vex2_byte1(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, VectorLength l,
2003 SIMDPrefix pp);
2004 void emit_vex3_byte0() { emit(0xc4); }
2005 inline void emit_vex3_byte1(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister rm, LeadingOpcode m);
2006 inline void emit_vex3_byte1(XMMRegister reg, Operand rm, LeadingOpcode m);
2007 inline void emit_vex3_byte2(VexW w, XMMRegister v, VectorLength l,
2008 SIMDPrefix pp);
2009 inline void emit_vex_prefix(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, XMMRegister rm,
2010 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2011 VexW w);
2012 inline void emit_vex_prefix(Register reg, Register v, Register rm,
2013 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2014 VexW w);
2015 inline void emit_vex_prefix(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, Operand rm,
2016 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2017 VexW w);
2018 inline void emit_vex_prefix(Register reg, Register v, Operand rm,
2019 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2020 VexW w);
2021
2022 // Emit the ModR/M byte, and optionally the SIB byte and
2023 // 1- or 4-byte offset for a memory operand. Also encodes
2024 // the second operand of the operation, a register or operation
2025 // subcode, into the reg field of the ModR/M byte.
2026 void emit_operand(Register reg, Operand adr) {
2027 emit_operand(reg.low_bits(), adr);
2028 }
2029
2030 // Emit the ModR/M byte, and optionally the SIB byte and
2031 // 1- or 4-byte offset for a memory operand. Also used to encode
2032 // a three-bit opcode extension into the ModR/M byte.
2033 void emit_operand(int rm, Operand adr);
2034
2035 // Emit a ModR/M byte with registers coded in the reg and rm_reg fields.
2036 void emit_modrm(Register reg, Register rm_reg) {
2037 emit(0xC0 | reg.low_bits() << 3 | rm_reg.low_bits());
2038 }
2039
2040 // Emit a ModR/M byte with an operation subcode in the reg field and
2041 // a register in the rm_reg field.
2042 void emit_modrm(int code, Register rm_reg) {
2043 DCHECK(is_uint3(code))((void) 0);
2044 emit(0xC0 | code << 3 | rm_reg.low_bits());
2045 }
2046
2047 // Emit the code-object-relative offset of the label's position
2048 inline void emit_code_relative_offset(Label* label);
2049
2050 // The first argument is the reg field, the second argument is the r/m field.
2051 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src);
2052 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister reg, Operand adr);
2053 void emit_sse_operand(Register reg, Operand adr);
2054 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst, Register src);
2055 void emit_sse_operand(Register dst, XMMRegister src);
2056 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst);
2057
2058 // Emit machine code for one of the operations ADD, ADC, SUB, SBC,
2059 // AND, OR, XOR, or CMP. The encodings of these operations are all
2060 // similar, differing just in the opcode or in the reg field of the
2061 // ModR/M byte.
2062 void arithmetic_op_8(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg);
2063 void arithmetic_op_8(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg);
2064 void arithmetic_op_16(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg);
2065 void arithmetic_op_16(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg);
2066 // Operate on operands/registers with pointer size, 32-bit or 64-bit size.
2067 void arithmetic_op(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg, int size);
2068 void arithmetic_op(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg, int size);
2069 // Operate on a byte in memory or register.
2070 void immediate_arithmetic_op_8(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src);
2071 void immediate_arithmetic_op_8(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src);
2072 // Operate on a word in memory or register.
2073 void immediate_arithmetic_op_16(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src);
2074 void immediate_arithmetic_op_16(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src);
2075 // Operate on operands/registers with pointer size, 32-bit or 64-bit size.
2076 void immediate_arithmetic_op(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src,
2077 int size);
2078 void immediate_arithmetic_op(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src,
2079 int size);
2080
2081 // Emit machine code for a shift operation.
2082 void shift(Operand dst, Immediate shift_amount, int subcode, int size);
2083 void shift(Register dst, Immediate shift_amount, int subcode, int size);
2084 // Shift dst by cl % 64 bits.
2085 void shift(Register dst, int subcode, int size);
2086 void shift(Operand dst, int subcode, int size);
2087
2088 void emit_farith(int b1, int b2, int i);
2089
2090 // labels
2091 // void print(Label* L);
2092 void bind_to(Label* L, int pos);
2093
2094 // record reloc info for current pc_
2095 void RecordRelocInfo(RelocInfo::Mode rmode, intptr_t data = 0);
2096
2097 // Arithmetics
2098 void emit_add(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2099 arithmetic_op(0x03, dst, src, size);
2100 }
2101
2102 void emit_add(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2103 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x0, dst, src, size);
2104 }
2105
2106 void emit_add(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2107 arithmetic_op(0x03, dst, src, size);
2108 }
2109
2110 void emit_add(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2111 arithmetic_op(0x1, src, dst, size);
2112 }
2113
2114 void emit_add(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2115 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x0, dst, src, size);
2116 }
2117
2118 void emit_and(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2119 arithmetic_op(0x23, dst, src, size);
2120 }
2121
2122 void emit_and(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2123 arithmetic_op(0x23, dst, src, size);
2124 }
2125
2126 void emit_and(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2127 arithmetic_op(0x21, src, dst, size);
2128 }
2129
2130 void emit_and(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2131 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x4, dst, src, size);
2132 }
2133
2134 void emit_and(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2135 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x4, dst, src, size);
2136 }
2137
2138 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2139 arithmetic_op(0x3B, dst, src, size);
2140 }
2141
2142 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2143 arithmetic_op(0x3B, dst, src, size);
2144 }
2145
2146 void emit_cmp(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2147 arithmetic_op(0x39, src, dst, size);
2148 }
2149
2150 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2151 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x7, dst, src, size);
2152 }
2153
2154 void emit_cmp(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2155 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x7, dst, src, size);
2156 }
2157
2158 // Compare {al,ax,eax,rax} with src. If equal, set ZF and write dst into
2159 // src. Otherwise clear ZF and write src into {al,ax,eax,rax}. This
2160 // operation is only atomic if prefixed by the lock instruction.
2161 void emit_cmpxchg(Operand dst, Register src, int size);
2162
2163 void emit_dec(Register dst, int size);
2164 void emit_dec(Operand dst, int size);
2165
2166 // Divide rdx:rax by src. Quotient in rax, remainder in rdx when size is 64.
2167 // Divide edx:eax by lower 32 bits of src. Quotient in eax, remainder in edx
2168 // when size is 32.
2169 void emit_idiv(Register src, int size);
2170 void emit_div(Register src, int size);
2171
2172 // Signed multiply instructions.
2173 // rdx:rax = rax * src when size is 64 or edx:eax = eax * src when size is 32.
2174 void emit_imul(Register src, int size);
2175 void emit_imul(Operand src, int size);
2176 void emit_imul(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2177 void emit_imul(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2178 void emit_imul(Register dst, Register src, Immediate imm, int size);
2179 void emit_imul(Register dst, Operand src, Immediate imm, int size);
2180
2181 void emit_inc(Register dst, int size);
2182 void emit_inc(Operand dst, int size);
2183
2184 void emit_lea(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2185
2186 void emit_mov(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2187 void emit_mov(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2188 void emit_mov(Operand dst, Register src, int size);
2189 void emit_mov(Register dst, Immediate value, int size);
2190 void emit_mov(Operand dst, Immediate value, int size);
2191 void emit_mov(Register dst, Immediate64 value, int size);
2192
2193 void emit_movzxb(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2194 void emit_movzxb(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2195 void emit_movzxw(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2196 void emit_movzxw(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2197
2198 void emit_neg(Register dst, int size);
2199 void emit_neg(Operand dst, int size);
2200
2201 void emit_not(Register dst, int size);
2202 void emit_not(Operand dst, int size);
2203
2204 void emit_or(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2205 arithmetic_op(0x0B, dst, src, size);
2206 }
2207
2208 void emit_or(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2209 arithmetic_op(0x0B, dst, src, size);
2210 }
2211
2212 void emit_or(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2213 arithmetic_op(0x9, src, dst, size);
2214 }
2215
2216 void emit_or(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2217 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x1, dst, src, size);
2218 }
2219
2220 void emit_or(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2221 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x1, dst, src, size);
2222 }
2223
2224 void emit_repmovs(int size);
2225
2226 void emit_sbb(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2227 arithmetic_op(0x1b, dst, src, size);
2228 }
2229
2230 void emit_sub(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2231 arithmetic_op(0x2B, dst, src, size);
2232 }
2233
2234 void emit_sub(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2235 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x5, dst, src, size);
2236 }
2237
2238 void emit_sub(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2239 arithmetic_op(0x2B, dst, src, size);
2240 }
2241
2242 void emit_sub(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2243 arithmetic_op(0x29, src, dst, size);
2244 }
2245
2246 void emit_sub(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2247 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x5, dst, src, size);
2248 }
2249
2250 void emit_test(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2251 void emit_test(Register reg, Immediate mask, int size);
2252 void emit_test(Operand op, Register reg, int size);
2253 void emit_test(Operand op, Immediate mask, int size);
2254 void emit_test(Register reg, Operand op, int size) {
2255 return emit_test(op, reg, size);
2256 }
2257
2258 void emit_xchg(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2259 void emit_xchg(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2260
2261 void emit_xor(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2262 if (size == kInt64Size && dst.code() == src.code()) {
2263 // 32 bit operations zero the top 32 bits of 64 bit registers. Therefore
2264 // there is no need to make this a 64 bit operation.
2265 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, kInt32Size);
2266 } else {
2267 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, size);
2268 }
2269 }
2270
2271 void emit_xor(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2272 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, size);
2273 }
2274
2275 void emit_xor(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2276 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x6, dst, src, size);
2277 }
2278
2279 void emit_xor(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2280 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x6, dst, src, size);
2281 }
2282
2283 void emit_xor(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2284 arithmetic_op(0x31, src, dst, size);
2285 }
2286
2287 // Most BMI instructions are similar.
2288 void bmi1q(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2289 void bmi1q(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2290 void bmi1l(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2291 void bmi1l(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2292 void bmi2q(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2293 void bmi2q(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2294 void bmi2l(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2295 void bmi2l(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2296
2297 // record the position of jmp/jcc instruction
2298 void record_farjmp_position(Label* L, int pos);
2299
2300 bool is_optimizable_farjmp(int idx);
2301
2302 void AllocateAndInstallRequestedHeapObjects(Isolate* isolate);
2303
2304 int WriteCodeComments();
2305
2306 friend class EnsureSpace;
2307 friend class RegExpMacroAssemblerX64;
2308
2309 // code generation
2310 RelocInfoWriter reloc_info_writer;
2311
2312 // Internal reference positions, required for (potential) patching in
2313 // GrowBuffer(); contains only those internal references whose labels
2314 // are already bound.
2315 std::deque<int> internal_reference_positions_;
2316
2317 // Variables for this instance of assembler
2318 int farjmp_num_ = 0;
2319 std::deque<int> farjmp_positions_;
2320 std::map<Label*, std::vector<int>> label_farjmp_maps_;
2321
2322 ConstPool constpool_;
2323
2324 friend class ConstPool;
2325
2326#if defined(V8_OS_WIN_X64)
2327 std::unique_ptr<win64_unwindinfo::XdataEncoder> xdata_encoder_;
2328#endif
2329};
2330
2331// Helper class that ensures that there is enough space for generating
2332// instructions and relocation information. The constructor makes
2333// sure that there is enough space and (in debug mode) the destructor
2334// checks that we did not generate too much.
2335class EnsureSpace {
2336 public:
2337 explicit EnsureSpace(Assembler* assembler) : assembler_(assembler) {
2338 if (assembler_->buffer_overflow()) assembler_->GrowBuffer();
2339#ifdef DEBUG
2340 space_before_ = assembler_->available_space();
2341#endif
2342 }
2343
2344#ifdef DEBUG
2345 ~EnsureSpace() {
2346 int bytes_generated = space_before_ - assembler_->available_space();
2347 DCHECK(bytes_generated < assembler_->kGap)((void) 0);
2348 }
2349#endif
2350
2351 private:
2352 Assembler* assembler_;
2353#ifdef DEBUG
2354 int space_before_;
2355#endif
2356};
2357
2358} // namespace internal
2359} // namespace v8
2360
2361#endif // V8_CODEGEN_X64_ASSEMBLER_X64_H_

33namespace v8 {
34namespace internal {
35
36#define __ ACCESS_MASM(masm)masm->
37
38void Builtins::Generate_Adaptor(MacroAssembler* masm, Address address) {
39 __ LoadAddress(kJavaScriptCallExtraArg1Register,
40 ExternalReference::Create(address));
41 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), AdaptorWithBuiltinExitFrame)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kAdaptorWithBuiltinExitFrame),
42 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
43}
44
45static void GenerateTailCallToReturnedCode(MacroAssembler* masm,
46 Runtime::FunctionId function_id) {
47 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
48 // -- rdx : new target (preserved for callee)
49 // -- rdi : target function (preserved for callee)
50 // -----------------------------------
51 {
52 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
53 // Push a copy of the target function and the new target.
54 __ Push(rdi);
55 __ Push(rdx);
56 // Function is also the parameter to the runtime call.
57 __ Push(rdi);
58
59 __ CallRuntime(function_id, 1);
60 __ movq(rcx, rax);
61
62 // Restore target function and new target.
63 __ Pop(rdx);
64 __ Pop(rdi);
65 }
66 static_assert(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister == rcx, "ABI mismatch");
67 __ JumpCodeObject(rcx);
68}
69
70namespace {
71
