72enum StackLimitKind { kInterruptStackLimit, kRealStackLimit };
73
74Operand StackLimitAsOperand(MacroAssembler* masm, StackLimitKind kind) {
75 DCHECK(masm->root_array_available())((void) 0);
76 Isolate* isolate = masm->isolate();
77 ExternalReference limit =
78 kind == StackLimitKind::kRealStackLimit
79 ? ExternalReference::address_of_real_jslimit(isolate)
80 : ExternalReference::address_of_jslimit(isolate);
81 DCHECK(TurboAssembler::IsAddressableThroughRootRegister(isolate, limit))((void) 0);
82
83 intptr_t offset =
84 TurboAssembler::RootRegisterOffsetForExternalReference(isolate, limit);
85 CHECK(is_int32(offset))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(is_int32(offset))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "is_int32(offset)"); } } while (false);
86 return Operand(kRootRegister, static_cast<int32_t>(offset));
87}
88
89void Generate_StackOverflowCheck(
90 MacroAssembler* masm, Register num_args, Register scratch,
91 Label* stack_overflow,
92 Label::Distance stack_overflow_distance = Label::kFar) {
93 // Check the stack for overflow. We are not trying to catch
94 // interruptions (e.g. debug break and preemption) here, so the "real stack
95 // limit" is checked.
96 __ movq(kScratchRegister,
97 StackLimitAsOperand(masm, StackLimitKind::kRealStackLimit));
98 __ movq(scratch, rsp);
99 // Make scratch the space we have left. The stack might already be overflowed
100 // here which will cause scratch to become negative.
101 __ subq(scratch, kScratchRegister);
102 __ sarq(scratch, Immediate(kSystemPointerSizeLog2));
103 // Check if the arguments will overflow the stack.
104 __ cmpq(scratch, num_args);
105 // Signed comparison.
106 __ j(less_equal, stack_overflow, stack_overflow_distance);
107}
108
109void Generate_JSBuiltinsConstructStubHelper(MacroAssembler* masm) {
110 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
111 // -- rax: number of arguments
112 // -- rdi: constructor function
113 // -- rdx: new target
114 // -- rsi: context
115 // -----------------------------------
116
117 Label stack_overflow;
118 Generate_StackOverflowCheck(masm, rax, rcx, &stack_overflow, Label::kFar);
119
120 // Enter a construct frame.
121 {
122 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::CONSTRUCT);
123
124 // Preserve the incoming parameters on the stack.
125 __ SmiTag(rcx, rax);
126 __ Push(rsi);
127 __ Push(rcx);
128
129#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
130 // Set up pointer to first argument (skip receiver).
131 __ leaq(rbx, Operand(rbp, StandardFrameConstants::kCallerSPOffset +
132 kSystemPointerSize));
133 // Copy arguments to the expression stack.
134 __ PushArray(rbx, rax, rcx);
135 // The receiver for the builtin/api call.
136 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kTheHoleValue);
137#else
138 // The receiver for the builtin/api call.
139 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kTheHoleValue);
140 // Set up pointer to last argument.
141 __ leaq(rbx, Operand(rbp, StandardFrameConstants::kCallerSPOffset));
142 // Copy arguments to the expression stack.
143 __ PushArray(rbx, rax, rcx);
144#endif
145
146 // Call the function.
147 // rax: number of arguments (untagged)
148 // rdi: constructor function
149 // rdx: new target
150 __ InvokeFunction(rdi, rdx, rax, CALL_FUNCTION);
151
152 // Restore context from the frame.
153 __ movq(rsi, Operand(rbp, ConstructFrameConstants::kContextOffset));
154 // Restore smi-tagged arguments count from the frame.
155 __ movq(rbx, Operand(rbp, ConstructFrameConstants::kLengthOffset));
156
157 // Leave construct frame.
158 }
159
160 // Remove caller arguments from the stack and return.
161 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
162 SmiIndex index = masm->SmiToIndex(rbx, rbx, kSystemPointerSizeLog2);
163 __ leaq(rsp, Operand(rsp, index.reg, index.scale, 1 * kSystemPointerSize));
164 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rcx);
165
166 __ ret(0);
167
168 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
169 {
170 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
171 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
172 __ int3(); // This should be unreachable.
173 }
174}
175
176} // namespace
177
178// The construct stub for ES5 constructor functions and ES6 class constructors.
179void Builtins::Generate_JSConstructStubGeneric(MacroAssembler* masm) {
180 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
181 // -- rax: number of arguments (untagged)
182 // -- rdi: constructor function
183 // -- rdx: new target
184 // -- rsi: context
185 // -- sp[...]: constructor arguments
186 // -----------------------------------
187
188 // Enter a construct frame.
189 {
190 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::CONSTRUCT);
191 Label post_instantiation_deopt_entry, not_create_implicit_receiver;
192
193 // Preserve the incoming parameters on the stack.
194 __ SmiTag(rcx, rax);
195 __ Push(rsi);
196 __ Push(rcx);
197 __ Push(rdi);
198 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kTheHoleValue);
199 __ Push(rdx);
200
201 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
202 // -- sp[0*kSystemPointerSize]: new target
203 // -- sp[1*kSystemPointerSize]: padding
204 // -- rdi and sp[2*kSystemPointerSize]: constructor function
205 // -- sp[3*kSystemPointerSize]: argument count
206 // -- sp[4*kSystemPointerSize]: context
207 // -----------------------------------
208
209 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
210 rbx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
211 __ movl(rbx, FieldOperand(rbx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFlagsOffset));
212 __ DecodeField<SharedFunctionInfo::FunctionKindBits>(rbx);
213 __ JumpIfIsInRange(rbx, kDefaultDerivedConstructor, kDerivedConstructor,
214 &not_create_implicit_receiver, Label::kNear);
215
216 // If not derived class constructor: Allocate the new receiver object.
217 __ IncrementCounter(masm->isolate()->counters()->constructed_objects(), 1);
218 __ Call(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), FastNewObject)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kFastNewObject),
219 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
220 __ jmp(&post_instantiation_deopt_entry, Label::kNear);
221
222 // Else: use TheHoleValue as receiver for constructor call
223 __ bind(&not_create_implicit_receiver);
224 __ LoadRoot(rax, RootIndex::kTheHoleValue);
225
226 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
227 // -- rax implicit receiver
228 // -- Slot 4 / sp[0*kSystemPointerSize] new target
229 // -- Slot 3 / sp[1*kSystemPointerSize] padding
230 // -- Slot 2 / sp[2*kSystemPointerSize] constructor function
231 // -- Slot 1 / sp[3*kSystemPointerSize] number of arguments (tagged)
232 // -- Slot 0 / sp[4*kSystemPointerSize] context
233 // -----------------------------------
234 // Deoptimizer enters here.
235 masm->isolate()->heap()->SetConstructStubCreateDeoptPCOffset(
236 masm->pc_offset());
237 __ bind(&post_instantiation_deopt_entry);
238
239 // Restore new target.
240 __ Pop(rdx);
241
242 // Push the allocated receiver to the stack.
243 __ Push(rax);
244
245#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
246 // We need two copies because we may have to return the original one
247 // and the calling conventions dictate that the called function pops the
248 // receiver. The second copy is pushed after the arguments, we saved in r8
249 // since rax needs to store the number of arguments before
250 // InvokingFunction.
251 __ movq(r8, rax);
252
253 // Set up pointer to first argument (skip receiver).
254 __ leaq(rbx, Operand(rbp, StandardFrameConstants::kCallerSPOffset +
255 kSystemPointerSize));
256#else
257 // We need two copies because we may have to return the original one
258 // and the calling conventions dictate that the called function pops the
259 // receiver.
260 __ Push(rax);
261
262 // Set up pointer to last argument.
263 __ leaq(rbx, Operand(rbp, StandardFrameConstants::kCallerSPOffset));
264#endif
265
266 // Restore constructor function and argument count.
267 __ movq(rdi, Operand(rbp, ConstructFrameConstants::kConstructorOffset));
268 __ SmiUntag(rax, Operand(rbp, ConstructFrameConstants::kLengthOffset));
269
270 // Check if we have enough stack space to push all arguments.
271 // Argument count in rax. Clobbers rcx.
272 Label enough_stack_space, stack_overflow;
273 Generate_StackOverflowCheck(masm, rax, rcx, &stack_overflow, Label::kNear);
274 __ jmp(&enough_stack_space, Label::kNear);
275
276 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
277 // Restore context from the frame.
278 __ movq(rsi, Operand(rbp, ConstructFrameConstants::kContextOffset));
279 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
280 // This should be unreachable.
281 __ int3();
282
283 __ bind(&enough_stack_space);
284
285 // Copy arguments to the expression stack.
286 __ PushArray(rbx, rax, rcx);
287
288#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
289 // Push implicit receiver.
290 __ Push(r8);
291#endif
292
293 // Call the function.
294 __ InvokeFunction(rdi, rdx, rax, CALL_FUNCTION);
295
296 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
297 // -- rax constructor result
298 // -- sp[0*kSystemPointerSize] implicit receiver
299 // -- sp[1*kSystemPointerSize] padding
300 // -- sp[2*kSystemPointerSize] constructor function
301 // -- sp[3*kSystemPointerSize] number of arguments
302 // -- sp[4*kSystemPointerSize] context
303 // -----------------------------------
304
305 // Store offset of return address for deoptimizer.
306 masm->isolate()->heap()->SetConstructStubInvokeDeoptPCOffset(
307 masm->pc_offset());
308
309 // Restore context from the frame.
310 __ movq(rsi, Operand(rbp, ConstructFrameConstants::kContextOffset));
311
312 // If the result is an object (in the ECMA sense), we should get rid
313 // of the receiver and use the result; see ECMA-262 section 13.2.2-7
314 // on page 74.
315 Label use_receiver, do_throw, leave_frame;
316
317 // If the result is undefined, we jump out to using the implicit receiver.
318 __ JumpIfRoot(rax, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue, &use_receiver, Label::kNear);
319
320 // Otherwise we do a smi check and fall through to check if the return value
321 // is a valid receiver.
322
323 // If the result is a smi, it is *not* an object in the ECMA sense.
324 __ JumpIfSmi(rax, &use_receiver, Label::kNear);
325
326 // If the type of the result (stored in its map) is less than
327 // FIRST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE, it is not an object in the ECMA sense.
328 STATIC_ASSERT(LAST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE == LAST_TYPE)static_assert(LAST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE == LAST_TYPE, "LAST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE == LAST_TYPE"
);
329 __ CmpObjectType(rax, FIRST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE, rcx);
330 __ j(above_equal, &leave_frame, Label::kNear);
331 __ jmp(&use_receiver, Label::kNear);
332
333 __ bind(&do_throw);
334 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowConstructorReturnedNonObject);
335
336 // Throw away the result of the constructor invocation and use the
337 // on-stack receiver as the result.
338 __ bind(&use_receiver);
339 __ movq(rax, Operand(rsp, 0 * kSystemPointerSize));
340 __ JumpIfRoot(rax, RootIndex::kTheHoleValue, &do_throw, Label::kNear);
341
342 __ bind(&leave_frame);
343 // Restore the arguments count.
344 __ movq(rbx, Operand(rbp, ConstructFrameConstants::kLengthOffset));
345 // Leave construct frame.
346 }
347 // Remove caller arguments from the stack and return.
348 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
349 SmiIndex index = masm->SmiToIndex(rbx, rbx, kSystemPointerSizeLog2);
350 __ leaq(rsp, Operand(rsp, index.reg, index.scale, 1 * kSystemPointerSize));
351 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rcx);
352 __ ret(0);
353}
354
355void Builtins::Generate_JSBuiltinsConstructStub(MacroAssembler* masm) {
356 Generate_JSBuiltinsConstructStubHelper(masm);
357}
358
359void Builtins::Generate_ConstructedNonConstructable(MacroAssembler* masm) {
360 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
361 __ Push(rdi);
362 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowConstructedNonConstructable);
363}
364
365namespace {
366
367// Called with the native C calling convention. The corresponding function
368// signature is either:
369// using JSEntryFunction = GeneratedCode<Address(
370// Address root_register_value, Address new_target, Address target,
371// Address receiver, intptr_t argc, Address** argv)>;
372// or
373// using JSEntryFunction = GeneratedCode<Address(
374// Address root_register_value, MicrotaskQueue* microtask_queue)>;
375void Generate_JSEntryVariant(MacroAssembler* masm, StackFrame::Type type,
376 Builtins::Name entry_trampoline) {
377 Label invoke, handler_entry, exit;
378 Label not_outermost_js, not_outermost_js_2;
379
380 { // NOLINT. Scope block confuses linter.
381 NoRootArrayScope uninitialized_root_register(masm);
382 // Set up frame.
383 __ pushq(rbp);
384 __ movq(rbp, rsp);
385
386 // Push the stack frame type.
387 __ Push(Immediate(StackFrame::TypeToMarker(type)));
388 // Reserve a slot for the context. It is filled after the root register has
389 // been set up.
390 __ AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize);
391 // Save callee-saved registers (X64/X32/Win64 calling conventions).
392 __ pushq(r12);
393 __ pushq(r13);
394 __ pushq(r14);
395 __ pushq(r15);
396#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
397 __ pushq(rdi); // Only callee save in Win64 ABI, argument in AMD64 ABI.
398 __ pushq(rsi); // Only callee save in Win64 ABI, argument in AMD64 ABI.
399#endif
400 __ pushq(rbx);
401
402#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
403 // On Win64 XMM6-XMM15 are callee-save.
404 __ AllocateStackSpace(EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize);
405 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 0), xmm6);
406 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 1), xmm7);
407 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 2), xmm8);
408 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 3), xmm9);
409 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 4), xmm10);
410 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 5), xmm11);
411 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 6), xmm12);
412 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 7), xmm13);
413 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 8), xmm14);
414 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 9), xmm15);
415 STATIC_ASSERT(EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters == 10)static_assert(EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters ==
10, "EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters == 10");
416 STATIC_ASSERT(EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize ==static_assert(EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize == EntryFrameConstants
::kXMMRegisterSize * EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters
, "EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize == EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters"
)
417 EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize *static_assert(EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize == EntryFrameConstants
::kXMMRegisterSize * EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters
, "EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize == EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters"
)
418 EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters)static_assert(EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize == EntryFrameConstants
::kXMMRegisterSize * EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters
, "EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize == EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * EntryFrameConstants::kCalleeSaveXMMRegisters"
);
419#endif
420
421 // Initialize the root register.
422 // C calling convention. The first argument is passed in arg_reg_1.
423 __ movq(kRootRegister, arg_reg_1);
424 }
425
426 // Save copies of the top frame descriptor on the stack.
427 ExternalReference c_entry_fp = ExternalReference::Create(
428 IsolateAddressId::kCEntryFPAddress, masm->isolate());
429 {
430 Operand c_entry_fp_operand = masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(c_entry_fp);
431 __ Push(c_entry_fp_operand);
432 }
433
434 // Store the context address in the previously-reserved slot.
435 ExternalReference context_address = ExternalReference::Create(
436 IsolateAddressId::kContextAddress, masm->isolate());
437 __ Load(kScratchRegister, context_address);
438 static constexpr int kOffsetToContextSlot = -2 * kSystemPointerSize;
439 __ movq(Operand(rbp, kOffsetToContextSlot), kScratchRegister);
440
441 // If this is the outermost JS call, set js_entry_sp value.
442 ExternalReference js_entry_sp = ExternalReference::Create(
443 IsolateAddressId::kJSEntrySPAddress, masm->isolate());
444 __ Load(rax, js_entry_sp);
445 __ testq(rax, rax);
446 __ j(not_zero, &not_outermost_js);
447 __ Push(Immediate(StackFrame::OUTERMOST_JSENTRY_FRAME));
448 __ movq(rax, rbp);
449 __ Store(js_entry_sp, rax);
450 Label cont;
451 __ jmp(&cont);
452 __ bind(&not_outermost_js);
453 __ Push(Immediate(StackFrame::INNER_JSENTRY_FRAME));
454 __ bind(&cont);
455
456 // Jump to a faked try block that does the invoke, with a faked catch
457 // block that sets the pending exception.
458 __ jmp(&invoke);
459 __ bind(&handler_entry);
460
461 // Store the current pc as the handler offset. It's used later to create the
462 // handler table.
463 masm->isolate()->builtins()->SetJSEntryHandlerOffset(handler_entry.pos());
464
465 // Caught exception: Store result (exception) in the pending exception
466 // field in the JSEnv and return a failure sentinel.
467 ExternalReference pending_exception = ExternalReference::Create(
468 IsolateAddressId::kPendingExceptionAddress, masm->isolate());
469 __ Store(pending_exception, rax);
470 __ LoadRoot(rax, RootIndex::kException);
471 __ jmp(&exit);
472
473 // Invoke: Link this frame into the handler chain.
474 __ bind(&invoke);
475 __ PushStackHandler();
476
477 // Invoke the function by calling through JS entry trampoline builtin and
478 // pop the faked function when we return.
479 Handle<Code> trampoline_code =
480 masm->isolate()->builtins()->builtin_handle(entry_trampoline);
481 __ Call(trampoline_code, RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
482
483 // Unlink this frame from the handler chain.
484 __ PopStackHandler();
485
486 __ bind(&exit);
487 // Check if the current stack frame is marked as the outermost JS frame.
488 __ Pop(rbx);
489 __ cmpq(rbx, Immediate(StackFrame::OUTERMOST_JSENTRY_FRAME));
490 __ j(not_equal, &not_outermost_js_2);
491 __ Move(kScratchRegister, js_entry_sp);
492 __ movq(Operand(kScratchRegister, 0), Immediate(0));
493 __ bind(&not_outermost_js_2);
494
495 // Restore the top frame descriptor from the stack.
496 {
497 Operand c_entry_fp_operand = masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(c_entry_fp);
498 __ Pop(c_entry_fp_operand);
499 }
500
501 // Restore callee-saved registers (X64 conventions).
502#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
503 // On Win64 XMM6-XMM15 are callee-save
504 __ movdqu(xmm6, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 0));
505 __ movdqu(xmm7, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 1));
506 __ movdqu(xmm8, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 2));
507 __ movdqu(xmm9, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 3));
508 __ movdqu(xmm10, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 4));
509 __ movdqu(xmm11, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 5));
510 __ movdqu(xmm12, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 6));
511 __ movdqu(xmm13, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 7));
512 __ movdqu(xmm14, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 8));
513 __ movdqu(xmm15, Operand(rsp, EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegisterSize * 9));
514 __ addq(rsp, Immediate(EntryFrameConstants::kXMMRegistersBlockSize));
515#endif
516
517 __ popq(rbx);
518#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
519 // Callee save on in Win64 ABI, arguments/volatile in AMD64 ABI.
520 __ popq(rsi);
521 __ popq(rdi);
522#endif
523 __ popq(r15);
524 __ popq(r14);
525 __ popq(r13);
526 __ popq(r12);
527 __ addq(rsp, Immediate(2 * kSystemPointerSize)); // remove markers
528
529 // Restore frame pointer and return.
530 __ popq(rbp);
531 __ ret(0);
532}
533
534} // namespace
535
536void Builtins::Generate_JSEntry(MacroAssembler* masm) {
537 Generate_JSEntryVariant(masm, StackFrame::ENTRY,
538 Builtins::kJSEntryTrampoline);
539}
540
541void Builtins::Generate_JSConstructEntry(MacroAssembler* masm) {
542 Generate_JSEntryVariant(masm, StackFrame::CONSTRUCT_ENTRY,
543 Builtins::kJSConstructEntryTrampoline);
544}
545
546void Builtins::Generate_JSRunMicrotasksEntry(MacroAssembler* masm) {
547 Generate_JSEntryVariant(masm, StackFrame::ENTRY,
548 Builtins::kRunMicrotasksTrampoline);
549}
550
551static void Generate_JSEntryTrampolineHelper(MacroAssembler* masm,
552 bool is_construct) {
553 // Expects six C++ function parameters.
554 // - Address root_register_value
555 // - Address new_target (tagged Object pointer)
556 // - Address function (tagged JSFunction pointer)
557 // - Address receiver (tagged Object pointer)
558 // - intptr_t argc
559 // - Address** argv (pointer to array of tagged Object pointers)
560 // (see Handle::Invoke in execution.cc).
561
562 // Open a C++ scope for the FrameScope.
563 {
564 // Platform specific argument handling. After this, the stack contains
565 // an internal frame and the pushed function and receiver, and
566 // register rax and rbx holds the argument count and argument array,
567 // while rdi holds the function pointer, rsi the context, and rdx the
568 // new.target.
569
570 // MSVC parameters in:
571 // rcx : root_register_value
572 // rdx : new_target
573 // r8 : function
574 // r9 : receiver
575 // [rsp+0x20] : argc
576 // [rsp+0x28] : argv
577 //
578 // GCC parameters in:
579 // rdi : root_register_value
580 // rsi : new_target
581 // rdx : function
582 // rcx : receiver
583 // r8 : argc
584 // r9 : argv
585
586 __ movq(rdi, arg_reg_3);
587 __ Move(rdx, arg_reg_2);
588 // rdi : function
589 // rdx : new_target
590
591 // Clear the context before we push it when entering the internal frame.
592 __ Set(rsi, 0);
593
594 // Enter an internal frame.
595 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
596
597 // Setup the context (we need to use the caller context from the isolate).
598 ExternalReference context_address = ExternalReference::Create(
599 IsolateAddressId::kContextAddress, masm->isolate());
600 __ movq(rsi, masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(context_address));
601
602 // Push the function onto the stack.
603 __ Push(rdi);
604
605#ifndef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
606 // Push the receiver onto the stack.
607 __ Push(arg_reg_4);
608#endif
609
610#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
611 // Load the previous frame pointer to access C arguments on stack
612 __ movq(kScratchRegister, Operand(rbp, 0));
613 // Load the number of arguments and setup pointer to the arguments.
614 __ movq(rax, Operand(kScratchRegister, EntryFrameConstants::kArgcOffset));
615 __ movq(rbx, Operand(kScratchRegister, EntryFrameConstants::kArgvOffset));
616#else // V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
617 // Load the number of arguments and setup pointer to the arguments.
618 __ movq(rax, r8);
619 __ movq(rbx, r9);
620#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
621 __ movq(r9, arg_reg_4); // Temporarily saving the receiver.
622#endif
623#endif // V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
624
625 // Current stack contents if V8_REVERSE_JSARGS:
626 // [rsp + kSystemPointerSize] : Internal frame
627 // [rsp] : function
628 // Current stack contents if not V8_REVERSE_JSARGS:
629 // [rsp + 2 * kSystemPointerSize] : Internal frame
630 // [rsp + kSystemPointerSize] : function
631 // [rsp] : receiver
632 // Current register contents:
633 // rax : argc
634 // rbx : argv
635 // rsi : context
636 // rdi : function
637 // rdx : new.target
638 // r9 : receiver, if V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
639
640 // Check if we have enough stack space to push all arguments.
641 // Argument count in rax. Clobbers rcx.
642 Label enough_stack_space, stack_overflow;
643 Generate_StackOverflowCheck(masm, rax, rcx, &stack_overflow, Label::kNear);
644 __ jmp(&enough_stack_space, Label::kNear);
645
646 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
647 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
648 // This should be unreachable.
649 __ int3();
650
651 __ bind(&enough_stack_space);
652
653 // Copy arguments to the stack in a loop.
654 // Register rbx points to array of pointers to handle locations.
655 // Push the values of these handles.
656#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
657 Label loop, entry;
658 __ movq(rcx, rax);
659 __ jmp(&entry, Label::kNear);
660 __ bind(&loop);
661 __ movq(kScratchRegister, Operand(rbx, rcx, times_system_pointer_size, 0));
662 __ Push(Operand(kScratchRegister, 0)); // dereference handle
663 __ bind(&entry);
664 __ decq(rcx);
665 __ j(greater_equal, &loop, Label::kNear);
666
667 // Push the receiver.
668 __ Push(r9);
669#else
670 Label loop, entry;
671 __ Set(rcx, 0); // Set loop variable to 0.
672 __ jmp(&entry, Label::kNear);
673 __ bind(&loop);
674 __ movq(kScratchRegister, Operand(rbx, rcx, times_system_pointer_size, 0));
675 __ Push(Operand(kScratchRegister, 0)); // dereference handle
676 __ addq(rcx, Immediate(1));
677 __ bind(&entry);
678 __ cmpq(rcx, rax);
679 __ j(not_equal, &loop, Label::kNear);
680#endif
681
682 // Invoke the builtin code.
683 Handle<Code> builtin = is_construct
684 ? BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), Construct)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstruct)
685 : masm->isolate()->builtins()->Call();
686 __ Call(builtin, RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
687
688 // Exit the internal frame. Notice that this also removes the empty
689 // context and the function left on the stack by the code
690 // invocation.
691 }
692
693 __ ret(0);
694}
695
696void Builtins::Generate_JSEntryTrampoline(MacroAssembler* masm) {
697 Generate_JSEntryTrampolineHelper(masm, false);
698}
699
700void Builtins::Generate_JSConstructEntryTrampoline(MacroAssembler* masm) {
701 Generate_JSEntryTrampolineHelper(masm, true);
702}
703
704void Builtins::Generate_RunMicrotasksTrampoline(MacroAssembler* masm) {
705 // arg_reg_2: microtask_queue
706 __ movq(RunMicrotasksDescriptor::MicrotaskQueueRegister(), arg_reg_2);
707 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), RunMicrotasks)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kRunMicrotasks), RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
708}
709
710static void GetSharedFunctionInfoBytecode(MacroAssembler* masm,
711 Register sfi_data,
712 Register scratch1) {
713 Label done;
714
715 __ CmpObjectType(sfi_data, INTERPRETER_DATA_TYPE, scratch1);
716 __ j(not_equal, &done, Label::kNear);
717
718 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
719 sfi_data, FieldOperand(sfi_data, InterpreterData::kBytecodeArrayOffset));
720
721 __ bind(&done);
722}
723
724// static
725void Builtins::Generate_ResumeGeneratorTrampoline(MacroAssembler* masm) {
726 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
727 // -- rax : the value to pass to the generator
728 // -- rdx : the JSGeneratorObject to resume
729 // -- rsp[0] : return address
730 // -----------------------------------
731 __ AssertGeneratorObject(rdx);
732
733 // Store input value into generator object.
734 __ StoreTaggedField(
735 FieldOperand(rdx, JSGeneratorObject::kInputOrDebugPosOffset), rax);
736 __ RecordWriteField(rdx, JSGeneratorObject::kInputOrDebugPosOffset, rax, rcx,
737 kDontSaveFPRegs);
738
739 Register decompr_scratch1 = COMPRESS_POINTERS_BOOLfalse ? r11 : no_reg;
740
741 // Load suspended function and context.
742 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
743 rdi, FieldOperand(rdx, JSGeneratorObject::kFunctionOffset));
744 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rsi, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kContextOffset));
745
746 // Flood function if we are stepping.
747 Label prepare_step_in_if_stepping, prepare_step_in_suspended_generator;
748 Label stepping_prepared;
749 ExternalReference debug_hook =
750 ExternalReference::debug_hook_on_function_call_address(masm->isolate());
751 Operand debug_hook_operand = masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(debug_hook);
752 __ cmpb(debug_hook_operand, Immediate(0));
753 __ j(not_equal, &prepare_step_in_if_stepping);
754
755 // Flood function if we need to continue stepping in the suspended generator.
756 ExternalReference debug_suspended_generator =
757 ExternalReference::debug_suspended_generator_address(masm->isolate());
758 Operand debug_suspended_generator_operand =
759 masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(debug_suspended_generator);
760 __ cmpq(rdx, debug_suspended_generator_operand);
761 __ j(equal, &prepare_step_in_suspended_generator);
762 __ bind(&stepping_prepared);
763
764 // Check the stack for overflow. We are not trying to catch interruptions
765 // (i.e. debug break and preemption) here, so check the "real stack limit".
766 Label stack_overflow;
767 __ cmpq(rsp, StackLimitAsOperand(masm, StackLimitKind::kRealStackLimit));
768 __ j(below, &stack_overflow);
769
770 // Pop return address.
771 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rax);
772
773#ifndef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
774 // Push receiver.
775 __ PushTaggedPointerField(
776 FieldOperand(rdx, JSGeneratorObject::kReceiverOffset), decompr_scratch1);
777#endif
778
779 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
780 // -- rax : return address
781 // -- rdx : the JSGeneratorObject to resume
782 // -- rdi : generator function
783 // -- rsi : generator context
784 // -- rsp[0] : generator receiver, if V8_REVERSE_JSARGS is not set
785 // -----------------------------------
786
787 // Copy the function arguments from the generator object's register file.
788 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
789 rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
790 __ movzxwq(
791 rcx, FieldOperand(rcx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFormalParameterCountOffset));
792
793 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
794 rbx, FieldOperand(rdx, JSGeneratorObject::kParametersAndRegistersOffset));
795
796 {
797#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
798 {
799 Label done_loop, loop;
800 __ movq(r9, rcx);
801
802 __ bind(&loop);
803 __ decq(r9);
804 __ j(less, &done_loop, Label::kNear);
805 __ PushTaggedAnyField(
806 FieldOperand(rbx, r9, times_tagged_size, FixedArray::kHeaderSize),
807 decompr_scratch1);
808 __ jmp(&loop);
809
810 __ bind(&done_loop);
811 }
812
813 // Push the receiver.
814 __ PushTaggedPointerField(
815 FieldOperand(rdx, JSGeneratorObject::kReceiverOffset),
816 decompr_scratch1);
817#else
818 Label done_loop, loop;
819 __ Set(r9, 0);
820
821 __ bind(&loop);
822 __ cmpl(r9, rcx);
823 __ j(greater_equal, &done_loop, Label::kNear);
824 __ PushTaggedAnyField(
825 FieldOperand(rbx, r9, times_tagged_size, FixedArray::kHeaderSize),
826 decompr_scratch1);
827 __ addl(r9, Immediate(1));
828 __ jmp(&loop);
829
830 __ bind(&done_loop);
831#endif
832 }
833
834 // Underlying function needs to have bytecode available.
835 if (FLAG_debug_code) {
836 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
837 rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
838 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
839 rcx, FieldOperand(rcx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFunctionDataOffset));
840 GetSharedFunctionInfoBytecode(masm, rcx, kScratchRegister);
841 __ CmpObjectType(rcx, BYTECODE_ARRAY_TYPE, rcx);
842 __ Assert(equal, AbortReason::kMissingBytecodeArray);
843 }
844
845 // Resume (Ignition/TurboFan) generator object.
846 {
847 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rax);
848 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
849 rax, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
850 __ movzxwq(rax, FieldOperand(
851 rax, SharedFunctionInfo::kFormalParameterCountOffset));
852 // We abuse new.target both to indicate that this is a resume call and to
853 // pass in the generator object. In ordinary calls, new.target is always
854 // undefined because generator functions are non-constructable.
855 static_assert(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister == rcx, "ABI mismatch");
856 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kCodeOffset));
857 __ JumpCodeObject(rcx);
858 }
859
860 __ bind(&prepare_step_in_if_stepping);
861 {
862 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
863 __ Push(rdx);
864 __ Push(rdi);
865 // Push hole as receiver since we do not use it for stepping.
866 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kTheHoleValue);
867 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kDebugOnFunctionCall);
868 __ Pop(rdx);
869 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
870 rdi, FieldOperand(rdx, JSGeneratorObject::kFunctionOffset));
871 }
872 __ jmp(&stepping_prepared);
873
874 __ bind(&prepare_step_in_suspended_generator);
875 {
876 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
877 __ Push(rdx);
878 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kDebugPrepareStepInSuspendedGenerator);
879 __ Pop(rdx);
880 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
881 rdi, FieldOperand(rdx, JSGeneratorObject::kFunctionOffset));
882 }
883 __ jmp(&stepping_prepared);
884
885 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
886 {
887 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
888 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
889 __ int3(); // This should be unreachable.
890 }
891}
892
893// TODO(juliana): if we remove the code below then we don't need all
894// the parameters.
895static void ReplaceClosureCodeWithOptimizedCode(MacroAssembler* masm,
896 Register optimized_code,
897 Register closure,
898 Register scratch1,
899 Register scratch2) {
900 // Store the optimized code in the closure.
901 __ StoreTaggedField(FieldOperand(closure, JSFunction::kCodeOffset),
902 optimized_code);
903 __ movq(scratch1, optimized_code); // Write barrier clobbers scratch1 below.
904 __ RecordWriteField(closure, JSFunction::kCodeOffset, scratch1, scratch2,
905 kDontSaveFPRegs, OMIT_REMEMBERED_SET, OMIT_SMI_CHECK);
906}
907
908static void LeaveInterpreterFrame(MacroAssembler* masm, Register scratch1,
909 Register scratch2) {
910 Register args_count = scratch1;
911 Register return_pc = scratch2;
912
913 // Get the arguments + receiver count.
914 __ movq(args_count,
915 Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeArrayFromFp));
916 __ movl(args_count,
917 FieldOperand(args_count, BytecodeArray::kParameterSizeOffset));
918
919 // Leave the frame (also dropping the register file).
920 __ leave();
921
922 // Drop receiver + arguments.
923 __ PopReturnAddressTo(return_pc);
924 __ addq(rsp, args_count);
925 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(return_pc);
926}
927
928// Tail-call |function_id| if |smi_entry| == |marker|
929static void TailCallRuntimeIfMarkerEquals(MacroAssembler* masm,
930 Register smi_entry,
931 OptimizationMarker marker,
932 Runtime::FunctionId function_id) {
933 Label no_match;
934 __ SmiCompare(smi_entry, Smi::FromEnum(marker));
935 __ j(not_equal, &no_match);
936 GenerateTailCallToReturnedCode(masm, function_id);
937 __ bind(&no_match);
938}
939
940static void MaybeOptimizeCode(MacroAssembler* masm, Register feedback_vector,
941 Register optimization_marker) {
942 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
943 // -- rdx : new target (preserved for callee if needed, and caller)
944 // -- rdi : target function (preserved for callee if needed, and caller)
945 // -- feedback vector (preserved for caller if needed)
946 // -- optimization_marker : a Smi containing a non-zero optimization marker.
947 // -----------------------------------
948
949 DCHECK(!AreAliased(feedback_vector, rdx, rdi, optimization_marker))((void) 0);
950
951 // TODO(v8:8394): The logging of first execution will break if
952 // feedback vectors are not allocated. We need to find a different way of
953 // logging these events if required.
954 TailCallRuntimeIfMarkerEquals(masm, optimization_marker,
955 OptimizationMarker::kLogFirstExecution,
956 Runtime::kFunctionFirstExecution);
957 TailCallRuntimeIfMarkerEquals(masm, optimization_marker,
958 OptimizationMarker::kCompileOptimized,
959 Runtime::kCompileOptimized_NotConcurrent);
960 TailCallRuntimeIfMarkerEquals(masm, optimization_marker,
961 OptimizationMarker::kCompileOptimizedConcurrent,
962 Runtime::kCompileOptimized_Concurrent);
963
964 // Otherwise, the marker is InOptimizationQueue, so fall through hoping
965 // that an interrupt will eventually update the slot with optimized code.
966 if (FLAG_debug_code) {
967 __ SmiCompare(optimization_marker,
968 Smi::FromEnum(OptimizationMarker::kInOptimizationQueue));
969 __ Assert(equal, AbortReason::kExpectedOptimizationSentinel);
970 }
971}
972
973static void TailCallOptimizedCodeSlot(MacroAssembler* masm,
974 Register optimized_code_entry,
975 Register scratch1, Register scratch2) {
976 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
977 // -- rdx : new target (preserved for callee if needed, and caller)
978 // -- rdi : target function (preserved for callee if needed, and caller)
979 // -----------------------------------
980
981 Register closure = rdi;
982
983 // Check if the optimized code is marked for deopt. If it is, call the
984 // runtime to clear it.
985 Label found_deoptimized_code;
986 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
987 scratch1,
988 FieldOperand(optimized_code_entry, Code::kCodeDataContainerOffset));
989 __ testl(FieldOperand(scratch1, CodeDataContainer::kKindSpecificFlagsOffset),
990 Immediate(1 << Code::kMarkedForDeoptimizationBit));
991 __ j(not_zero, &found_deoptimized_code);
992
993 // Optimized code is good, get it into the closure and link the closure into
994 // the optimized functions list, then tail call the optimized code.
995 ReplaceClosureCodeWithOptimizedCode(masm, optimized_code_entry, closure,
996 scratch1, scratch2);
997 static_assert(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister == rcx, "ABI mismatch");
998 __ Move(rcx, optimized_code_entry);
999 __ JumpCodeObject(rcx);
1000
1001 // Optimized code slot contains deoptimized code, evict it and re-enter the
1002 // closure's code.
1003 __ bind(&found_deoptimized_code);
1004 GenerateTailCallToReturnedCode(masm, Runtime::kEvictOptimizedCodeSlot);
1005}
1006
1007// Advance the current bytecode offset. This simulates what all bytecode
1008// handlers do upon completion of the underlying operation. Will bail out to a
1009// label if the bytecode (without prefix) is a return bytecode. Will not advance
1010// the bytecode offset if the current bytecode is a JumpLoop, instead just
1011// re-executing the JumpLoop to jump to the correct bytecode.
1012static void AdvanceBytecodeOffsetOrReturn(MacroAssembler* masm,
1013 Register bytecode_array,
1014 Register bytecode_offset,
1015 Register bytecode, Register scratch1,
1016 Register scratch2, Label* if_return) {
1017 Register bytecode_size_table = scratch1;
1018
1019 // The bytecode offset value will be increased by one in wide and extra wide
1020 // cases. In the case of having a wide or extra wide JumpLoop bytecode, we
1021 // will restore the original bytecode. In order to simplify the code, we have
1022 // a backup of it.
1023 Register original_bytecode_offset = scratch2;
1024 DCHECK(!AreAliased(bytecode_array, bytecode_offset, bytecode,((void) 0)
1025 bytecode_size_table, original_bytecode_offset))((void) 0);
1026
1027 __ movq(original_bytecode_offset, bytecode_offset);
1028
1029 __ Move(bytecode_size_table,
1030 ExternalReference::bytecode_size_table_address());
1031
1032 // Check if the bytecode is a Wide or ExtraWide prefix bytecode.
1033 Label process_bytecode, extra_wide;
1034 STATIC_ASSERT(0 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kWide))static_assert(0 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode
::kWide), "0 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kWide)"
);
1035 STATIC_ASSERT(1 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kExtraWide))static_assert(1 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode
::kExtraWide), "1 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kExtraWide)"
);
1036 STATIC_ASSERT(2 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kDebugBreakWide))static_assert(2 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode
::kDebugBreakWide), "2 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kDebugBreakWide)"
);
1037 STATIC_ASSERT(3 ==static_assert(3 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode
::kDebugBreakExtraWide), "3 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kDebugBreakExtraWide)"
)
1038 static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kDebugBreakExtraWide))static_assert(3 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode
::kDebugBreakExtraWide), "3 == static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kDebugBreakExtraWide)"
);
1039 __ cmpb(bytecode, Immediate(0x3));
1040 __ j(above, &process_bytecode, Label::kNear);
1041 // The code to load the next bytecode is common to both wide and extra wide.
1042 // We can hoist them up here. incl has to happen before testb since it
1043 // modifies the ZF flag.
1044 __ incl(bytecode_offset);
1045 __ testb(bytecode, Immediate(0x1));
1046 __ movzxbq(bytecode, Operand(bytecode_array, bytecode_offset, times_1, 0));
1047 __ j(not_equal, &extra_wide, Label::kNear);
1048
1049 // Update table to the wide scaled table.
1050 __ addq(bytecode_size_table,
1051 Immediate(kIntSize * interpreter::Bytecodes::kBytecodeCount));
1052 __ jmp(&process_bytecode, Label::kNear);
1053
1054 __ bind(&extra_wide);
1055 // Update table to the extra wide scaled table.
1056 __ addq(bytecode_size_table,
1057 Immediate(2 * kIntSize * interpreter::Bytecodes::kBytecodeCount));
1058
1059 __ bind(&process_bytecode);
1060
1061// Bailout to the return label if this is a return bytecode.
1062#define JUMP_IF_EQUAL(NAME) \
1063 __ cmpb(bytecode, \
1064 Immediate(static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::k##NAME))); \
1065 __ j(equal, if_return, Label::kFar);
1066 RETURN_BYTECODE_LIST(JUMP_IF_EQUAL)JUMP_IF_EQUAL(Return) JUMP_IF_EQUAL(SuspendGenerator)
1067#undef JUMP_IF_EQUAL
1068
1069 // If this is a JumpLoop, re-execute it to perform the jump to the beginning
1070 // of the loop.
1071 Label end, not_jump_loop;
1072 __ cmpb(bytecode,
1073 Immediate(static_cast<int>(interpreter::Bytecode::kJumpLoop)));
1074 __ j(not_equal, &not_jump_loop, Label::kNear);
1075 // We need to restore the original bytecode_offset since we might have
1076 // increased it to skip the wide / extra-wide prefix bytecode.
1077 __ movq(bytecode_offset, original_bytecode_offset);
1078 __ jmp(&end, Label::kNear);
1079
1080 __ bind(&not_jump_loop);
1081 // Otherwise, load the size of the current bytecode and advance the offset.
1082 __ addl(bytecode_offset,
1083 Operand(bytecode_size_table, bytecode, times_int_size, 0));
1084
1085 __ bind(&end);
1086}
1087
1088// Generate code for entering a JS function with the interpreter.
1089// On entry to the function the receiver and arguments have been pushed on the
1090// stack left to right. The actual argument count matches the formal parameter
1091// count expected by the function.
1092//
1093// The live registers are:
1094// o rdi: the JS function object being called
1095// o rdx: the incoming new target or generator object
1096// o rsi: our context
1097// o rbp: the caller's frame pointer
1098// o rsp: stack pointer (pointing to return address)
1099//
1100// The function builds an interpreter frame. See InterpreterFrameConstants in
1101// frames.h for its layout.
1102void Builtins::Generate_InterpreterEntryTrampoline(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1103 Register closure = rdi;
1104 Register feedback_vector = rbx;
1105
1106 // Get the bytecode array from the function object and load it into
1107 // kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister.
1108 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
1109 rax, FieldOperand(closure, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
1110 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
1111 kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1112 FieldOperand(rax, SharedFunctionInfo::kFunctionDataOffset));
1113 GetSharedFunctionInfoBytecode(masm, kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1114 kScratchRegister);
1115
1116 // The bytecode array could have been flushed from the shared function info,
1117 // if so, call into CompileLazy.
1118 Label compile_lazy;
1119 __ CmpObjectType(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister, BYTECODE_ARRAY_TYPE, rax);
1120 __ j(not_equal, &compile_lazy);
1121
1122 // Load the feedback vector from the closure.
1123 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
1124 feedback_vector, FieldOperand(closure, JSFunction::kFeedbackCellOffset));
1125 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(feedback_vector,
1126 FieldOperand(feedback_vector, Cell::kValueOffset));
1127
1128 Label push_stack_frame;
1129 // Check if feedback vector is valid. If valid, check for optimized code
1130 // and update invocation count. Otherwise, setup the stack frame.
1131 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
1132 rcx, FieldOperand(feedback_vector, HeapObject::kMapOffset));
1133 __ CmpInstanceType(rcx, FEEDBACK_VECTOR_TYPE);
1134 __ j(not_equal, &push_stack_frame);
1135
1136 // Read off the optimized code slot in the feedback vector, and if there
1137 // is optimized code or an optimization marker, call that instead.
1138
1139 Register optimized_code_entry = rcx;
1140
1141 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(
1142 optimized_code_entry,
1143 FieldOperand(feedback_vector,
1144 FeedbackVector::kOptimizedCodeWeakOrSmiOffset));
1145
1146 // Check if the optimized code slot is not empty.
1147 Label optimized_code_slot_not_empty;
1148 __ Cmp(optimized_code_entry, Smi::FromEnum(OptimizationMarker::kNone));
1149 __ j(not_equal, &optimized_code_slot_not_empty);
1150
1151 Label not_optimized;
1152 __ bind(&not_optimized);
1153
1154 // Increment invocation count for the function.
1155 __ incl(
1156 FieldOperand(feedback_vector, FeedbackVector::kInvocationCountOffset));
1157
1158 // Open a frame scope to indicate that there is a frame on the stack. The
1159 // MANUAL indicates that the scope shouldn't actually generate code to set up
1160 // the frame (that is done below).
1161 __ bind(&push_stack_frame);
1162 FrameScope frame_scope(masm, StackFrame::MANUAL);
1163 __ pushq(rbp); // Caller's frame pointer.
1164 __ movq(rbp, rsp);
1165 __ Push(rsi); // Callee's context.
1166 __ Push(rdi); // Callee's JS function.
1167
1168 // Reset code age and the OSR arming. The OSR field and BytecodeAgeOffset are
1169 // 8-bit fields next to each other, so we could just optimize by writing a
1170 // 16-bit. These static asserts guard our assumption is valid.
1171 STATIC_ASSERT(BytecodeArray::kBytecodeAgeOffset ==static_assert(BytecodeArray::kBytecodeAgeOffset == BytecodeArray
::kOsrNestingLevelOffset + kCharSize, "BytecodeArray::kBytecodeAgeOffset == BytecodeArray::kOsrNestingLevelOffset + kCharSize"
)
1172 BytecodeArray::kOsrNestingLevelOffset + kCharSize)static_assert(BytecodeArray::kBytecodeAgeOffset == BytecodeArray
::kOsrNestingLevelOffset + kCharSize, "BytecodeArray::kBytecodeAgeOffset == BytecodeArray::kOsrNestingLevelOffset + kCharSize"
);
1173 STATIC_ASSERT(BytecodeArray::kNoAgeBytecodeAge == 0)static_assert(BytecodeArray::kNoAgeBytecodeAge == 0, "BytecodeArray::kNoAgeBytecodeAge == 0"
);
1174 __ movw(FieldOperand(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1175 BytecodeArray::kOsrNestingLevelOffset),
1176 Immediate(0));
1177
1178 // Load initial bytecode offset.
1179 __ movq(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister,
1180 Immediate(BytecodeArray::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag));
1181
1182 // Push bytecode array and Smi tagged bytecode offset.
1183 __ Push(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister);
1184 __ SmiTag(rcx, kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister);
1185 __ Push(rcx);
1186
1187 // Allocate the local and temporary register file on the stack.
1188 Label stack_overflow;
1189 {
1190 // Load frame size from the BytecodeArray object.
1191 __ movl(rcx, FieldOperand(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1192 BytecodeArray::kFrameSizeOffset));
1193
1194 // Do a stack check to ensure we don't go over the limit.
1195 __ movq(rax, rsp);
1196 __ subq(rax, rcx);
1197 __ cmpq(rax, StackLimitAsOperand(masm, StackLimitKind::kRealStackLimit));
1198 __ j(below, &stack_overflow);
1199
1200 // If ok, push undefined as the initial value for all register file entries.
1201 Label loop_header;
1202 Label loop_check;
1203 __ LoadRoot(kInterpreterAccumulatorRegister, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1204 __ j(always, &loop_check, Label::kNear);
1205 __ bind(&loop_header);
1206 // TODO(rmcilroy): Consider doing more than one push per loop iteration.
1207 __ Push(kInterpreterAccumulatorRegister);
1208 // Continue loop if not done.
1209 __ bind(&loop_check);
1210 __ subq(rcx, Immediate(kSystemPointerSize));
1211 __ j(greater_equal, &loop_header, Label::kNear);
1212 }
1213
1214 // If the bytecode array has a valid incoming new target or generator object
1215 // register, initialize it with incoming value which was passed in rdx.
1216 Label no_incoming_new_target_or_generator_register;
1217 __ movsxlq(
1218 rcx,
1219 FieldOperand(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1220 BytecodeArray::kIncomingNewTargetOrGeneratorRegisterOffset));
1221 __ testl(rcx, rcx);
1222 __ j(zero, &no_incoming_new_target_or_generator_register, Label::kNear);
1223 __ movq(Operand(rbp, rcx, times_system_pointer_size, 0), rdx);
1224 __ bind(&no_incoming_new_target_or_generator_register);
1225
1226 // Perform interrupt stack check.
1227 // TODO(solanes): Merge with the real stack limit check above.
1228 Label stack_check_interrupt, after_stack_check_interrupt;
1229 __ cmpq(rsp, StackLimitAsOperand(masm, StackLimitKind::kInterruptStackLimit));
1230 __ j(below, &stack_check_interrupt);
1231 __ bind(&after_stack_check_interrupt);
1232
1233 // The accumulator is already loaded with undefined.
1234
1235 // Load the dispatch table into a register and dispatch to the bytecode
1236 // handler at the current bytecode offset.
1237 Label do_dispatch;
1238 __ bind(&do_dispatch);
1239 __ Move(
1240 kInterpreterDispatchTableRegister,
1241 ExternalReference::interpreter_dispatch_table_address(masm->isolate()));
1242 __ movzxbq(r11, Operand(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1243 kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister, times_1, 0));
1244 __ movq(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister,
1245 Operand(kInterpreterDispatchTableRegister, r11,
1246 times_system_pointer_size, 0));
1247 __ call(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister);
1248 masm->isolate()->heap()->SetInterpreterEntryReturnPCOffset(masm->pc_offset());
1249
1250 // Any returns to the entry trampoline are either due to the return bytecode
1251 // or the interpreter tail calling a builtin and then a dispatch.
1252
1253 // Get bytecode array and bytecode offset from the stack frame.
1254 __ movq(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1255 Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeArrayFromFp));
1256 __ SmiUntag(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister,
1257 Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeOffsetFromFp));
1258
1259 // Either return, or advance to the next bytecode and dispatch.
1260 Label do_return;
1261 __ movzxbq(rbx, Operand(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1262 kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister, times_1, 0));
1263 AdvanceBytecodeOffsetOrReturn(masm, kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1264 kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister, rbx, rcx,
1265 r11, &do_return);
1266 __ jmp(&do_dispatch);
1267
1268 __ bind(&do_return);
1269 // The return value is in rax.
1270 LeaveInterpreterFrame(masm, rbx, rcx);
1271 __ ret(0);
1272
1273 __ bind(&stack_check_interrupt);
1274 // Modify the bytecode offset in the stack to be kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset
1275 // for the call to the StackGuard.
1276 __ Move(Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeOffsetFromFp),
1277 Smi::FromInt(BytecodeArray::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag +
1278 kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset));
1279 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kStackGuard);
1280
1281 // After the call, restore the bytecode array, bytecode offset and accumulator
1282 // registers again. Also, restore the bytecode offset in the stack to its
1283 // previous value.
1284 __ movq(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1285 Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeArrayFromFp));
1286 __ movq(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister,
1287 Immediate(BytecodeArray::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag));
1288 __ LoadRoot(kInterpreterAccumulatorRegister, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1289
1290 __ SmiTag(rcx, kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister);
1291 __ movq(Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeOffsetFromFp), rcx);
1292
1293 __ jmp(&after_stack_check_interrupt);
1294
1295 __ bind(&compile_lazy);
1296 GenerateTailCallToReturnedCode(masm, Runtime::kCompileLazy);
1297 __ int3(); // Should not return.
1298
1299 __ bind(&optimized_code_slot_not_empty);
1300 Label maybe_has_optimized_code;
1301 // Check if optimized code marker is actually a weak reference to the
1302 // optimized code as opposed to an optimization marker.
1303 __ JumpIfNotSmi(optimized_code_entry, &maybe_has_optimized_code);
1304 MaybeOptimizeCode(masm, feedback_vector, optimized_code_entry);
1305 // Fall through if there's no runnable optimized code.
1306 __ jmp(&not_optimized);
1307
1308 __ bind(&maybe_has_optimized_code);
1309 // Load code entry from the weak reference, if it was cleared, resume
1310 // execution of unoptimized code.
1311 __ LoadWeakValue(optimized_code_entry, &not_optimized);
1312 TailCallOptimizedCodeSlot(masm, optimized_code_entry, r11, r15);
1313
1314 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
1315 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
1316 __ int3(); // Should not return.
1317}
1318
1319static void Generate_InterpreterPushArgs(MacroAssembler* masm,
1320 Register num_args,
1321 Register start_address,
1322 Register scratch) {
1323 // Find the argument with lowest address.
1324 __ movq(scratch, num_args);
1325 __ negq(scratch);
1326 __ leaq(start_address,
1327 Operand(start_address, scratch, times_system_pointer_size,
1328 kSystemPointerSize));
1329 // Push the arguments.
1330#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1331 __ PushArray(start_address, num_args, scratch,
1332 TurboAssembler::PushArrayOrder::kReverse);
1333#else
1334 __ PushArray(start_address, num_args, scratch);
1335#endif
1336}
1337
1338// static
1339void Builtins::Generate_InterpreterPushArgsThenCallImpl(
1340 MacroAssembler* masm, ConvertReceiverMode receiver_mode,
1341 InterpreterPushArgsMode mode) {
1342 DCHECK(mode != InterpreterPushArgsMode::kArrayFunction)((void) 0);
1343 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
1344 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
1345 // -- rbx : the address of the first argument to be pushed. Subsequent
1346 // arguments should be consecutive above this, in the same order as
1347 // they are to be pushed onto the stack.
1348 // -- rdi : the target to call (can be any Object).
1349 // -----------------------------------
1350 Label stack_overflow;
1351
1352#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1353 if (mode == InterpreterPushArgsMode::kWithFinalSpread) {
1354 // The spread argument should not be pushed.
1355 __ decl(rax);
1356 }
1357#endif
1358
1359 __ leal(rcx, Operand(rax, 1)); // Add one for receiver.
1360
1361 // Add a stack check before pushing arguments.
1362 Generate_StackOverflowCheck(masm, rcx, rdx, &stack_overflow);
1363
1364 // Pop return address to allow tail-call after pushing arguments.
1365 __ PopReturnAddressTo(kScratchRegister);
1366
1367#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1368 if (receiver_mode == ConvertReceiverMode::kNullOrUndefined) {
1369 // Don't copy receiver.
1370 __ decq(rcx);
1371 }
1372
1373 // rbx and rdx will be modified.
1374 Generate_InterpreterPushArgs(masm, rcx, rbx, rdx);
1375
1376 // Push "undefined" as the receiver arg if we need to.
1377 if (receiver_mode == ConvertReceiverMode::kNullOrUndefined) {
1378 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1379 }
1380
1381 if (mode == InterpreterPushArgsMode::kWithFinalSpread) {
1382 // Pass the spread in the register rbx.
1383 // rbx already points to the penultime argument, the spread
1384 // is below that.
1385 __ movq(rbx, Operand(rbx, -kSystemPointerSize));
1386 }
1387#else
1388 // Push "undefined" as the receiver arg if we need to.
1389 if (receiver_mode == ConvertReceiverMode::kNullOrUndefined) {
1390 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1391 __ decl(rcx); // Subtract one for receiver.
1392 }
1393
1394 // rbx and rdx will be modified.
1395 Generate_InterpreterPushArgs(masm, rcx, rbx, rdx);
1396
1397 if (mode == InterpreterPushArgsMode::kWithFinalSpread) {
1398 __ Pop(rbx); // Pass the spread in a register
1399 __ decl(rax); // Subtract one for spread
1400 }
1401#endif
1402
1403 // Call the target.
1404 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(kScratchRegister); // Re-push return address.
1405
1406 if (mode == InterpreterPushArgsMode::kWithFinalSpread) {
1407 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), CallWithSpread)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kCallWithSpread),
1408 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1409 } else {
1410 __ Jump(masm->isolate()->builtins()->Call(receiver_mode),
1411 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1412 }
1413
1414 // Throw stack overflow exception.
1415 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
1416 {
1417 __ TailCallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
1418 // This should be unreachable.
1419 __ int3();
1420 }
1421}
1422
1423// static
1424void Builtins::Generate_InterpreterPushArgsThenConstructImpl(
1425 MacroAssembler* masm, InterpreterPushArgsMode mode) {
1426 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
1427 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
1428 // -- rdx : the new target (either the same as the constructor or
1429 // the JSFunction on which new was invoked initially)
1430 // -- rdi : the constructor to call (can be any Object)
1431 // -- rbx : the allocation site feedback if available, undefined otherwise
1432 // -- rcx : the address of the first argument to be pushed. Subsequent
1433 // arguments should be consecutive above this, in the same order as
1434 // they are to be pushed onto the stack.
1435 // -----------------------------------
1436 Label stack_overflow;
1437
1438 // Add a stack check before pushing arguments.
1439 Generate_StackOverflowCheck(masm, rax, r8, &stack_overflow);
1440
1441 // Pop return address to allow tail-call after pushing arguments.
1442 __ PopReturnAddressTo(kScratchRegister);
1443
1444#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1445 if (mode == InterpreterPushArgsMode::kWithFinalSpread) {
1446 // The spread argument should not be pushed.
1447 __ decl(rax);
1448 }
1449
1450 // rcx and r8 will be modified.
1451 Generate_InterpreterPushArgs(masm, rax, rcx, r8);
1452
1453 // Push slot for the receiver to be constructed.
1454 __ Push(Immediate(0));
1455#else
1456 // Push slot for the receiver to be constructed.
1457 __ Push(Immediate(0));
1458
1459 // rcx and r8 will be modified.
1460 Generate_InterpreterPushArgs(masm, rax, rcx, r8);
1461#endif
1462
1463 if (mode == InterpreterPushArgsMode::kWithFinalSpread) {
1464#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1465 // Pass the spread in the register rbx.
1466 __ movq(rbx, Operand(rcx, -kSystemPointerSize));
1467#else
1468 __ Pop(rbx); // Pass the spread in a register
1469 __ decl(rax); // Subtract one for spread
1470#endif
1471 // Push return address in preparation for the tail-call.
1472 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(kScratchRegister);
1473 } else {
1474 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(kScratchRegister);
1475 __ AssertUndefinedOrAllocationSite(rbx);
1476 }
1477
1478 if (mode == InterpreterPushArgsMode::kArrayFunction) {
1479 // Tail call to the array construct stub (still in the caller
1480 // context at this point).
1481 __ AssertFunction(rdi);
1482 // Jump to the constructor function (rax, rbx, rdx passed on).
1483 Handle<Code> code = BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), ArrayConstructorImpl)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kArrayConstructorImpl);
1484 __ Jump(code, RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1485 } else if (mode == InterpreterPushArgsMode::kWithFinalSpread) {
1486 // Call the constructor (rax, rdx, rdi passed on).
1487 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), ConstructWithSpread)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstructWithSpread),
1488 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1489 } else {
1490 DCHECK_EQ(InterpreterPushArgsMode::kOther, mode)((void) 0);
1491 // Call the constructor (rax, rdx, rdi passed on).
1492 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), Construct)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstruct), RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1493 }
1494
1495 // Throw stack overflow exception.
1496 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
1497 {
1498 __ TailCallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
1499 // This should be unreachable.
1500 __ int3();
1501 }
1502}
1503
1504static void Generate_InterpreterEnterBytecode(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1505 // Set the return address to the correct point in the interpreter entry
1506 // trampoline.
1507 Label builtin_trampoline, trampoline_loaded;
1508 Smi interpreter_entry_return_pc_offset(
1509 masm->isolate()->heap()->interpreter_entry_return_pc_offset());
1510 DCHECK_NE(interpreter_entry_return_pc_offset, Smi::zero())((void) 0);
1511
1512 // If the SFI function_data is an InterpreterData, the function will have a
1513 // custom copy of the interpreter entry trampoline for profiling. If so,
1514 // get the custom trampoline, otherwise grab the entry address of the global
1515 // trampoline.
1516 __ movq(rbx, Operand(rbp, StandardFrameConstants::kFunctionOffset));
1517 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
1518 rbx, FieldOperand(rbx, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
1519 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
1520 rbx, FieldOperand(rbx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFunctionDataOffset));
1521 __ CmpObjectType(rbx, INTERPRETER_DATA_TYPE, kScratchRegister);
1522 __ j(not_equal, &builtin_trampoline, Label::kNear);
1523
1524 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
1525 rbx, FieldOperand(rbx, InterpreterData::kInterpreterTrampolineOffset));
1526 __ addq(rbx, Immediate(Code::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag));
1527 __ jmp(&trampoline_loaded, Label::kNear);
1528
1529 __ bind(&builtin_trampoline);
1530 // TODO(jgruber): Replace this by a lookup in the builtin entry table.
1531 __ movq(rbx,
1532 __ ExternalReferenceAsOperand(
1533 ExternalReference::
1534 address_of_interpreter_entry_trampoline_instruction_start(
1535 masm->isolate()),
1536 kScratchRegister));
1537
1538 __ bind(&trampoline_loaded);
1539 __ addq(rbx, Immediate(interpreter_entry_return_pc_offset.value()));
1540 __ Push(rbx);
1541
1542 // Initialize dispatch table register.
1543 __ Move(
1544 kInterpreterDispatchTableRegister,
1545 ExternalReference::interpreter_dispatch_table_address(masm->isolate()));
1546
1547 // Get the bytecode array pointer from the frame.
1548 __ movq(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1549 Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeArrayFromFp));
1550
1551 if (FLAG_debug_code) {
1552 // Check function data field is actually a BytecodeArray object.
1553 __ AssertNotSmi(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister);
1554 __ CmpObjectType(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister, BYTECODE_ARRAY_TYPE,
1555 rbx);
1556 __ Assert(
1557 equal,
1558 AbortReason::kFunctionDataShouldBeBytecodeArrayOnInterpreterEntry);
1559 }
1560
1561 // Get the target bytecode offset from the frame.
1562 __ SmiUntag(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister,
1563 Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeOffsetFromFp));
1564
1565 if (FLAG_debug_code) {
1566 Label okay;
1567 __ cmpq(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister,
1568 Immediate(BytecodeArray::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag));
1569 __ j(greater_equal, &okay, Label::kNear);
1570 __ int3();
1571 __ bind(&okay);
1572 }
1573
1574 // Dispatch to the target bytecode.
1575 __ movzxbq(r11, Operand(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1576 kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister, times_1, 0));
1577 __ movq(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister,
1578 Operand(kInterpreterDispatchTableRegister, r11,
1579 times_system_pointer_size, 0));
1580 __ jmp(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister);
1581}
1582
1583void Builtins::Generate_InterpreterEnterBytecodeAdvance(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1584 // Get bytecode array and bytecode offset from the stack frame.
1585 __ movq(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1586 Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeArrayFromFp));
1587 __ SmiUntag(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister,
1588 Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeOffsetFromFp));
1589
1590 Label enter_bytecode, function_entry_bytecode;
1591 __ cmpq(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister,
1592 Immediate(BytecodeArray::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag +
1593 kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset));
1594 __ j(equal, &function_entry_bytecode);
1595
1596 // Load the current bytecode.
1597 __ movzxbq(rbx, Operand(kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1598 kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister, times_1, 0));
1599
1600 // Advance to the next bytecode.
1601 Label if_return;
1602 AdvanceBytecodeOffsetOrReturn(masm, kInterpreterBytecodeArrayRegister,
1603 kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister, rbx, rcx,
1604 r11, &if_return);
1605
1606 __ bind(&enter_bytecode);
1607 // Convert new bytecode offset to a Smi and save in the stackframe.
1608 __ SmiTag(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister);
1609 __ movq(Operand(rbp, InterpreterFrameConstants::kBytecodeOffsetFromFp),
1610 kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister);
1611
1612 Generate_InterpreterEnterBytecode(masm);
1613
1614 __ bind(&function_entry_bytecode);
1615 // If the code deoptimizes during the implicit function entry stack interrupt
1616 // check, it will have a bailout ID of kFunctionEntryBytecodeOffset, which is
1617 // not a valid bytecode offset. Detect this case and advance to the first
1618 // actual bytecode.
1619 __ movq(kInterpreterBytecodeOffsetRegister,
1620 Immediate(BytecodeArray::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag));
1621 __ jmp(&enter_bytecode);
1622
1623 // We should never take the if_return path.
1624 __ bind(&if_return);
1625 __ Abort(AbortReason::kInvalidBytecodeAdvance);
1626}
1627
1628void Builtins::Generate_InterpreterEnterBytecodeDispatch(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1629 Generate_InterpreterEnterBytecode(masm);
1630}
1631
1632namespace {
1633void Generate_ContinueToBuiltinHelper(MacroAssembler* masm,
1634 bool java_script_builtin,
1635 bool with_result) {
1636 const RegisterConfiguration* config(RegisterConfiguration::Default());
1637 int allocatable_register_count = config->num_allocatable_general_registers();
1638 if (with_result) {
1639#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1640 if (java_script_builtin) {
1641 // kScratchRegister is not included in the allocateable registers.
1642 __ movq(kScratchRegister, rax);
1643 } else {
1644 // Overwrite the hole inserted by the deoptimizer with the return value
1645 // from the LAZY deopt point.
1646 __ movq(
1647 Operand(rsp, config->num_allocatable_general_registers() *
1648 kSystemPointerSize +
1649 BuiltinContinuationFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSize),
1650 rax);
1651 }
1652#else
1653 // Overwrite the hole inserted by the deoptimizer with the return value from
1654 // the LAZY deopt point.
1655 __ movq(
1656 Operand(rsp, config->num_allocatable_general_registers() *
1657 kSystemPointerSize +
1658 BuiltinContinuationFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSize),
1659 rax);
1660#endif
1661 }
1662 for (int i = allocatable_register_count - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
1663 int code = config->GetAllocatableGeneralCode(i);
1664 __ popq(Register::from_code(code));
1665 if (java_script_builtin && code == kJavaScriptCallArgCountRegister.code()) {
1666 __ SmiUntag(Register::from_code(code));
1667 }
1668 }
1669#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1670 if (with_result && java_script_builtin) {
1671 // Overwrite the hole inserted by the deoptimizer with the return value from
1672 // the LAZY deopt point. rax contains the arguments count, the return value
1673 // from LAZY is always the last argument.
1674 __ movq(Operand(rsp, rax, times_system_pointer_size,
1675 BuiltinContinuationFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSize),
1676 kScratchRegister);
1677 }
1678#endif
1679 __ movq(
1680 rbp,
1681 Operand(rsp, BuiltinContinuationFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSizeFromFp));
1682 const int offsetToPC =
1683 BuiltinContinuationFrameConstants::kFixedFrameSizeFromFp -
1684 kSystemPointerSize;
1685 __ popq(Operand(rsp, offsetToPC));
1686 __ Drop(offsetToPC / kSystemPointerSize);
1687
1688 // Replace the builtin index Smi on the stack with the instruction start
1689 // address of the builtin from the builtins table, and then Ret to this
1690 // address
1691 __ movq(kScratchRegister, Operand(rsp, 0));
1692 __ movq(kScratchRegister,
1693 __ EntryFromBuiltinIndexAsOperand(kScratchRegister));
1694 __ movq(Operand(rsp, 0), kScratchRegister);
1695
1696 __ Ret();
1697}
1698} // namespace
1699
1700void Builtins::Generate_ContinueToCodeStubBuiltin(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1701 Generate_ContinueToBuiltinHelper(masm, false, false);
1702}
1703
1704void Builtins::Generate_ContinueToCodeStubBuiltinWithResult(
1705 MacroAssembler* masm) {
1706 Generate_ContinueToBuiltinHelper(masm, false, true);
1707}
1708
1709void Builtins::Generate_ContinueToJavaScriptBuiltin(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1710 Generate_ContinueToBuiltinHelper(masm, true, false);
1711}
1712
1713void Builtins::Generate_ContinueToJavaScriptBuiltinWithResult(
1714 MacroAssembler* masm) {
1715 Generate_ContinueToBuiltinHelper(masm, true, true);
1716}
1717
1718void Builtins::Generate_NotifyDeoptimized(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1719 // Enter an internal frame.
1720 {
1721 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
1722 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kNotifyDeoptimized);
1723 // Tear down internal frame.
1724 }
1725
1726 DCHECK_EQ(kInterpreterAccumulatorRegister.code(), rax.code())((void) 0);
1727 __ movq(rax, Operand(rsp, kPCOnStackSize));
1728 __ ret(1 * kSystemPointerSize); // Remove rax.
1729}
1730
1731// static
1732void Builtins::Generate_FunctionPrototypeApply(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1733 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
1734 // -- rax : argc
1735 // -- rsp[0] : return address
1736 // The order of args depends on V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1737 // -- args[0] : receiver
1738 // -- args[1] : thisArg
1739 // -- args[2] : argArray
1740 // -----------------------------------
1741
1742 // 1. Load receiver into rdi, argArray into rbx (if present), remove all
1743 // arguments from the stack (including the receiver), and push thisArg (if
1744 // present) instead.
1745 {
1746 Label no_arg_array, no_this_arg;
1747 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
1748 __ LoadRoot(rdx, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1749 __ movq(rbx, rdx);
1750 __ movq(rdi, args[0]);
1751 __ testq(rax, rax);
1752 __ j(zero, &no_this_arg, Label::kNear);
1753 {
1754 __ movq(rdx, args[1]);
1755 __ cmpq(rax, Immediate(1));
1756 __ j(equal, &no_arg_array, Label::kNear);
1757 __ movq(rbx, args[2]);
1758 __ bind(&no_arg_array);
1759 }
1760 __ bind(&no_this_arg);
1761 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
1762 __ leaq(rsp,
1763 Operand(rsp, rax, times_system_pointer_size, kSystemPointerSize));
1764 __ Push(rdx);
1765 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rcx);
1766 }
1767
1768 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
1769 // -- rbx : argArray
1770 // -- rdi : receiver
1771 // -- rsp[0] : return address
1772 // -- rsp[8] : thisArg
1773 // -----------------------------------
1774
1775 // 2. We don't need to check explicitly for callable receiver here,
1776 // since that's the first thing the Call/CallWithArrayLike builtins
1777 // will do.
1778
1779 // 3. Tail call with no arguments if argArray is null or undefined.
1780 Label no_arguments;
1781 __ JumpIfRoot(rbx, RootIndex::kNullValue, &no_arguments, Label::kNear);
1782 __ JumpIfRoot(rbx, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue, &no_arguments, Label::kNear);
1783
1784 // 4a. Apply the receiver to the given argArray.
1785 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), CallWithArrayLike)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kCallWithArrayLike),
1786 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1787
1788 // 4b. The argArray is either null or undefined, so we tail call without any
1789 // arguments to the receiver. Since we did not create a frame for
1790 // Function.prototype.apply() yet, we use a normal Call builtin here.
1791 __ bind(&no_arguments);
1792 {
1793 __ Set(rax, 0);
1794 __ Jump(masm->isolate()->builtins()->Call(), RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1795 }
1796}
1797
1798// static
1799void Builtins::Generate_FunctionPrototypeCall(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1800 // Stack Layout:
1801 // rsp[0] : Return address
1802 // rsp[8] : Argument n
1803 // rsp[16] : Argument n-1
1804 // ...
1805 // rsp[8 * n] : Argument 1
1806 // rsp[8 * (n + 1)] : Argument 0 (receiver: callable to call)
1807 // NOTE: The order of args are reversed if V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1808 // rax contains the number of arguments, n, not counting the receiver.
1809
1810#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1811 // 1. Get the callable to call (passed as receiver) from the stack.
1812 {
1813 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
1814 __ movq(rdi, args.GetReceiverOperand());
1815 }
1816
1817 // 2. Save the return address and drop the callable.
1818 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rbx);
1819 __ Pop(kScratchRegister);
1820
1821 // 3. Make sure we have at least one argument.
1822 {
1823 Label done;
1824 __ testq(rax, rax);
1825 __ j(not_zero, &done, Label::kNear);
1826 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1827 __ incq(rax);
1828 __ bind(&done);
1829 }
1830
1831 // 4. Push back the return address one slot down on the stack (overwriting the
1832 // original callable), making the original first argument the new receiver.
1833 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rbx);
1834 __ decq(rax); // One fewer argument (first argument is new receiver).
1835
1836#else
1837 // 1. Make sure we have at least one argument.
1838 {
1839 Label done;
1840 __ testq(rax, rax);
1841 __ j(not_zero, &done, Label::kNear);
1842 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rbx);
1843 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1844 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rbx);
1845 __ incq(rax);
1846 __ bind(&done);
1847 }
1848
1849 // 2. Get the callable to call (passed as receiver) from the stack.
1850 {
1851 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
1852 __ movq(rdi, args.GetReceiverOperand());
1853 }
1854
1855 // 3. Shift arguments and return address one slot down on the stack
1856 // (overwriting the original receiver). Adjust argument count to make
1857 // the original first argument the new receiver.
1858 {
1859 Label loop;
1860 __ movq(rcx, rax);
1861 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rcx);
1862 __ bind(&loop);
1863 __ movq(rbx, args[1]);
1864 __ movq(args[0], rbx);
1865 __ decq(rcx);
1866 __ j(not_zero, &loop); // While non-zero.
1867 __ DropUnderReturnAddress(1, rbx); // Drop one slot under return address.
1868 __ decq(rax); // One fewer argument (first argument is new receiver).
1869 }
1870#endif
1871
1872 // 4. Call the callable.
1873 // Since we did not create a frame for Function.prototype.call() yet,
1874 // we use a normal Call builtin here.
1875 __ Jump(masm->isolate()->builtins()->Call(), RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1876}
1877
1878void Builtins::Generate_ReflectApply(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1879 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
1880 // -- rax : argc
1881 // -- rsp[0] : return address
1882 // The order of args depends on V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1883 // -- args[0] : receiver
1884 // -- args[1] : target
1885 // -- args[2] : thisArgument
1886 // -- args[3] : argumentsList
1887 // -----------------------------------
1888
1889 // 1. Load target into rdi (if present), argumentsList into rbx (if present),
1890 // remove all arguments from the stack (including the receiver), and push
1891 // thisArgument (if present) instead.
1892 {
1893 Label done;
1894 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
1895 __ LoadRoot(rdi, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1896 __ movq(rdx, rdi);
1897 __ movq(rbx, rdi);
1898 __ cmpq(rax, Immediate(1));
1899 __ j(below, &done, Label::kNear);
1900 __ movq(rdi, args[1]); // target
1901 __ j(equal, &done, Label::kNear);
1902 __ movq(rdx, args[2]); // thisArgument
1903 __ cmpq(rax, Immediate(3));
1904 __ j(below, &done, Label::kNear);
1905 __ movq(rbx, args[3]); // argumentsList
1906 __ bind(&done);
1907 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
1908 __ leaq(rsp,
1909 Operand(rsp, rax, times_system_pointer_size, kSystemPointerSize));
1910 __ Push(rdx);
1911 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rcx);
1912 }
1913
1914 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
1915 // -- rbx : argumentsList
1916 // -- rdi : target
1917 // -- rsp[0] : return address
1918 // -- rsp[8] : thisArgument
1919 // -----------------------------------
1920
1921 // 2. We don't need to check explicitly for callable target here,
1922 // since that's the first thing the Call/CallWithArrayLike builtins
1923 // will do.
1924
1925 // 3. Apply the target to the given argumentsList.
1926 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), CallWithArrayLike)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kCallWithArrayLike),
1927 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1928}
1929
1930void Builtins::Generate_ReflectConstruct(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1931 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
1932 // -- rax : argc
1933 // -- rsp[0] : return address
1934 // The order of args depends on V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
1935 // -- args[0] : receiver
1936 // -- args[1] : target
1937 // -- args[2] : argumentsList
1938 // -- args[3] : new.target (optional)
1939 // -----------------------------------
1940
1941 // 1. Load target into rdi (if present), argumentsList into rbx (if present),
1942 // new.target into rdx (if present, otherwise use target), remove all
1943 // arguments from the stack (including the receiver), and push thisArgument
1944 // (if present) instead.
1945 {
1946 Label done;
1947 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
1948 __ LoadRoot(rdi, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1949 __ movq(rdx, rdi);
1950 __ movq(rbx, rdi);
1951 __ cmpq(rax, Immediate(1));
1952 __ j(below, &done, Label::kNear);
1953 __ movq(rdi, args[1]); // target
1954 __ movq(rdx, rdi); // new.target defaults to target
1955 __ j(equal, &done, Label::kNear);
1956 __ movq(rbx, args[2]); // argumentsList
1957 __ cmpq(rax, Immediate(3));
1958 __ j(below, &done, Label::kNear);
1959 __ movq(rdx, args[3]); // new.target
1960 __ bind(&done);
1961 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
1962 __ leaq(rsp,
1963 Operand(rsp, rax, times_system_pointer_size, kSystemPointerSize));
1964 __ PushRoot(RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
1965 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rcx);
1966 }
1967
1968 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
1969 // -- rbx : argumentsList
1970 // -- rdx : new.target
1971 // -- rdi : target
1972 // -- rsp[0] : return address
1973 // -- rsp[8] : receiver (undefined)
1974 // -----------------------------------
1975
1976 // 2. We don't need to check explicitly for constructor target here,
1977 // since that's the first thing the Construct/ConstructWithArrayLike
1978 // builtins will do.
1979
1980 // 3. We don't need to check explicitly for constructor new.target here,
1981 // since that's the second thing the Construct/ConstructWithArrayLike
1982 // builtins will do.
1983
1984 // 4. Construct the target with the given new.target and argumentsList.
1985 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), ConstructWithArrayLike)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstructWithArrayLike),
1986 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
1987}
1988
1989static void EnterArgumentsAdaptorFrame(MacroAssembler* masm) {
1990 __ pushq(rbp);
1991 __ movq(rbp, rsp);
1992
1993 // Store the arguments adaptor context sentinel.
1994 __ Push(Immediate(StackFrame::TypeToMarker(StackFrame::ARGUMENTS_ADAPTOR)));
1995
1996 // Push the function on the stack.
1997 __ Push(rdi);
1998
1999 // Preserve the number of arguments on the stack. Must preserve rax,
2000 // rbx and rcx because these registers are used when copying the
2001 // arguments and the receiver.
2002 __ SmiTag(r8, rax);
2003 __ Push(r8);
2004
2005 __ Push(Immediate(0)); // Padding.
2006}
2007
2008static void LeaveArgumentsAdaptorFrame(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2009 // Retrieve the number of arguments from the stack. Number is a Smi.
2010 __ movq(rbx, Operand(rbp, ArgumentsAdaptorFrameConstants::kLengthOffset));
2011
2012 // Leave the frame.
2013 __ movq(rsp, rbp);
2014 __ popq(rbp);
2015
2016 // Remove caller arguments from the stack.
2017 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
2018 SmiIndex index = masm->SmiToIndex(rbx, rbx, kSystemPointerSizeLog2);
2019 __ leaq(rsp, Operand(rsp, index.reg, index.scale, 1 * kSystemPointerSize));
2020 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rcx);
2021}
2022
2023void Builtins::Generate_ArgumentsAdaptorTrampoline(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2024 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2025 // -- rax : actual number of arguments
2026 // -- rbx : expected number of arguments
2027 // -- rdx : new target (passed through to callee)
2028 // -- rdi : function (passed through to callee)
2029 // -----------------------------------
2030
2031 Label dont_adapt_arguments, stack_overflow, skip_adapt_arguments;
2032 __ cmpq(rbx, Immediate(kDontAdaptArgumentsSentinel));
2033 __ j(equal, &dont_adapt_arguments);
2034 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2035 rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
2036
2037#ifndef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2038 // This optimization is disabled when the arguments are reversed.
2039 __ testl(
2040 FieldOperand(rcx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFlagsOffset),
2041 Immediate(SharedFunctionInfo::IsSafeToSkipArgumentsAdaptorBit::kMask));
2042 __ j(not_zero, &skip_adapt_arguments);
2043#endif
2044
2045 // -------------------------------------------
2046 // Adapt arguments.
2047 // -------------------------------------------
2048 {
2049 EnterArgumentsAdaptorFrame(masm);
2050 Generate_StackOverflowCheck(masm, rbx, rcx, &stack_overflow);
2051
2052 Label under_application, over_application, invoke;
2053 __ cmpq(rax, rbx);
2054 __ j(less, &under_application, Label::kNear);
2055
