2056 // Enough parameters: Actual >= expected.
2057 __ bind(&over_application);
2058 {
2059 // Copy receiver and all expected arguments.
2060 const int offset = StandardFrameConstants::kCallerSPOffset;
2061#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2062 __ leaq(r8, Operand(rbp, rbx, times_system_pointer_size, offset));
2063#else
2064 __ leaq(r8, Operand(rbp, rax, times_system_pointer_size, offset));
2065#endif
2066 __ Set(rax, -1); // account for receiver
2067
2068 Label copy;
2069 __ bind(&copy);
2070 __ incq(rax);
2071 __ Push(Operand(r8, 0));
2072 __ subq(r8, Immediate(kSystemPointerSize));
2073 __ cmpq(rax, rbx);
2074 __ j(less, &copy);
2075 __ jmp(&invoke, Label::kNear);
2076 }
2077
2078 // Too few parameters: Actual < expected.
2079 __ bind(&under_application);
2080 {
2081#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2082 // Fill remaining expected arguments with undefined values.
2083 Label fill;
2084 __ LoadRoot(kScratchRegister, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
2085 __ movq(r8, rbx);
2086 __ subq(r8, rax);
2087 __ bind(&fill);
2088 __ Push(kScratchRegister);
2089 __ decq(r8);
2090 __ j(greater, &fill);
2091
2092 // Copy receiver and all actual arguments.
2093 const int offset = StandardFrameConstants::kCallerSPOffset;
2094 __ leaq(r9, Operand(rbp, rax, times_system_pointer_size, offset));
2095 __ Set(r8, -1); // account for receiver
2096
2097 Label copy;
2098 __ bind(&copy);
2099 __ incq(r8);
2100 __ Push(Operand(r9, 0));
2101 __ subq(r9, Immediate(kSystemPointerSize));
2102 __ cmpq(r8, rax);
2103 __ j(less, &copy);
2104
2105 // Update actual number of arguments.
2106 __ movq(rax, rbx);
2107#else // !V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2108 // Copy receiver and all actual arguments.
2109 const int offset = StandardFrameConstants::kCallerSPOffset;
2110 __ leaq(r9, Operand(rbp, rax, times_system_pointer_size, offset));
2111 __ Set(r8, -1); // account for receiver
2112
2113 Label copy;
2114 __ bind(&copy);
2115 __ incq(r8);
2116 __ Push(Operand(r9, 0));
2117 __ subq(r9, Immediate(kSystemPointerSize));
2118 __ cmpq(r8, rax);
2119 __ j(less, &copy);
2120
2121 // Fill remaining expected arguments with undefined values.
2122 Label fill;
2123 __ LoadRoot(kScratchRegister, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
2124 __ bind(&fill);
2125 __ incq(rax);
2126 __ Push(kScratchRegister);
2127 __ cmpq(rax, rbx);
2128 __ j(less, &fill);
2129#endif // !V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2130 }
2131
2132 // Call the entry point.
2133 __ bind(&invoke);
2134 // rax : expected number of arguments
2135 // rdx : new target (passed through to callee)
2136 // rdi : function (passed through to callee)
2137 static_assert(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister == rcx, "ABI mismatch");
2138 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kCodeOffset));
2139 __ CallCodeObject(rcx);
2140
2141 // Store offset of return address for deoptimizer.
2142 masm->isolate()->heap()->SetArgumentsAdaptorDeoptPCOffset(
2143 masm->pc_offset());
2144
2145 // Leave frame and return.
2146 LeaveArgumentsAdaptorFrame(masm);
2147 __ ret(0);
2148 }
2149
2150 // -------------------------------------------
2151 // Skip adapt arguments.
2152 // -------------------------------------------
2153 __ bind(&skip_adapt_arguments);
2154 {
2155 // The callee cannot observe the actual arguments, so it's safe to just
2156 // pass the expected arguments by massaging the stack appropriately. See
2157 // http://bit.ly/v8-faster-calls-with-arguments-mismatch for details.
2158 Label under_application, over_application, invoke;
2159 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
2160 __ cmpq(rax, rbx);
2161 __ j(less, &under_application, Label::kNear);
2162
2163 __ bind(&over_application);
2164 {
2165 // Remove superfluous parameters from the stack.
2166 __ xchgq(rax, rbx);
2167 __ subq(rbx, rax);
2168 __ leaq(rsp, Operand(rsp, rbx, times_system_pointer_size, 0));
2169 __ jmp(&invoke, Label::kNear);
2170 }
2171
2172 __ bind(&under_application);
2173 {
2174 // Fill remaining expected arguments with undefined values.
2175 Label fill;
2176 __ LoadRoot(kScratchRegister, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
2177 __ bind(&fill);
2178 __ incq(rax);
2179 __ Push(kScratchRegister);
2180 __ cmpq(rax, rbx);
2181 __ j(less, &fill);
2182 }
2183
2184 __ bind(&invoke);
2185 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rcx);
2186 }
2187
2188 // -------------------------------------------
2189 // Don't adapt arguments.
2190 // -------------------------------------------
2191 __ bind(&dont_adapt_arguments);
2192 static_assert(kJavaScriptCallCodeStartRegister == rcx, "ABI mismatch");
2193 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kCodeOffset));
2194 __ JumpCodeObject(rcx);
2195
2196 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
2197 {
2198 FrameScope frame(masm, StackFrame::MANUAL);
2199 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
2200 __ int3();
2201 }
2202}
2203
2204// static
2205void Builtins::Generate_CallOrConstructVarargs(MacroAssembler* masm,
2206 Handle<Code> code) {
2207 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2208 // -- rdi : target
2209 // -- rax : number of parameters on the stack (not including the receiver)
2210 // -- rbx : arguments list (a FixedArray)
2211 // -- rcx : len (number of elements to push from args)
2212 // -- rdx : new.target (for [[Construct]])
2213 // -- rsp[0] : return address
2214 // -----------------------------------
2215 Register scratch = r11;
2216
2217 if (masm->emit_debug_code()) {
2218 // Allow rbx to be a FixedArray, or a FixedDoubleArray if rcx == 0.
2219 Label ok, fail;
2220 __ AssertNotSmi(rbx);
2221 Register map = r9;
2222 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(map, FieldOperand(rbx, HeapObject::kMapOffset));
2223 __ CmpInstanceType(map, FIXED_ARRAY_TYPE);
2224 __ j(equal, &ok);
2225 __ CmpInstanceType(map, FIXED_DOUBLE_ARRAY_TYPE);
2226 __ j(not_equal, &fail);
2227 __ cmpl(rcx, Immediate(0));
2228 __ j(equal, &ok);
2229 // Fall through.
2230 __ bind(&fail);
2231 __ Abort(AbortReason::kOperandIsNotAFixedArray);
2232
2233 __ bind(&ok);
2234 }
2235
2236 Label stack_overflow;
2237 Generate_StackOverflowCheck(masm, rcx, r8, &stack_overflow, Label::kNear);
2238
2239 // Push additional arguments onto the stack.
2240#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2241 // Move the arguments already in the stack,
2242 // including the receiver and the return address.
2243 {
2244 Label copy, check;
2245 Register src = r8, dest = rsp, num = r9, current = r11;
2246 __ movq(src, rsp);
2247 __ leaq(kScratchRegister, Operand(rcx, times_system_pointer_size, 0));
2248 __ AllocateStackSpace(kScratchRegister);
2249 __ leaq(num, Operand(rax, 2)); // Number of words to copy.
2250 // +2 for receiver and return address.
2251 __ Set(current, 0);
2252 __ jmp(&check);
2253 __ bind(&copy);
2254 __ movq(kScratchRegister,
2255 Operand(src, current, times_system_pointer_size, 0));
2256 __ movq(Operand(dest, current, times_system_pointer_size, 0),
2257 kScratchRegister);
2258 __ incq(current);
2259 __ bind(&check);
2260 __ cmpq(current, num);
2261 __ j(less, &copy);
2262 __ leaq(r8, Operand(rsp, num, times_system_pointer_size, 0));
2263 }
2264
2265 // Copy the additional arguments onto the stack.
2266 {
2267 Register value = scratch;
2268 Register src = rbx, dest = r8, num = rcx, current = r9;
2269 __ Set(current, 0);
2270 Label done, push, loop;
2271 __ bind(&loop);
2272 __ cmpl(current, num);
2273 __ j(equal, &done, Label::kNear);
2274 // Turn the hole into undefined as we go.
2275 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(value, FieldOperand(src, current, times_tagged_size,
2276 FixedArray::kHeaderSize));
2277 __ CompareRoot(value, RootIndex::kTheHoleValue);
2278 __ j(not_equal, &push, Label::kNear);
2279 __ LoadRoot(value, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
2280 __ bind(&push);
2281 __ movq(Operand(dest, current, times_system_pointer_size, 0), value);
2282 __ incl(current);
2283 __ jmp(&loop);
2284 __ bind(&done);
2285 __ addq(rax, current);
2286 }
2287#else // !V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2288 {
2289 Register value = scratch;
2290 __ PopReturnAddressTo(r8);
2291 __ Set(r9, 0);
2292 Label done, push, loop;
2293 __ bind(&loop);
2294 __ cmpl(r9, rcx);
2295 __ j(equal, &done, Label::kNear);
2296 // Turn the hole into undefined as we go.
2297 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(value, FieldOperand(rbx, r9, times_tagged_size,
2298 FixedArray::kHeaderSize));
2299 __ CompareRoot(value, RootIndex::kTheHoleValue);
2300 __ j(not_equal, &push, Label::kNear);
2301 __ LoadRoot(value, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
2302 __ bind(&push);
2303 __ Push(value);
2304 __ incl(r9);
2305 __ jmp(&loop);
2306 __ bind(&done);
2307 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(r8);
2308 __ addq(rax, r9);
2309 }
2310#endif
2311
2312 // Tail-call to the actual Call or Construct builtin.
2313 __ Jump(code, RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2314
2315 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
2316 __ TailCallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
2317}
2318
2319// static
2320void Builtins::Generate_CallOrConstructForwardVarargs(MacroAssembler* masm,
2321 CallOrConstructMode mode,
2322 Handle<Code> code) {
2323 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2324 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2325 // -- rdx : the new target (for [[Construct]] calls)
2326 // -- rdi : the target to call (can be any Object)
2327 // -- rcx : start index (to support rest parameters)
2328 // -----------------------------------
2329
2330 // Check if new.target has a [[Construct]] internal method.
2331 if (mode == CallOrConstructMode::kConstruct) {
2332 Label new_target_constructor, new_target_not_constructor;
2333 __ JumpIfSmi(rdx, &new_target_not_constructor, Label::kNear);
2334 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rbx, FieldOperand(rdx, HeapObject::kMapOffset));
2335 __ testb(FieldOperand(rbx, Map::kBitFieldOffset),
2336 Immediate(Map::Bits1::IsConstructorBit::kMask));
2337 __ j(not_zero, &new_target_constructor, Label::kNear);
2338 __ bind(&new_target_not_constructor);
2339 {
2340 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::MANUAL);
2341 __ EnterFrame(StackFrame::INTERNAL);
2342 __ Push(rdx);
2343 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowNotConstructor);
2344 }
2345 __ bind(&new_target_constructor);
2346 }
2347
2348 // Check if we have an arguments adaptor frame below the function frame.
2349 Label arguments_adaptor, arguments_done;
2350 __ movq(rbx, Operand(rbp, StandardFrameConstants::kCallerFPOffset));
2351 __ cmpq(Operand(rbx, CommonFrameConstants::kContextOrFrameTypeOffset),
2352 Immediate(StackFrame::TypeToMarker(StackFrame::ARGUMENTS_ADAPTOR)));
2353 __ j(equal, &arguments_adaptor, Label::kNear);
2354 {
2355 __ movq(r8, Operand(rbp, StandardFrameConstants::kFunctionOffset));
2356 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2357 r8, FieldOperand(r8, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
2358 __ movzxwq(
2359 r8, FieldOperand(r8, SharedFunctionInfo::kFormalParameterCountOffset));
2360 __ movq(rbx, rbp);
2361 }
2362 __ jmp(&arguments_done, Label::kNear);
2363 __ bind(&arguments_adaptor);
2364 {
2365 __ SmiUntag(r8,
2366 Operand(rbx, ArgumentsAdaptorFrameConstants::kLengthOffset));
2367 }
2368 __ bind(&arguments_done);
2369
2370 Label stack_done, stack_overflow;
2371 __ subl(r8, rcx);
2372 __ j(less_equal, &stack_done);
2373 {
2374 // Check for stack overflow.
2375 Generate_StackOverflowCheck(masm, r8, rcx, &stack_overflow, Label::kNear);
2376
2377 // Forward the arguments from the caller frame.
2378 {
2379 Label loop;
2380 __ addl(rax, r8);
2381 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
2382#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2383 // The new receiver is already on the stack. Save it to push it later.
2384 __ Pop(kScratchRegister);
2385#endif
2386 __ bind(&loop);
2387 {
2388 __ decl(r8);
2389#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2390 // Skips the old receiver.
2391 __ Push(Operand(rbx, r8, times_system_pointer_size,
2392 kFPOnStackSize + kPCOnStackSize + kSystemPointerSize));
2393#else
2394 __ Push(Operand(rbx, r8, times_system_pointer_size,
2395 kFPOnStackSize + kPCOnStackSize));
2396#endif
2397 __ j(not_zero, &loop);
2398 }
2399#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2400 // Recover the new receiver.
2401 __ Push(kScratchRegister);
2402#endif
2403 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rcx);
2404 }
2405 }
2406 __ jmp(&stack_done, Label::kNear);
2407 __ bind(&stack_overflow);
2408 __ TailCallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
2409 __ bind(&stack_done);
2410
2411 // Tail-call to the {code} handler.
2412 __ Jump(code, RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2413}
2414
2415// static
2416void Builtins::Generate_CallFunction(MacroAssembler* masm,
2417 ConvertReceiverMode mode) {
2418 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2419 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2420 // -- rdi : the function to call (checked to be a JSFunction)
2421 // -----------------------------------
2422
2423 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
2424 __ AssertFunction(rdi);
2425
2426 // ES6 section 9.2.1 [[Call]] ( thisArgument, argumentsList)
2427 // Check that the function is not a "classConstructor".
2428 Label class_constructor;
2429 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2430 rdx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
2431 __ testl(FieldOperand(rdx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFlagsOffset),
2432 Immediate(SharedFunctionInfo::IsClassConstructorBit::kMask));
2433 __ j(not_zero, &class_constructor);
2434
2435 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2436 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2437 // -- rdx : the shared function info.
2438 // -- rdi : the function to call (checked to be a JSFunction)
2439 // -----------------------------------
2440
2441 // Enter the context of the function; ToObject has to run in the function
2442 // context, and we also need to take the global proxy from the function
2443 // context in case of conversion.
2444 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rsi, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kContextOffset));
2445 // We need to convert the receiver for non-native sloppy mode functions.
2446 Label done_convert;
2447 __ testl(FieldOperand(rdx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFlagsOffset),
2448 Immediate(SharedFunctionInfo::IsNativeBit::kMask |
2449 SharedFunctionInfo::IsStrictBit::kMask));
2450 __ j(not_zero, &done_convert);
2451 {
2452 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2453 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2454 // -- rdx : the shared function info.
2455 // -- rdi : the function to call (checked to be a JSFunction)
2456 // -- rsi : the function context.
2457 // -----------------------------------
2458
2459 if (mode == ConvertReceiverMode::kNullOrUndefined) {
2460 // Patch receiver to global proxy.
2461 __ LoadGlobalProxy(rcx);
2462 } else {
2463 Label convert_to_object, convert_receiver;
2464 __ movq(rcx, args.GetReceiverOperand());
2465 __ JumpIfSmi(rcx, &convert_to_object, Label::kNear);
2466 STATIC_ASSERT(LAST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE == LAST_TYPE)static_assert(LAST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE == LAST_TYPE, "LAST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE == LAST_TYPE"
);
2467 __ CmpObjectType(rcx, FIRST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE, rbx);
2468 __ j(above_equal, &done_convert);
2469 if (mode != ConvertReceiverMode::kNotNullOrUndefined) {
2470 Label convert_global_proxy;
2471 __ JumpIfRoot(rcx, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue, &convert_global_proxy,
2472 Label::kNear);
2473 __ JumpIfNotRoot(rcx, RootIndex::kNullValue, &convert_to_object,
2474 Label::kNear);
2475 __ bind(&convert_global_proxy);
2476 {
2477 // Patch receiver to global proxy.
2478 __ LoadGlobalProxy(rcx);
2479 }
2480 __ jmp(&convert_receiver);
2481 }
2482 __ bind(&convert_to_object);
2483 {
2484 // Convert receiver using ToObject.
2485 // TODO(bmeurer): Inline the allocation here to avoid building the frame
2486 // in the fast case? (fall back to AllocateInNewSpace?)
2487 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
2488 __ SmiTag(rax);
2489 __ Push(rax);
2490 __ Push(rdi);
2491 __ movq(rax, rcx);
2492 __ Push(rsi);
2493 __ Call(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), ToObject)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kToObject),
2494 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2495 __ Pop(rsi);
2496 __ movq(rcx, rax);
2497 __ Pop(rdi);
2498 __ Pop(rax);
2499 __ SmiUntag(rax);
2500 }
2501 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2502 rdx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
2503 __ bind(&convert_receiver);
2504 }
2505 __ movq(args.GetReceiverOperand(), rcx);
2506 }
2507 __ bind(&done_convert);
2508
2509 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2510 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2511 // -- rdx : the shared function info.
2512 // -- rdi : the function to call (checked to be a JSFunction)
2513 // -- rsi : the function context.
2514 // -----------------------------------
2515
2516 __ movzxwq(
2517 rbx, FieldOperand(rdx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFormalParameterCountOffset));
2518
2519 __ InvokeFunctionCode(rdi, no_reg, rbx, rax, JUMP_FUNCTION);
2520
2521 // The function is a "classConstructor", need to raise an exception.
2522 __ bind(&class_constructor);
2523 {
2524 FrameScope frame(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
2525 __ Push(rdi);
2526 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowConstructorNonCallableError);
2527 }
2528}
2529
2530namespace {
2531
2532void Generate_PushBoundArguments(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2533 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2534 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2535 // -- rdx : new.target (only in case of [[Construct]])
2536 // -- rdi : target (checked to be a JSBoundFunction)
2537 // -----------------------------------
2538
2539 // Load [[BoundArguments]] into rcx and length of that into rbx.
2540 Label no_bound_arguments;
2541 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2542 rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSBoundFunction::kBoundArgumentsOffset));
2543 __ SmiUntagField(rbx, FieldOperand(rcx, FixedArray::kLengthOffset));
2544 __ testl(rbx, rbx);
2545 __ j(zero, &no_bound_arguments);
2546 {
2547 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2548 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2549 // -- rdx : new.target (only in case of [[Construct]])
2550 // -- rdi : target (checked to be a JSBoundFunction)
2551 // -- rcx : the [[BoundArguments]] (implemented as FixedArray)
2552 // -- rbx : the number of [[BoundArguments]] (checked to be non-zero)
2553 // -----------------------------------
2554
2555 // TODO(victor): Use Generate_StackOverflowCheck here.
2556 // Check the stack for overflow.
2557 {
2558 Label done;
2559 __ shlq(rbx, Immediate(kSystemPointerSizeLog2));
2560 __ movq(kScratchRegister, rsp);
2561 __ subq(kScratchRegister, rbx);
2562
2563 // We are not trying to catch interruptions (i.e. debug break and
2564 // preemption) here, so check the "real stack limit".
2565 __ cmpq(kScratchRegister,
2566 StackLimitAsOperand(masm, StackLimitKind::kRealStackLimit));
2567 __ j(above_equal, &done, Label::kNear);
2568 {
2569 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::MANUAL);
2570 __ EnterFrame(StackFrame::INTERNAL);
2571 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowStackOverflow);
2572 }
2573 __ bind(&done);
2574 }
2575
2576#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2577 // Save Return Address and Receiver into registers.
2578 __ Pop(r8);
2579 __ Pop(r10);
2580
2581 // Push [[BoundArguments]] to the stack.
2582 {
2583 Label loop;
2584 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2585 rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSBoundFunction::kBoundArgumentsOffset));
2586 __ SmiUntagField(rbx, FieldOperand(rcx, FixedArray::kLengthOffset));
2587 __ addq(rax, rbx); // Adjust effective number of arguments.
2588 __ bind(&loop);
2589 // Instead of doing decl(rbx) here subtract kTaggedSize from the header
2590 // offset in order to be able to move decl(rbx) right before the loop
2591 // condition. This is necessary in order to avoid flags corruption by
2592 // pointer decompression code.
2593 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(
2594 r12, FieldOperand(rcx, rbx, times_tagged_size,
2595 FixedArray::kHeaderSize - kTaggedSize));
2596 __ Push(r12);
2597 __ decl(rbx);
2598 __ j(greater, &loop);
2599 }
2600
2601 // Recover Receiver and Return Address.
2602 __ Push(r10);
2603 __ Push(r8);
2604#else // !V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2605 // Reserve stack space for the [[BoundArguments]].
2606 __ movq(kScratchRegister, rbx);
2607 __ AllocateStackSpace(kScratchRegister);
2608
2609 // Adjust effective number of arguments to include return address.
2610 __ incl(rax);
2611
2612 // Relocate arguments and return address down the stack.
2613 {
2614 Label loop;
2615 __ Set(rcx, 0);
2616 __ addq(rbx, rsp);
2617 __ bind(&loop);
2618 __ movq(kScratchRegister,
2619 Operand(rbx, rcx, times_system_pointer_size, 0));
2620 __ movq(Operand(rsp, rcx, times_system_pointer_size, 0),
2621 kScratchRegister);
2622 __ incl(rcx);
2623 __ cmpl(rcx, rax);
2624 __ j(less, &loop);
2625 }
2626
2627 // Copy [[BoundArguments]] to the stack (below the arguments).
2628 {
2629 Label loop;
2630 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2631 rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSBoundFunction::kBoundArgumentsOffset));
2632 __ SmiUntagField(rbx, FieldOperand(rcx, FixedArray::kLengthOffset));
2633 __ bind(&loop);
2634 // Instead of doing decl(rbx) here subtract kTaggedSize from the header
2635 // offset in order be able to move decl(rbx) right before the loop
2636 // condition. This is necessary in order to avoid flags corruption by
2637 // pointer decompression code.
2638 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(
2639 r12, FieldOperand(rcx, rbx, times_tagged_size,
2640 FixedArray::kHeaderSize - kTaggedSize));
2641 __ movq(Operand(rsp, rax, times_system_pointer_size, 0), r12);
2642 __ leal(rax, Operand(rax, 1));
2643 __ decl(rbx);
2644 __ j(greater, &loop);
2645 }
2646
2647 // Adjust effective number of arguments (rax contains the number of
2648 // arguments from the call plus return address plus the number of
2649 // [[BoundArguments]]), so we need to subtract one for the return address.
2650 __ decl(rax);
2651#endif // !V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
2652 }
2653 __ bind(&no_bound_arguments);
2654}
2655
2656} // namespace
2657
2658// static
2659void Builtins::Generate_CallBoundFunctionImpl(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2660 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2661 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2662 // -- rdi : the function to call (checked to be a JSBoundFunction)
2663 // -----------------------------------
2664 __ AssertBoundFunction(rdi);
2665
2666 // Patch the receiver to [[BoundThis]].
2667 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
2668 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(rbx,
2669 FieldOperand(rdi, JSBoundFunction::kBoundThisOffset));
2670 __ movq(args.GetReceiverOperand(), rbx);
2671
2672 // Push the [[BoundArguments]] onto the stack.
2673 Generate_PushBoundArguments(masm);
2674
2675 // Call the [[BoundTargetFunction]] via the Call builtin.
2676 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2677 rdi, FieldOperand(rdi, JSBoundFunction::kBoundTargetFunctionOffset));
2678 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), Call_ReceiverIsAny)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kCall_ReceiverIsAny),
2679 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2680}
2681
2682// static
2683void Builtins::Generate_Call(MacroAssembler* masm, ConvertReceiverMode mode) {
2684 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2685 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2686 // -- rdi : the target to call (can be any Object)
2687 // -----------------------------------
2688 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
2689
2690 Label non_callable;
2691 __ JumpIfSmi(rdi, &non_callable);
2692 __ CmpObjectType(rdi, JS_FUNCTION_TYPE, rcx);
2693 __ Jump(masm->isolate()->builtins()->CallFunction(mode),
2694 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET, equal);
2695
2696 __ CmpInstanceType(rcx, JS_BOUND_FUNCTION_TYPE);
2697 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), CallBoundFunction)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kCallBoundFunction),
2698 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET, equal);
2699
2700 // Check if target has a [[Call]] internal method.
2701 __ testb(FieldOperand(rcx, Map::kBitFieldOffset),
2702 Immediate(Map::Bits1::IsCallableBit::kMask));
2703 __ j(zero, &non_callable, Label::kNear);
2704
2705 // Check if target is a proxy and call CallProxy external builtin
2706 __ CmpInstanceType(rcx, JS_PROXY_TYPE);
2707 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), CallProxy)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kCallProxy), RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET,
2708 equal);
2709
2710 // 2. Call to something else, which might have a [[Call]] internal method (if
2711 // not we raise an exception).
2712
2713 // Overwrite the original receiver with the (original) target.
2714 __ movq(args.GetReceiverOperand(), rdi);
2715 // Let the "call_as_function_delegate" take care of the rest.
2716 __ LoadNativeContextSlot(Context::CALL_AS_FUNCTION_DELEGATE_INDEX, rdi);
2717 __ Jump(masm->isolate()->builtins()->CallFunction(
2718 ConvertReceiverMode::kNotNullOrUndefined),
2719 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2720
2721 // 3. Call to something that is not callable.
2722 __ bind(&non_callable);
2723 {
2724 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
2725 __ Push(rdi);
2726 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kThrowCalledNonCallable);
2727 }
2728}
2729
2730// static
2731void Builtins::Generate_ConstructFunction(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2732 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2733 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2734 // -- rdx : the new target (checked to be a constructor)
2735 // -- rdi : the constructor to call (checked to be a JSFunction)
2736 // -----------------------------------
2737 __ AssertConstructor(rdi);
2738 __ AssertFunction(rdi);
2739
2740 // Calling convention for function specific ConstructStubs require
2741 // rbx to contain either an AllocationSite or undefined.
2742 __ LoadRoot(rbx, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
2743
2744 // Jump to JSBuiltinsConstructStub or JSConstructStubGeneric.
2745 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2746 rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSFunction::kSharedFunctionInfoOffset));
2747 __ testl(FieldOperand(rcx, SharedFunctionInfo::kFlagsOffset),
2748 Immediate(SharedFunctionInfo::ConstructAsBuiltinBit::kMask));
2749 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), JSBuiltinsConstructStub)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kJSBuiltinsConstructStub),
2750 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET, not_zero);
2751
2752 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), JSConstructStubGeneric)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kJSConstructStubGeneric),
2753 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2754}
2755
2756// static
2757void Builtins::Generate_ConstructBoundFunction(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2758 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2759 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2760 // -- rdx : the new target (checked to be a constructor)
2761 // -- rdi : the constructor to call (checked to be a JSBoundFunction)
2762 // -----------------------------------
2763 __ AssertConstructor(rdi);
2764 __ AssertBoundFunction(rdi);
2765
2766 // Push the [[BoundArguments]] onto the stack.
2767 Generate_PushBoundArguments(masm);
2768
2769 // Patch new.target to [[BoundTargetFunction]] if new.target equals target.
2770 {
2771 Label done;
2772 __ cmpq(rdi, rdx);
2773 __ j(not_equal, &done, Label::kNear);
2774 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2775 rdx, FieldOperand(rdi, JSBoundFunction::kBoundTargetFunctionOffset));
2776 __ bind(&done);
2777 }
2778
2779 // Construct the [[BoundTargetFunction]] via the Construct builtin.
2780 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
2781 rdi, FieldOperand(rdi, JSBoundFunction::kBoundTargetFunctionOffset));
2782 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), Construct)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstruct), RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2783}
2784
2785// static
2786void Builtins::Generate_Construct(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2787 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
2788 // -- rax : the number of arguments (not including the receiver)
2789 // -- rdx : the new target (either the same as the constructor or
2790 // the JSFunction on which new was invoked initially)
2791 // -- rdi : the constructor to call (can be any Object)
2792 // -----------------------------------
2793 StackArgumentsAccessor args(rax);
2794
2795 // Check if target is a Smi.
2796 Label non_constructor;
2797 __ JumpIfSmi(rdi, &non_constructor);
2798
2799 // Check if target has a [[Construct]] internal method.
2800 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rcx, FieldOperand(rdi, HeapObject::kMapOffset));
2801 __ testb(FieldOperand(rcx, Map::kBitFieldOffset),
2802 Immediate(Map::Bits1::IsConstructorBit::kMask));
2803 __ j(zero, &non_constructor);
2804
2805 // Dispatch based on instance type.
2806 __ CmpInstanceType(rcx, JS_FUNCTION_TYPE);
2807 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), ConstructFunction)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstructFunction),
2808 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET, equal);
2809
2810 // Only dispatch to bound functions after checking whether they are
2811 // constructors.
2812 __ CmpInstanceType(rcx, JS_BOUND_FUNCTION_TYPE);
2813 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), ConstructBoundFunction)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstructBoundFunction),
2814 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET, equal);
2815
2816 // Only dispatch to proxies after checking whether they are constructors.
2817 __ CmpInstanceType(rcx, JS_PROXY_TYPE);
2818 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), ConstructProxy)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstructProxy), RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET,
2819 equal);
2820
2821 // Called Construct on an exotic Object with a [[Construct]] internal method.
2822 {
2823 // Overwrite the original receiver with the (original) target.
2824 __ movq(args.GetReceiverOperand(), rdi);
2825 // Let the "call_as_constructor_delegate" take care of the rest.
2826 __ LoadNativeContextSlot(Context::CALL_AS_CONSTRUCTOR_DELEGATE_INDEX, rdi);
2827 __ Jump(masm->isolate()->builtins()->CallFunction(),
2828 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2829 }
2830
2831 // Called Construct on an Object that doesn't have a [[Construct]] internal
2832 // method.
2833 __ bind(&non_constructor);
2834 __ Jump(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), ConstructedNonConstructable)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kConstructedNonConstructable),
2835 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
2836}
2837
2838void Builtins::Generate_InterpreterOnStackReplacement(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2839 {
2840 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::INTERNAL);
2841 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kCompileForOnStackReplacement);
2842 }
2843
2844 Label skip;
2845 // If the code object is null, just return to the caller.
2846 __ testq(rax, rax);
2847 __ j(not_equal, &skip, Label::kNear);
2848 __ ret(0);
2849
2850 __ bind(&skip);
2851
2852 // Drop the handler frame that is be sitting on top of the actual
2853 // JavaScript frame. This is the case then OSR is triggered from bytecode.
2854 __ leave();
2855
2856 // Load deoptimization data from the code object.
2857 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(rbx,
2858 FieldOperand(rax, Code::kDeoptimizationDataOffset));
2859
2860 // Load the OSR entrypoint offset from the deoptimization data.
2861 __ SmiUntagField(
2862 rbx, FieldOperand(rbx, FixedArray::OffsetOfElementAt(
2863 DeoptimizationData::kOsrPcOffsetIndex)));
2864
2865 // Compute the target address = code_obj + header_size + osr_offset
2866 __ leaq(rax, FieldOperand(rax, rbx, times_1, Code::kHeaderSize));
2867
2868 // Overwrite the return address on the stack.
2869 __ movq(StackOperandForReturnAddress(0), rax);
2870
2871 // And "return" to the OSR entry point of the function.
2872 __ ret(0);
2873}
2874
2875void Builtins::Generate_WasmCompileLazy(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2876 // The function index was pushed to the stack by the caller as int32.
2877 __ Pop(r11);
2878 // Convert to Smi for the runtime call.
2879 __ SmiTag(r11);
2880 {
2881 HardAbortScope hard_abort(masm); // Avoid calls to Abort.
2882 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::WASM_COMPILE_LAZY);
2883
2884 // Save all parameter registers (see wasm-linkage.cc). They might be
2885 // overwritten in the runtime call below. We don't have any callee-saved
2886 // registers in wasm, so no need to store anything else.
2887 static_assert(WasmCompileLazyFrameConstants::kNumberOfSavedGpParamRegs ==
2888 arraysize(wasm::kGpParamRegisters)(sizeof(ArraySizeHelper(wasm::kGpParamRegisters))),
2889 "frame size mismatch");
2890 for (Register reg : wasm::kGpParamRegisters) {
2891 __ Push(reg);
2892 }
2893 static_assert(WasmCompileLazyFrameConstants::kNumberOfSavedFpParamRegs ==
2894 arraysize(wasm::kFpParamRegisters)(sizeof(ArraySizeHelper(wasm::kFpParamRegisters))),
2895 "frame size mismatch");
2896 __ AllocateStackSpace(kSimd128Size * arraysize(wasm::kFpParamRegisters)(sizeof(ArraySizeHelper(wasm::kFpParamRegisters))));
2897 int offset = 0;
2898 for (DoubleRegister reg : wasm::kFpParamRegisters) {
2899 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, offset), reg);
2900 offset += kSimd128Size;
2901 }
2902
2903 // Push the Wasm instance as an explicit argument to WasmCompileLazy.
2904 __ Push(kWasmInstanceRegister);
2905 // Push the function index as second argument.
2906 __ Push(r11);
2907 // Initialize the JavaScript context with 0. CEntry will use it to
2908 // set the current context on the isolate.
2909 __ Move(kContextRegister, Smi::zero());
2910 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kWasmCompileLazy, 2);
2911 // The entrypoint address is the return value.
2912 __ movq(r11, kReturnRegister0);
2913
2914 // Restore registers.
2915 for (DoubleRegister reg : base::Reversed(wasm::kFpParamRegisters)) {
2916 offset -= kSimd128Size;
2917 __ movdqu(reg, Operand(rsp, offset));
2918 }
2919 DCHECK_EQ(0, offset)((void) 0);
2920 __ addq(rsp, Immediate(kSimd128Size * arraysize(wasm::kFpParamRegisters)(sizeof(ArraySizeHelper(wasm::kFpParamRegisters)))));
2921 for (Register reg : base::Reversed(wasm::kGpParamRegisters)) {
2922 __ Pop(reg);
2923 }
2924 }
2925 // Finally, jump to the entrypoint.
2926 __ jmp(r11);
2927}
2928
2929void Builtins::Generate_WasmDebugBreak(MacroAssembler* masm) {
2930 HardAbortScope hard_abort(masm); // Avoid calls to Abort.
2931 {
2932 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::WASM_DEBUG_BREAK);
2933
2934 // Save all parameter registers. They might hold live values, we restore
2935 // them after the runtime call.
2936 for (int reg_code : base::bits::IterateBitsBackwards(
2937 WasmDebugBreakFrameConstants::kPushedGpRegs)) {
2938 __ Push(Register::from_code(reg_code));
2939 }
2940
2941 constexpr int kFpStackSize =
2942 kSimd128Size * WasmDebugBreakFrameConstants::kNumPushedFpRegisters;
2943 __ AllocateStackSpace(kFpStackSize);
2944 int offset = kFpStackSize;
2945 for (int reg_code : base::bits::IterateBitsBackwards(
2946 WasmDebugBreakFrameConstants::kPushedFpRegs)) {
2947 offset -= kSimd128Size;
2948 __ movdqu(Operand(rsp, offset), DoubleRegister::from_code(reg_code));
2949 }
2950
2951 // Initialize the JavaScript context with 0. CEntry will use it to
2952 // set the current context on the isolate.
2953 __ Move(kContextRegister, Smi::zero());
2954 __ CallRuntime(Runtime::kWasmDebugBreak, 0);
2955
2956 // Restore registers.
2957 for (int reg_code :
2958 base::bits::IterateBits(WasmDebugBreakFrameConstants::kPushedFpRegs)) {
2959 __ movdqu(DoubleRegister::from_code(reg_code), Operand(rsp, offset));
2960 offset += kSimd128Size;
2961 }
2962 __ addq(rsp, Immediate(kFpStackSize));
2963 for (int reg_code :
2964 base::bits::IterateBits(WasmDebugBreakFrameConstants::kPushedGpRegs)) {
2965 __ Pop(Register::from_code(reg_code));
2966 }
2967 }
2968
2969 __ ret(0);
2970}
2971
2972void Builtins::Generate_CEntry(MacroAssembler* masm, int result_size,
2973 SaveFPRegsMode save_doubles, ArgvMode argv_mode,
2974 bool builtin_exit_frame) {
2975 // rax: number of arguments including receiver
2976 // rbx: pointer to C function (C callee-saved)
2977 // rbp: frame pointer of calling JS frame (restored after C call)
2978 // rsp: stack pointer (restored after C call)
2979 // rsi: current context (restored)
2980 //
2981 // If argv_mode == kArgvInRegister:
2982 // r15: pointer to the first argument
2983
2984#ifdef V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
2985 // Windows 64-bit ABI passes arguments in rcx, rdx, r8, r9. It requires the
2986 // stack to be aligned to 16 bytes. It only allows a single-word to be
2987 // returned in register rax. Larger return sizes must be written to an address
2988 // passed as a hidden first argument.
2989 const Register kCCallArg0 = rcx;
2990 const Register kCCallArg1 = rdx;
2991 const Register kCCallArg2 = r8;
2992 const Register kCCallArg3 = r9;
2993 const int kArgExtraStackSpace = 2;
2994 const int kMaxRegisterResultSize = 1;
2995#else
2996 // GCC / Clang passes arguments in rdi, rsi, rdx, rcx, r8, r9. Simple results
2997 // are returned in rax, and a struct of two pointers are returned in rax+rdx.
2998 // Larger return sizes must be written to an address passed as a hidden first
2999 // argument.
3000 const Register kCCallArg0 = rdi;
3001 const Register kCCallArg1 = rsi;
3002 const Register kCCallArg2 = rdx;
3003 const Register kCCallArg3 = rcx;
3004 const int kArgExtraStackSpace = 0;
3005 const int kMaxRegisterResultSize = 2;
3006#endif // V8_TARGET_OS_WIN
3007
3008 // Enter the exit frame that transitions from JavaScript to C++.
3009 int arg_stack_space =
3010 kArgExtraStackSpace +
3011 (result_size <= kMaxRegisterResultSize ? 0 : result_size);
3012 if (argv_mode == kArgvInRegister) {
3013 DCHECK(save_doubles == kDontSaveFPRegs)((void) 0);
3014 DCHECK(!builtin_exit_frame)((void) 0);
3015 __ EnterApiExitFrame(arg_stack_space);
3016 // Move argc into r14 (argv is already in r15).
3017 __ movq(r14, rax);
3018 } else {
3019 __ EnterExitFrame(
3020 arg_stack_space, save_doubles == kSaveFPRegs,
3021 builtin_exit_frame ? StackFrame::BUILTIN_EXIT : StackFrame::EXIT);
3022 }
3023
3024 // rbx: pointer to builtin function (C callee-saved).
3025 // rbp: frame pointer of exit frame (restored after C call).
3026 // rsp: stack pointer (restored after C call).
3027 // r14: number of arguments including receiver (C callee-saved).
3028 // r15: argv pointer (C callee-saved).
3029
3030 // Check stack alignment.
3031 if (FLAG_debug_code) {
3032 __ CheckStackAlignment();
3033 }
3034
3035 // Call C function. The arguments object will be created by stubs declared by
3036 // DECLARE_RUNTIME_FUNCTION().
3037 if (result_size <= kMaxRegisterResultSize) {
3038 // Pass a pointer to the Arguments object as the first argument.
3039 // Return result in single register (rax), or a register pair (rax, rdx).
3040 __ movq(kCCallArg0, r14); // argc.
3041 __ movq(kCCallArg1, r15); // argv.
3042 __ Move(kCCallArg2, ExternalReference::isolate_address(masm->isolate()));
3043 } else {
3044 DCHECK_LE(result_size, 2)((void) 0);
3045 // Pass a pointer to the result location as the first argument.
3046 __ leaq(kCCallArg0, StackSpaceOperand(kArgExtraStackSpace));
3047 // Pass a pointer to the Arguments object as the second argument.
3048 __ movq(kCCallArg1, r14); // argc.
3049 __ movq(kCCallArg2, r15); // argv.
3050 __ Move(kCCallArg3, ExternalReference::isolate_address(masm->isolate()));
3051 }
3052 __ call(rbx);
3053
3054 if (result_size > kMaxRegisterResultSize) {
3055 // Read result values stored on stack. Result is stored
3056 // above the the two Arguments object slots on Win64.
3057 DCHECK_LE(result_size, 2)((void) 0);
3058 __ movq(kReturnRegister0, StackSpaceOperand(kArgExtraStackSpace + 0));
3059 __ movq(kReturnRegister1, StackSpaceOperand(kArgExtraStackSpace + 1));
3060 }
3061 // Result is in rax or rdx:rax - do not destroy these registers!
3062
3063 // Check result for exception sentinel.
3064 Label exception_returned;
3065 __ CompareRoot(rax, RootIndex::kException);
3066 __ j(equal, &exception_returned);
3067
3068 // Check that there is no pending exception, otherwise we
3069 // should have returned the exception sentinel.
3070 if (FLAG_debug_code) {
3071 Label okay;
3072 __ LoadRoot(r14, RootIndex::kTheHoleValue);
3073 ExternalReference pending_exception_address = ExternalReference::Create(
3074 IsolateAddressId::kPendingExceptionAddress, masm->isolate());
3075 Operand pending_exception_operand =
3076 masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(pending_exception_address);
3077 __ cmp_tagged(r14, pending_exception_operand);
3078 __ j(equal, &okay, Label::kNear);
3079 __ int3();
3080 __ bind(&okay);
3081 }
3082
3083 // Exit the JavaScript to C++ exit frame.
3084 __ LeaveExitFrame(save_doubles == kSaveFPRegs, argv_mode == kArgvOnStack);
3085 __ ret(0);
3086
3087 // Handling of exception.
3088 __ bind(&exception_returned);
3089
3090 ExternalReference pending_handler_context_address = ExternalReference::Create(
3091 IsolateAddressId::kPendingHandlerContextAddress, masm->isolate());
3092 ExternalReference pending_handler_entrypoint_address =
3093 ExternalReference::Create(
3094 IsolateAddressId::kPendingHandlerEntrypointAddress, masm->isolate());
3095 ExternalReference pending_handler_fp_address = ExternalReference::Create(
3096 IsolateAddressId::kPendingHandlerFPAddress, masm->isolate());
3097 ExternalReference pending_handler_sp_address = ExternalReference::Create(
3098 IsolateAddressId::kPendingHandlerSPAddress, masm->isolate());
3099
3100 // Ask the runtime for help to determine the handler. This will set rax to
3101 // contain the current pending exception, don't clobber it.
3102 ExternalReference find_handler =
3103 ExternalReference::Create(Runtime::kUnwindAndFindExceptionHandler);
3104 {
3105 FrameScope scope(masm, StackFrame::MANUAL);
3106 __ movq(arg_reg_1, Immediate(0)); // argc.
3107 __ movq(arg_reg_2, Immediate(0)); // argv.
3108 __ Move(arg_reg_3, ExternalReference::isolate_address(masm->isolate()));
3109 __ PrepareCallCFunction(3);
3110 __ CallCFunction(find_handler, 3);
3111 }
3112 // Retrieve the handler context, SP and FP.
3113 __ movq(rsi,
3114 masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(pending_handler_context_address));
3115 __ movq(rsp, masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(pending_handler_sp_address));
3116 __ movq(rbp, masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(pending_handler_fp_address));
3117
3118 // If the handler is a JS frame, restore the context to the frame. Note that
3119 // the context will be set to (rsi == 0) for non-JS frames.
3120 Label skip;
3121 __ testq(rsi, rsi);
3122 __ j(zero, &skip, Label::kNear);
3123 __ movq(Operand(rbp, StandardFrameConstants::kContextOffset), rsi);
3124 __ bind(&skip);
3125
3126 // Reset the masking register. This is done independent of the underlying
3127 // feature flag {FLAG_untrusted_code_mitigations} to make the snapshot work
3128 // with both configurations. It is safe to always do this, because the
3129 // underlying register is caller-saved and can be arbitrarily clobbered.
3130 __ ResetSpeculationPoisonRegister();
3131
3132 // Compute the handler entry address and jump to it.
3133 __ movq(rdi,
3134 masm->ExternalReferenceAsOperand(pending_handler_entrypoint_address));
3135 __ jmp(rdi);
3136}
3137
3138void Builtins::Generate_DoubleToI(MacroAssembler* masm) {
3139 Label check_negative, process_64_bits, done;
3140
3141 // Account for return address and saved regs.
3142 const int kArgumentOffset = 4 * kSystemPointerSize;
3143
3144 MemOperand mantissa_operand(MemOperand(rsp, kArgumentOffset));
3145 MemOperand exponent_operand(
3146 MemOperand(rsp, kArgumentOffset + kDoubleSize / 2));
1
Calling constructor for 'Operand'
→
3147
3148 // The result is returned on the stack.
3149 MemOperand return_operand = mantissa_operand;
3150
3151 Register scratch1 = rbx;
3152
3153 // Since we must use rcx for shifts below, use some other register (rax)
3154 // to calculate the result if ecx is the requested return register.
3155 Register result_reg = rax;
3156 // Save ecx if it isn't the return register and therefore volatile, or if it
3157 // is the return register, then save the temp register we use in its stead
3158 // for the result.
3159 Register save_reg = rax;
3160 __ pushq(rcx);
3161 __ pushq(scratch1);
3162 __ pushq(save_reg);
3163
3164 __ movl(scratch1, mantissa_operand);
3165 __ Movsd(kScratchDoubleReg, mantissa_operand);
3166 __ movl(rcx, exponent_operand);
3167
3168 __ andl(rcx, Immediate(HeapNumber::kExponentMask));
3169 __ shrl(rcx, Immediate(HeapNumber::kExponentShift));
3170 __ leal(result_reg, MemOperand(rcx, -HeapNumber::kExponentBias));
3171 __ cmpl(result_reg, Immediate(HeapNumber::kMantissaBits));
3172 __ j(below, &process_64_bits, Label::kNear);
3173
3174 // Result is entirely in lower 32-bits of mantissa
3175 int delta = HeapNumber::kExponentBias + Double::kPhysicalSignificandSize;
3176 __ subl(rcx, Immediate(delta));
3177 __ xorl(result_reg, result_reg);
3178 __ cmpl(rcx, Immediate(31));
3179 __ j(above, &done, Label::kNear);
3180 __ shll_cl(scratch1);
3181 __ jmp(&check_negative, Label::kNear);
3182
3183 __ bind(&process_64_bits);
3184 __ Cvttsd2siq(result_reg, kScratchDoubleReg);
3185 __ jmp(&done, Label::kNear);
3186
3187 // If the double was negative, negate the integer result.
3188 __ bind(&check_negative);
3189 __ movl(result_reg, scratch1);
3190 __ negl(result_reg);
3191 __ cmpl(exponent_operand, Immediate(0));
3192 __ cmovl(greater, result_reg, scratch1);
3193
3194 // Restore registers
3195 __ bind(&done);
3196 __ movl(return_operand, result_reg);
3197 __ popq(save_reg);
3198 __ popq(scratch1);
3199 __ popq(rcx);
3200 __ ret(0);
3201}
3202
3203void Builtins::Generate_GenericJSToWasmWrapper(MacroAssembler* masm) {
3204 // Set up the stackframe.
3205 __ EnterFrame(StackFrame::JS_TO_WASM);
3206
3207 Register closure = rdi;
3208 Register shared_function_info = rbx;
3209 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(
3210 shared_function_info,
3211 MemOperand(
3212 closure,
3213 wasm::ObjectAccess::SharedFunctionInfoOffsetInTaggedJSFunction()));
3214 closure = no_reg;
3215
3216 Register function_data = shared_function_info;
3217 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(
3218 function_data,
3219 MemOperand(shared_function_info,
3220 SharedFunctionInfo::kFunctionDataOffset - kHeapObjectTag));
3221 shared_function_info = no_reg;
3222
3223 Register wasm_instance = rsi;
3224 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(
3225 wasm_instance,
3226 MemOperand(function_data,
3227 WasmExportedFunctionData::kInstanceOffset - kHeapObjectTag));
3228
3229 // Int signature_type gives the number of int32 params (can be only 0 or 1).
3230 Register signature_type = r9;
3231 __ SmiUntagField(
3232 signature_type,
3233 MemOperand(function_data, WasmExportedFunctionData::kSignatureTypeOffset -
3234 kHeapObjectTag));
3235
3236 __ cmpl(signature_type, Immediate(0));
3237
3238 // In 0 param case jump through parameter handling.
3239 Label params_done;
3240 __ j(equal, &params_done);
3241
3242 // Param handling.
3243 Register param = rax;
3244 const int firstParamOffset = 16;
3245 __ movq(param, MemOperand(rbp, firstParamOffset));
3246
3247 Label not_smi;
3248 __ JumpIfNotSmi(param, &not_smi);
3249
3250 // Change from smi to int32.
3251 __ SmiUntag(param);
3252
3253 __ bind(&params_done);
3254
3255 // Set thread_in_wasm_flag.
3256 Register thread_in_wasm_flag_addr = rdx;
3257 __ movq(
3258 thread_in_wasm_flag_addr,
3259 MemOperand(kRootRegister, Isolate::thread_in_wasm_flag_address_offset()));
3260 __ movl(MemOperand(thread_in_wasm_flag_addr, 0), Immediate(1));
3261
3262 Register jump_table_start = thread_in_wasm_flag_addr;
3263 __ movq(jump_table_start,
3264 MemOperand(wasm_instance,
3265 wasm::ObjectAccess::ToTagged(
3266 WasmInstanceObject::kJumpTableStartOffset)));
3267 thread_in_wasm_flag_addr = no_reg;
3268
3269 Register jump_table_offset = function_data;
3270 __ DecompressTaggedSigned(
3271 jump_table_offset,
3272 MemOperand(
3273 function_data,
3274 WasmExportedFunctionData::kJumpTableOffsetOffset - kHeapObjectTag));
3275
3276 // Change from smi to integer.
3277 __ SmiUntag(jump_table_offset);
3278
3279 Register function_entry = jump_table_offset;
3280 __ addq(function_entry, jump_table_start);
3281 jump_table_offset = no_reg;
3282 jump_table_start = no_reg;
3283
3284 __ pushq(signature_type);
3285
3286 __ call(function_entry);
3287 function_entry = no_reg;
3288
3289 __ popq(signature_type);
3290
3291 // Unset thread_in_wasm_flag.
3292 thread_in_wasm_flag_addr = r8;
3293 __ movq(
3294 thread_in_wasm_flag_addr,
3295 MemOperand(kRootRegister, Isolate::thread_in_wasm_flag_address_offset()));
3296 __ movl(MemOperand(thread_in_wasm_flag_addr, 0), Immediate(0));
3297
3298 Register return_reg = rax;
3299 __ LoadRoot(return_reg, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
3300
3301 // Deconstrunct the stack frame.
3302 __ LeaveFrame(StackFrame::JS_TO_WASM);
3303
3304 __ cmpl(signature_type, Immediate(0));
3305
3306 Label ret_0_param;
3307 __ j(equal, &ret_0_param);
3308
3309 __ ret(16);
3310
3311 __ bind(&ret_0_param);
3312 __ ret(8);
3313
3314 // Handle the conversion to int32 when the param is not a smi.
3315 __ bind(&not_smi);
3316
3317 // The order of pushes is important. We want the heap objects, that should be
3318 // scanned by GC, to be on the top of the stack.
3319 __ pushq(signature_type);
3320 __ pushq(wasm_instance);
3321 __ pushq(function_data);
3322 __ LoadAnyTaggedField(
3323 rsi,
3324 MemOperand(wasm_instance, wasm::ObjectAccess::ToTagged(
3325 WasmInstanceObject::kNativeContextOffset)));
3326 // We had to prepare the parameters for the Call:
3327 // put the value into rax, and the context to rsi.
3328 __ Call(BUILTIN_CODE(masm->isolate(), WasmTaggedNonSmiToInt32)(masm->isolate())->builtins()->builtin_handle(Builtins
::kWasmTaggedNonSmiToInt32),
3329 RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET);
3330
3331 __ popq(function_data);
3332 __ popq(wasm_instance);
3333 __ popq(signature_type);
3334
3335 __ jmp(&params_done);
3336}
3337
3338namespace {
3339
3340int Offset(ExternalReference ref0, ExternalReference ref1) {
3341 int64_t offset = (ref0.address() - ref1.address());
3342 // Check that fits into int.
3343 DCHECK(static_cast<int>(offset) == offset)((void) 0);
3344 return static_cast<int>(offset);
3345}
3346
3347// Calls an API function. Allocates HandleScope, extracts returned value
3348// from handle and propagates exceptions. Clobbers r14, r15, rbx and
3349// caller-save registers. Restores context. On return removes
3350// stack_space * kSystemPointerSize (GCed).
3351void CallApiFunctionAndReturn(MacroAssembler* masm, Register function_address,
3352 ExternalReference thunk_ref,
3353 Register thunk_last_arg, int stack_space,
3354 Operand* stack_space_operand,
3355 Operand return_value_operand) {
3356 Label prologue;
3357 Label promote_scheduled_exception;
3358 Label delete_allocated_handles;
3359 Label leave_exit_frame;
3360
3361 Isolate* isolate = masm->isolate();
3362 Factory* factory = isolate->factory();
3363 ExternalReference next_address =
3364 ExternalReference::handle_scope_next_address(isolate);
3365 const int kNextOffset = 0;
3366 const int kLimitOffset = Offset(
3367 ExternalReference::handle_scope_limit_address(isolate), next_address);
3368 const int kLevelOffset = Offset(
3369 ExternalReference::handle_scope_level_address(isolate), next_address);
3370 ExternalReference scheduled_exception_address =
3371 ExternalReference::scheduled_exception_address(isolate);
3372
3373 DCHECK(rdx == function_address || r8 == function_address)((void) 0);
3374 // Allocate HandleScope in callee-save registers.
3375 Register prev_next_address_reg = r14;
3376 Register prev_limit_reg = rbx;
3377 Register base_reg = r15;
3378 __ Move(base_reg, next_address);
3379 __ movq(prev_next_address_reg, Operand(base_reg, kNextOffset));
3380 __ movq(prev_limit_reg, Operand(base_reg, kLimitOffset));
3381 __ addl(Operand(base_reg, kLevelOffset), Immediate(1));
3382
3383 Label profiler_enabled, end_profiler_check;
3384 __ Move(rax, ExternalReference::is_profiling_address(isolate));
3385 __ cmpb(Operand(rax, 0), Immediate(0));
3386 __ j(not_zero, &profiler_enabled);
3387 __ Move(rax, ExternalReference::address_of_runtime_stats_flag());
3388 __ cmpl(Operand(rax, 0), Immediate(0));
3389 __ j(not_zero, &profiler_enabled);
3390 {
3391 // Call the api function directly.
3392 __ Move(rax, function_address);
3393 __ jmp(&end_profiler_check);
3394 }
3395 __ bind(&profiler_enabled);
3396 {
3397 // Third parameter is the address of the actual getter function.
3398 __ Move(thunk_last_arg, function_address);
3399 __ Move(rax, thunk_ref);
3400 }
3401 __ bind(&end_profiler_check);
3402
3403 // Call the api function!
3404 __ call(rax);
3405
3406 // Load the value from ReturnValue
3407 __ movq(rax, return_value_operand);
3408 __ bind(&prologue);
3409
3410 // No more valid handles (the result handle was the last one). Restore
3411 // previous handle scope.
3412 __ subl(Operand(base_reg, kLevelOffset), Immediate(1));
3413 __ movq(Operand(base_reg, kNextOffset), prev_next_address_reg);
3414 __ cmpq(prev_limit_reg, Operand(base_reg, kLimitOffset));
3415 __ j(not_equal, &delete_allocated_handles);
3416
3417 // Leave the API exit frame.
3418 __ bind(&leave_exit_frame);
3419 if (stack_space_operand != nullptr) {
3420 DCHECK_EQ(stack_space, 0)((void) 0);
3421 __ movq(rbx, *stack_space_operand);
3422 }
3423 __ LeaveApiExitFrame();
3424
3425 // Check if the function scheduled an exception.
3426 __ Move(rdi, scheduled_exception_address);
3427 __ Cmp(Operand(rdi, 0), factory->the_hole_value());
3428 __ j(not_equal, &promote_scheduled_exception);
3429
3430#if DEBUG
3431 // Check if the function returned a valid JavaScript value.
3432 Label ok;
3433 Register return_value = rax;
3434 Register map = rcx;
3435
3436 __ JumpIfSmi(return_value, &ok, Label::kNear);
3437 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(map,
3438 FieldOperand(return_value, HeapObject::kMapOffset));
3439
3440 __ CmpInstanceType(map, LAST_NAME_TYPE);
3441 __ j(below_equal, &ok, Label::kNear);
3442
3443 __ CmpInstanceType(map, FIRST_JS_RECEIVER_TYPE);
3444 __ j(above_equal, &ok, Label::kNear);
3445
3446 __ CompareRoot(map, RootIndex::kHeapNumberMap);
3447 __ j(equal, &ok, Label::kNear);
3448
3449 __ CompareRoot(map, RootIndex::kBigIntMap);
3450 __ j(equal, &ok, Label::kNear);
3451
3452 __ CompareRoot(return_value, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
3453 __ j(equal, &ok, Label::kNear);
3454
3455 __ CompareRoot(return_value, RootIndex::kTrueValue);
3456 __ j(equal, &ok, Label::kNear);
3457
3458 __ CompareRoot(return_value, RootIndex::kFalseValue);
3459 __ j(equal, &ok, Label::kNear);
3460
3461 __ CompareRoot(return_value, RootIndex::kNullValue);
3462 __ j(equal, &ok, Label::kNear);
3463
3464 __ Abort(AbortReason::kAPICallReturnedInvalidObject);
3465
3466 __ bind(&ok);
3467#endif
3468
3469 if (stack_space_operand == nullptr) {
3470 DCHECK_NE(stack_space, 0)((void) 0);
3471 __ ret(stack_space * kSystemPointerSize);
3472 } else {
3473 DCHECK_EQ(stack_space, 0)((void) 0);
3474 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rcx);
3475 __ addq(rsp, rbx);
3476 __ jmp(rcx);
3477 }
3478
3479 // Re-throw by promoting a scheduled exception.
3480 __ bind(&promote_scheduled_exception);
3481 __ TailCallRuntime(Runtime::kPromoteScheduledException);
3482
3483 // HandleScope limit has changed. Delete allocated extensions.
3484 __ bind(&delete_allocated_handles);
3485 __ movq(Operand(base_reg, kLimitOffset), prev_limit_reg);
3486 __ movq(prev_limit_reg, rax);
3487 __ LoadAddress(arg_reg_1, ExternalReference::isolate_address(isolate));
3488 __ LoadAddress(rax, ExternalReference::delete_handle_scope_extensions());
3489 __ call(rax);
3490 __ movq(rax, prev_limit_reg);
3491 __ jmp(&leave_exit_frame);
3492}
3493
3494} // namespace
3495
3496// TODO(jgruber): Instead of explicitly setting up implicit_args_ on the stack
3497// in CallApiCallback, we could use the calling convention to set up the stack
3498// correctly in the first place.
3499//
3500// TODO(jgruber): I suspect that most of CallApiCallback could be implemented
3501// as a C++ trampoline, vastly simplifying the assembly implementation.
3502
3503void Builtins::Generate_CallApiCallback(MacroAssembler* masm) {
3504 // ----------- S t a t e -------------
3505 // -- rsi : context
3506 // -- rdx : api function address
3507 // -- rcx : arguments count (not including the receiver)
3508 // -- rbx : call data
3509 // -- rdi : holder
3510 // -- rsp[0] : return address
3511 // -- rsp[8] : argument argc
3512 // -- ...
3513 // -- rsp[argc * 8] : argument 1
3514 // -- rsp[(argc + 1) * 8] : argument 0 (receiver)
3515 // -----------------------------------
3516 // NOTE: The order of args are reversed if V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
3517
3518 Register api_function_address = rdx;
3519 Register argc = rcx;
3520 Register call_data = rbx;
3521 Register holder = rdi;
3522
3523 DCHECK(!AreAliased(api_function_address, argc, holder, call_data,((void) 0)
3524 kScratchRegister))((void) 0);
3525
3526 using FCA = FunctionCallbackArguments;
3527
3528 STATIC_ASSERT(FCA::kArgsLength == 6)static_assert(FCA::kArgsLength == 6, "FCA::kArgsLength == 6");
3529 STATIC_ASSERT(FCA::kNewTargetIndex == 5)static_assert(FCA::kNewTargetIndex == 5, "FCA::kNewTargetIndex == 5"
);
3530 STATIC_ASSERT(FCA::kDataIndex == 4)static_assert(FCA::kDataIndex == 4, "FCA::kDataIndex == 4");
3531 STATIC_ASSERT(FCA::kReturnValueOffset == 3)static_assert(FCA::kReturnValueOffset == 3, "FCA::kReturnValueOffset == 3"
);
3532 STATIC_ASSERT(FCA::kReturnValueDefaultValueIndex == 2)static_assert(FCA::kReturnValueDefaultValueIndex == 2, "FCA::kReturnValueDefaultValueIndex == 2"
);
3533 STATIC_ASSERT(FCA::kIsolateIndex == 1)static_assert(FCA::kIsolateIndex == 1, "FCA::kIsolateIndex == 1"
);
3534 STATIC_ASSERT(FCA::kHolderIndex == 0)static_assert(FCA::kHolderIndex == 0, "FCA::kHolderIndex == 0"
);
3535
3536 // Set up FunctionCallbackInfo's implicit_args on the stack as follows:
3537 //
3538 // Current state:
3539 // rsp[0]: return address
3540 //
3541 // Target state:
3542 // rsp[0 * kSystemPointerSize]: return address
3543 // rsp[1 * kSystemPointerSize]: kHolder
3544 // rsp[2 * kSystemPointerSize]: kIsolate
3545 // rsp[3 * kSystemPointerSize]: undefined (kReturnValueDefaultValue)
3546 // rsp[4 * kSystemPointerSize]: undefined (kReturnValue)
3547 // rsp[5 * kSystemPointerSize]: kData
3548 // rsp[6 * kSystemPointerSize]: undefined (kNewTarget)
3549
3550 __ PopReturnAddressTo(rax);
3551 __ LoadRoot(kScratchRegister, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
3552 __ Push(kScratchRegister);
3553 __ Push(call_data);
3554 __ Push(kScratchRegister);
3555 __ Push(kScratchRegister);
3556 __ PushAddress(ExternalReference::isolate_address(masm->isolate()));
3557 __ Push(holder);
3558 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(rax);
3559
3560 // Keep a pointer to kHolder (= implicit_args) in a scratch register.
3561 // We use it below to set up the FunctionCallbackInfo object.
3562 Register scratch = rbx;
3563 __ leaq(scratch, Operand(rsp, 1 * kSystemPointerSize));
3564
3565 // Allocate the v8::Arguments structure in the arguments' space since
3566 // it's not controlled by GC.
3567 static constexpr int kApiStackSpace = 4;
3568 __ EnterApiExitFrame(kApiStackSpace);
3569
3570 // FunctionCallbackInfo::implicit_args_ (points at kHolder as set up above).
3571 __ movq(StackSpaceOperand(0), scratch);
3572
3573 // FunctionCallbackInfo::values_ (points at the first varargs argument passed
3574 // on the stack).
3575#ifdef V8_REVERSE_JSARGS
3576 __ leaq(scratch,
3577 Operand(scratch, (FCA::kArgsLength + 1) * kSystemPointerSize));
3578#else
3579 __ leaq(scratch, Operand(scratch, argc, times_system_pointer_size,
3580 (FCA::kArgsLength - 1) * kSystemPointerSize));
3581#endif
3582 __ movq(StackSpaceOperand(1), scratch);
3583
3584 // FunctionCallbackInfo::length_.
3585 __ movq(StackSpaceOperand(2), argc);
3586
3587 // We also store the number of bytes to drop from the stack after returning
3588 // from the API function here.
3589 __ leaq(kScratchRegister,
3590 Operand(argc, times_system_pointer_size,
3591 (FCA::kArgsLength + 1 /* receiver */) * kSystemPointerSize));
3592 __ movq(StackSpaceOperand(3), kScratchRegister);
3593
3594 Register arguments_arg = arg_reg_1;
3595 Register callback_arg = arg_reg_2;
3596
3597 // It's okay if api_function_address == callback_arg
3598 // but not arguments_arg
3599 DCHECK(api_function_address != arguments_arg)((void) 0);
3600
3601 // v8::InvocationCallback's argument.
3602 __ leaq(arguments_arg, StackSpaceOperand(0));
3603
3604 ExternalReference thunk_ref = ExternalReference::invoke_function_callback();
3605
3606 // There are two stack slots above the arguments we constructed on the stack:
3607 // the stored ebp (pushed by EnterApiExitFrame), and the return address.
3608 static constexpr int kStackSlotsAboveFCA = 2;
3609 Operand return_value_operand(
3610 rbp,
3611 (kStackSlotsAboveFCA + FCA::kReturnValueOffset) * kSystemPointerSize);
3612
3613 static constexpr int kUseStackSpaceOperand = 0;
3614 Operand stack_space_operand = StackSpaceOperand(3);
3615 CallApiFunctionAndReturn(masm, api_function_address, thunk_ref, callback_arg,
3616 kUseStackSpaceOperand, &stack_space_operand,
3617 return_value_operand);
3618}
3619
3620void Builtins::Generate_CallApiGetter(MacroAssembler* masm) {
3621 Register name_arg = arg_reg_1;
3622 Register accessor_info_arg = arg_reg_2;
3623 Register getter_arg = arg_reg_3;
3624 Register api_function_address = r8;
3625 Register receiver = ApiGetterDescriptor::ReceiverRegister();
3626 Register holder = ApiGetterDescriptor::HolderRegister();
3627 Register callback = ApiGetterDescriptor::CallbackRegister();
3628 Register scratch = rax;
3629 Register decompr_scratch1 = COMPRESS_POINTERS_BOOLfalse ? r11 : no_reg;
3630
3631 DCHECK(!AreAliased(receiver, holder, callback, scratch, decompr_scratch1))((void) 0);
3632
3633 // Build v8::PropertyCallbackInfo::args_ array on the stack and push property
3634 // name below the exit frame to make GC aware of them.
3635 STATIC_ASSERT(PropertyCallbackArguments::kShouldThrowOnErrorIndex == 0)static_assert(PropertyCallbackArguments::kShouldThrowOnErrorIndex
== 0, "PropertyCallbackArguments::kShouldThrowOnErrorIndex == 0"
);
3636 STATIC_ASSERT(PropertyCallbackArguments::kHolderIndex == 1)static_assert(PropertyCallbackArguments::kHolderIndex == 1, "PropertyCallbackArguments::kHolderIndex == 1"
);
3637 STATIC_ASSERT(PropertyCallbackArguments::kIsolateIndex == 2)static_assert(PropertyCallbackArguments::kIsolateIndex == 2, "PropertyCallbackArguments::kIsolateIndex == 2"
);
3638 STATIC_ASSERT(PropertyCallbackArguments::kReturnValueDefaultValueIndex == 3)static_assert(PropertyCallbackArguments::kReturnValueDefaultValueIndex
== 3, "PropertyCallbackArguments::kReturnValueDefaultValueIndex == 3"
);
3639 STATIC_ASSERT(PropertyCallbackArguments::kReturnValueOffset == 4)static_assert(PropertyCallbackArguments::kReturnValueOffset ==
4, "PropertyCallbackArguments::kReturnValueOffset == 4");
3640 STATIC_ASSERT(PropertyCallbackArguments::kDataIndex == 5)static_assert(PropertyCallbackArguments::kDataIndex == 5, "PropertyCallbackArguments::kDataIndex == 5"
);
3641 STATIC_ASSERT(PropertyCallbackArguments::kThisIndex == 6)static_assert(PropertyCallbackArguments::kThisIndex == 6, "PropertyCallbackArguments::kThisIndex == 6"
);
3642 STATIC_ASSERT(PropertyCallbackArguments::kArgsLength == 7)static_assert(PropertyCallbackArguments::kArgsLength == 7, "PropertyCallbackArguments::kArgsLength == 7"
);
3643
3644 // Insert additional parameters into the stack frame above return address.
3645 __ PopReturnAddressTo(scratch);
3646 __ Push(receiver);
3647 __ PushTaggedAnyField(FieldOperand(callback, AccessorInfo::kDataOffset),
3648 decompr_scratch1);
3649 __ LoadRoot(kScratchRegister, RootIndex::kUndefinedValue);
3650 __ Push(kScratchRegister); // return value
3651 __ Push(kScratchRegister); // return value default
3652 __ PushAddress(ExternalReference::isolate_address(masm->isolate()));
3653 __ Push(holder);
3654 __ Push(Smi::zero()); // should_throw_on_error -> false
3655 __ PushTaggedPointerField(FieldOperand(callback, AccessorInfo::kNameOffset),
3656 decompr_scratch1);
3657 __ PushReturnAddressFrom(scratch);
3658
3659 // v8::PropertyCallbackInfo::args_ array and name handle.
3660 const int kStackUnwindSpace = PropertyCallbackArguments::kArgsLength + 1;
3661
3662 // Allocate v8::PropertyCallbackInfo in non-GCed stack space.
3663 const int kArgStackSpace = 1;
3664
3665 // Load address of v8::PropertyAccessorInfo::args_ array.
3666 __ leaq(scratch, Operand(rsp, 2 * kSystemPointerSize));
3667
3668 __ EnterApiExitFrame(kArgStackSpace);
3669
3670 // Create v8::PropertyCallbackInfo object on the stack and initialize
3671 // it's args_ field.
3672 Operand info_object = StackSpaceOperand(0);
3673 __ movq(info_object, scratch);
3674
3675 __ leaq(name_arg, Operand(scratch, -kSystemPointerSize));
3676 // The context register (rsi) has been saved in EnterApiExitFrame and
3677 // could be used to pass arguments.
3678 __ leaq(accessor_info_arg, info_object);
3679
3680 ExternalReference thunk_ref =
3681 ExternalReference::invoke_accessor_getter_callback();
3682
3683 // It's okay if api_function_address == getter_arg
3684 // but not accessor_info_arg or name_arg
3685 DCHECK(api_function_address != accessor_info_arg)((void) 0);
3686 DCHECK(api_function_address != name_arg)((void) 0);
3687 __ LoadTaggedPointerField(
3688 scratch, FieldOperand(callback, AccessorInfo::kJsGetterOffset));
3689 __ LoadExternalPointerField(
3690 api_function_address,
3691 FieldOperand(scratch, Foreign::kForeignAddressOffset));
3692
3693 // +3 is to skip prolog, return address and name handle.
3694 Operand return_value_operand(
3695 rbp,
3696 (PropertyCallbackArguments::kReturnValueOffset + 3) * kSystemPointerSize);
3697 Operand* const kUseStackSpaceConstant = nullptr;
3698 CallApiFunctionAndReturn(masm, api_function_address, thunk_ref, getter_arg,
3699 kStackUnwindSpace, kUseStackSpaceConstant,
3700 return_value_operand);
3701}
3702
3703void Builtins::Generate_DirectCEntry(MacroAssembler* masm) {
3704 __ int3(); // Unused on this architecture.
3705}
3706
3707#undef __
3708
3709} // namespace internal
3710} // namespace v8
3711
3712#endif // V8_TARGET_ARCH_X64
